Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: TMS08
Reviews.Content: Was able to secure a great rate for two nights, through Orbitz at this property. Stayed at the Avia Hotel during my previous 2 stays in Napa. While not in walking distance to the wineries, River Terrace is a short drive away from the Silverado Trail and Highway 29. It is a garden style property with only 3 floors. The lobby and the hallways seems a bit dated but I was pleasantly surprised by the rooms. The rooms were contemporary, clean, and had a great walk-in shower. Rooms also included a refrigerator which is nice if you are staying a few days and want to pick up food/snacks. Parking is complimentary which is a nice amenity. I would definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: vanMontreal
Reviews.Content: We were married in the beautiful Napa Valley and stayed at the River Terrace Inn. Unfortunately, the continental breakfast is no longer available but the food was still very good. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly. Every morning there is coffee/tea available in the lobby for the guests. I would definitely stay at this hotel next time we are in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “A great place and a great value”
Reviews.Author: 1mermaid11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Terrace Inn and was able to get a fantastic rate. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. They have a great outdoor space and are on a walking trail right by the river. It is not near any wineries but I thought it was a convenient location. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Napa”
Reviews.Author: Gbmars
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at great price for the area. Right next door to the Westin ( which was much more money). Walking distance to downtown Napa, close to oxbow market. Rooms were large with nice terrace. Hotel was quiet, staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MeitalF
Reviews.Content: Traveling to napa is hard to choose where to stay with all the options, but we made a great choice with the terrace inn- through their promotion on line we stayed 3 nights for the price of 2 and reserved the great balcony with jacuzzi room for a great rate ( would not afford the regular rate for this room). The bed was amazing , huge king and our baby slept with us. The room is very nice and decorated tastefully and is spaces, the balcony facing the river is nice and the 2 head shower is real treat! A few comments - 1. they had no concierge service at our visit even though they had a concierge desk, we arrived late and wanted some direction from the front desk but they did not seem to know what to suggest wich is strange to me for a hotel located in napa, 2. the terrace cafe has closed but online it showed as open, 3. although it's nice to put wine in the room their was no prices on them or menu in room- so we didn't chance it. The room was awsome and that made our stay unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Added cost, but no added value”
Reviews.Author: D J
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the River Terrace Inn in Napa, CA during April, 2012 (my second stay in the last two years), and while the room was comfortable, I was disappointed to see the continental breakfast is no longer offered. I was even more disappointed to see that rates have increased substantially. My first night’s rate increased $70 and my second night’s rate increased by $119 over my last stay. I didn't see the value in the added cost. I am not planning to stay at the River Terrace Inn in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa so we didn't know which hotel to choose. We pre-paid the River Terrace Inn which made the price reasonable (four nights for the price of three). For meals, including breakfast, you have to walk across the spacious parking lot to the Cuvee which is a tad pricey. We had a corner room with small balcony overlooking the river which was very pleasant. Beds are very comfortable and bathrooms are spacious, very accommodating. There is a fridge for your use as well as a minibar. We couldn't find a price list for the minibar or the wines atop the serving shelf. Staff was friendly when approached but slightly standoffish. It's a great location away from the bustle of the downtown district and easy walk there as well as to the Oxbow Market which is worth the walk. Breakfast actually was better at the Model Bakery, next to the Oxbow and cheaper than the Cuvee.

Reviews.Title: “Great buy, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ikimashyo
Reviews.Content: I go to Napa often, and usually stay at the more expensive Avia Hotel - I now prefer the more affordable River Terrace Inn. There is copious parking right out front, and the rooms are big, stylish, and comfortable. It's not smack in the middle of town, but it's an easy walk - for me, being able to park was worth the trade-off. I paid a little more for a river room and would recommend the expense - while the terraces are cramped, you can leave your door open, hear the birds and smell the eucalyptus. One small criticism of the Inn - while I was there the bar was understaffed, and the bartender had to do double-duty fetching food from the restaurant next door. Also, while I was there in the off-season, I would take care if I booked a room in the warmer months to NOT have a room over the patio which also faces the river. That said, it's a really nice place to bring some take-out and have a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dandyd2
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at the River Terrace Inn. Rooms are very well apponted and bed is very comfortable. Large bathroom and a nice "fridge" for your use. Short walk to downtown Napa.............do not miss! Many fine places to eat and explore. Oxbow Market is a gem.........do not miss the oyster bar inside along with the cheese shop. Next door is the Fatted Pig.......great place for picnic meats and next to it is the Model Bakery.......bread is fantastic! However, do not wait too long to go in and purchase you picnic breads.........they sell out early.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: mcintrav
Reviews.Content: Two couples stayed at River Terrance Inn. Rooms were spacious, well-decorated and bath included a jacuzzi tub. Staff was attentive and helpful with sightseeing. You could walk to a Walmart. There was easy access to a number of wineries, the Oxbow Public Market where we ate lunch and the Wine Train. We had bid on the rooms at a charity auction so really don't know what they cost normally.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jonell G
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet hotel. Very relaxing. The bed and pillows were so comfortable that we took pictures of the mattress and pillows to get them at home. The only downside was there is no room service and the "hotel restaurant" is off site and a little high end for our taste. The wine was great and Henry had pleasant conversation. It was within walking distance to the oxbow market and downtown so we didn't have to drive a lot once we were there, which made wine tastings more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travel4sully
Reviews.Content: Blocks from downtown and the oxbow district...this place was great especially for the value. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie G
Reviews.Content: River Terrace Inn was a great hotel in a great location. The room was comfortable and the hotel was affordable. Would recommend to anyone heading to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Great and affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jabberly21
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous trip advisor reviews, my husband and I decided to spend our vacation to the wine country at the River Terrace Inn. We knew we wouldn't be spending too much time at the hotel since it was our first time to the Napa area, so we chose something that was affordable and had good reviews. Overall, we had a great experience. It rained the entire trip but the hotel staff had umbrellas at the bellhop stand that we could use when needed. The staff was friendly but they didn't go out of their way to be helpful. On entering the property for the first time, it was pouring outside and I was struggling to get our 3 bags in the door while my husband parked our car. The girl at the front desk either pretended not to see me or actually didn't see me struggle, but was friendly once I got the bags in and approached her. I had to ask for a bellhop to help me take the bags up to the room. Not that I couldn't do this myself, but it was odd to me that since I was the only guest in the lobby at the time, that no one offered their assistance. The same thing happened at check out - no one offered to assist us with our luggage. However, this is my ONLY complaint about the hotel and it really didn't affect our stay at all. We used the gym once, it was small but not crowded at all (one treadmill, 2 bikes, one elliptical and some free weights). The pool looked nice but with all the rain, we didn't get to use it. It looked like there were walking trails around the property too but we never checked it out. The room was clean, shower was HUGE, and it had great amenities. Due to reading some reviews on trip advisor, we thought that there was a buffet breakfast, but that must have changed recently because the only breakfast was next door in their restaurant, which was pretty good! I asked the girl at the front desk about upgrading to a "breakfast" package (I read to do this on trip advisor) but she said since we purchased through orbitz she couldn't add anything to our pre paid rate. We just paid full price for breakfast which wasn't expensive, and it got us to get out and try other breakfast spots which was nice (I highly recommend "the general store" in downtown Napa). The concierge helped us make dinner reservations one night, and she was very knowledgeable and helpful. To summarize, the hotel is comfortable, clean and affordable but the hotel staff could have made it just a little better by going the extra mile for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: TAMMY R
Reviews.Content: I loved the room ! It was big, and very stylish, bed was comfy and the bathroom was huge. I like how they have an extra fridge that is empty in addition to the one with snacks (that I never use). Front desk was very friendly and helpful. Overall, I was very impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: LenCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very pleasing to the eye. Great location.They have tables and a fireplace out back for guests. The rooms are very nice. Nice large bathroom and bed was very comfortable. Would recommend this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location is FANTASTIC - can walk to downtown Napa and the Oxbow market. Plentiful parking, friendly staff, great rooms (ours had a nice outdoor terrace which is always a great perk). Small gym, but you're in Napa, so you're not spending much time worrying about "working out" (that being said, I did get in a morning run and that was nice). Most important, we got a great rate a week prior. I've stayed at the Westin next door and while it's a really great hotel, it's nearly double the price (or at least the price we paid) and since we spend most of our time away from the hotel, it doesn't make sense to pay that much extra.

Reviews.Title: “All the amenities you need!”
Reviews.Author: Larry W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn on February 24th-27th for her birthday trip to Napa. When staying at other hotels, one of my pet peeves is not having a large enough bathroom for the both of us as we're either trying to get ready to start the day sightseeing or getting dressed up for a night out on the town. The sinks & counters are never wide enough for me to shave and for her to do her makeup at the same time. At the River Terrace Inn, our River Side King room had a sitting area with a large lighted mirror and extendable magnifying mirror for my wife to do her makeup while I got to use the sink to shave. This may seem a minor perk, but we try to take advantage of every minute while on vacation so this added benefit certainly helped. Along with the large bathroom, came a small mini fridge where could store our soft drinks,assorted cheeses, and leftover meals from their awesome restaurant, Cuvee. We were pleased with the selections of wine available for purchase too. We popped open a bottle of Franciscan and were surprised to find they only charged a very small dollar amount on the bottle compared to what we noramlly pay for it at the store. Nice to see they don't gouge their guests like some hotels do for in-room amenities. We used the elegant robes provided free of charge, the internet free of charge, the coffeemaker, the iron, the stylish & easy to use alarm clock, huge lineup of HD cable channels, the walking trail behind the hotel that runs along the Napa River, the bar, the free coffee in the morning, the free USA today newspaper, and lastly the free access to the gym. Had it been warm enough to use the pool, well.... Our ground room floor had a small balcony with 2 chairs and a table with a fantastic view of the river. The rooms are well built with solid walls and ceilings buffering out any outside noises. The beds were comfortable ( I used the pull out queen sleeper sofa one night ) and the climate in the room was always perfect. Their signature restaurant, Cuvee serves amazing food with personalized service. It is a small establishment and getting a table will require some advanced planning on your part. They do take reservations so take advantage of it. I used my Open Table phone app to make reservations that morning for 7:00PM and was able to get in. When we arrived, there was a couple in front of us who had just walked in and were informed they were completely booked for the night. I originally had reservations at another boutique hotel around the corner (Best Western's Elm House Inn) but about a month before our trip I wanted to see if there were any better deals out there and came across the River Terrace Inn. After doing a comparison, I ended up saving over $147 for our 3 night stay. I would definitley recommend this hotel to those reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - good location”
Reviews.Author: AzoreanChild
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the River Terrace Inn last weekend. We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The king size bed was very comfortable. It was a very quiet hotel. The hotel is perfectly located to visit either the Napa or Sonoma Valleys. We had breakfast one morning at the resturant, Cuvee. It was very good. It is a good value for the price for Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: Silverio33
Reviews.Content: this hotel is on a great location, the rooms are very nice, clean and confortable, the bathroom has only a shower but is big enough with double shower heads and very clean.. we had a room with balcony wich is actually big enough to sit down and enjoy the views. this hotel is next to the Westin versa napa wich has the michelin star restaurant La toque.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: JakCv
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the center of Napa. Nice garden and nice building. Has a restaurant which also looks very good, although we have not had time to try it. Altogether, a very good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Chrisbee59
Reviews.Content: I had researched a lot of Napa hotels prior to our vaca and picked River Terrace Inn. We are really glad we did. First of all, location is excellent. We walked to downtown Napa everyday and to the Oxbow market. Also there is a walking trail across the bridge that we really enjoyed. The rooms are beautiful! We were upgraded to a king with river veiw and loved it. I had read a review that the river "wasn't much" so don't spend the money for river view but we really enjoyed sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine looking at the peaceful river. The hotel staff especially the concierge (sorry, can't remember her name) were always pleasant and helpful. We spent 5 days at River Terrace and loved it. The rooms are very nice, clean and beautifully furnished. The bathrooms are great with very nice amenities. The room also had bottles of wine that you could buy, a mini fridge and wine glasses. The hotel lobby is also very nice with a fireplace, seating area and great bar. We will definetly stay here if we ever get back to Napa. I would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a mini-vacation to Napa Valley. Not knowing the area, we didn't know what to expect. First receptionist we spoke to could have been friendlier. Other than that, we were pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was. Our room was very cozy, clean, and had a very comfortable bed. Our regret was that we only stayed one night. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hiltonmissionbay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a chance to get away to Napa with some friends and stayed here. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. It’s close to everything and just a short drive from the wineries. The room was very clean and had an amazing view of the river that runs behind it. The free standing restaurant “Cuvee” had an amazing menu, great lounge and the staff was just as friendly and accommodating as the hotel. My wife and I can’t wait to return again…

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connoisseur22
Reviews.Content: The rooms are gorgeous, especially the bathrooms! A nice neighborhood in Napa and just a very clean, comfortable place to lay your head while visiting wine country. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gregg t
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife with a trip to Napa for her birthday. After extensive research reading reviews on this site. I decided to book the River Terrace Inn. One of the best trips we have taken. The hotel is in a PRIME location. Walking distance to the oxbow market (cool place). The wine train is also walking distance. Only 5 minutes. Downtown Napa is also walking distance maybe 10 minutes. Or a $4 cab ride. We also walked to the outlets to spend some Birthday gift cards 20 minutes. Being from NY and used to walking in NYC these are not too far. I had set up some tours with Jeanie the concierge and she emailed me the itinerary that day. She was great. She was very attentive to us to make sure we were enjoying our stay. When we arrived a little early our room was ready and there were chocolate covered strawberries in the room waiting for as a birthday treat. I cannot say enough about he bed!! So comfortable!! The jetted tub was huge and the dual shower head was really nice. It rained while we were there so we did not get to enjoy the outdoor fire pits. The restaurant Cuvee thefood was amazing. The staff was great. everything about this hotel was Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alicia B
Reviews.Content: We came to Napa to do some wine tasting and really enjoyed this hotel. The river runs along the back and although they could not give us a view room ( The hotel was completely booked ) we really liked the amenities. There is a nice pool and courtyard area with heaters when it gets chilly. There is a bar in the rear of the lobby area with great drinks and wine tasting. It is very close to amenities if you want to pick something up at the store. The hotel is not very kid friendly so if you have children it may not be the best spot.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: DeeLee11
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our New Year’s Eve stay at the River Terrace Inn. When I booked the reservation, I requested an upper floor, quiet room. Though I realize that hotels can never guarantee your room preferences, it was like they had made no attempt to fulfill my original room preference as they gave us the worst possible room. We ended up in a ground level, noisy room. It was extremely noisy mainly due to the building’s plumbing system that ran constantly within the walls. We were unable to sleep soundly the entire night. We were so disappointed that the hotel did such a poor job in assigning a better room for us. However, despite our unfortunate experience, I must commend Jeff Whitehead, General Manager, who was quick to follow up with a response to a letter that I sent shortly after our stay. He was very understanding of our situation and made no excuses for his staff’s handling of our room assignment. He was promptly able to compensate us to our satisfaction. His customer service helped to lessen the bad experience. Although we will never return to the River Terrace Inn, at least we feel better that they were willing to make good on their oversight without making excuses and we hope that they use our experience as a tool to improve their service for future guests. Overall, the hotel and its surroundings were nice, but our unpleasant experience with the room overshadowed our enjoyment of any other of the hotel’s amenities and far outweighs any other reason to come back.

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: MTCard
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel and in general, I find this hotel to have beautiful rooms, a polite staff, good location, and a decent price tag. However, on my most recent stay I was disappointed to find that this hotel no longer included a complimentary continental breakfast with each stay. I was further disappointed by the manner, in which, the staff responded when my wife and I asked about the breakfast. The staff responded with indecipherable grumbling, no eye contact, and shoved a vague letter into our faces advertising the meals offered at a nearby restaurant. We asked a number of the employees and none of them gave us a straight answer whether a complimentary breakfast was still offered and they took no responsibility for this recent decision to cut amenities to increase their own profit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: LBToni
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay for a long weekend in Napa. Room was clean and comfortable, staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: skidabump
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the River Terrace Inn (12/30-1/2/12), the staff was very friendly and answered any questions we had. The room was nice and modern and worked out perfectly for a few nights, the hotel was full but still quiet. We took advantage of the breakfast prior to starting our wine tour and it was very good. (Eggs, Sausage, Bacon, Potatoes, French toast, fruit, ceral...) A+ to Dave with Platypus tours for a great afternoon. The thing we liked best about this hotel was the location, its a very short walk to the Oxbow Market. Although we didn't visit Oxbow Markt we walked by it many times as we walked into Downtown Napa District which is a 10 minute walk, perfect to walk off a nice dinner or a few glasses of wine from the tasting rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to visit Napa and not go "Over the Top". Thanks again RIver Terrace Inn and we look forward to visiting with you in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatation”
Reviews.Author: summertosun
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The location is awesome and in walking distance to the Oxbow market. The breakfast was amazing and the waitstaff in the bar area were helpful and friendly. The room we stayed in was roomy, had a very comfortable bed and a pretty river view. The downside was there was shaving stubble in our sink...gross! and crumbs all beside the mini fridge in the room. The front desk staff seemed stressed out and not very welcoming. I think this hotel has potential to be awesome with some minor tweaks. Oh yeah....watch your bill. We had already paid with American Airlines points and were charged 544.00 on our credit card last week.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: everett_rainier
Reviews.Content: Hotel would be a great base for a few days in Napa. I stayed only one night, but the room was fantastic. Big bathroom, big room, comfortable bed. There was a party going on across the hall (noticed as we were heading in for the night), but we couldn't hear it. Check in and out was painless.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: Ken D
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and beautiful. Double headed shower with full length glass doors. Lot's of quality tile and stone. Great service and help with where to visit. Close parking. Small but high end at a great price. Minutes from hundreds of wineries. Local main street has plenty of eating to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolfpackfans
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location is very central to downtown Napa and easy to get to the wineries and surrounding areas (Yountville, etc.). The rooms are large, and the bathoom was very nice. The double-head shower was a nice touch, and the rooms also have robes and coffee makers. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Darlene L
Reviews.Content: For the overall hotel - this is a great place to stay. Friendly staff, spacious and nice rooms, large bathroom, some rooms have balconies, pretty much noise free - I heard very little noise fom the neighboring rooms! I heard in the a.m. a few footsteps upstais (on the weekend) and commented to a friend who came to visit from out of town. My breakfast wasn't included and thought it was a tad over priced for a patron staying there. It was okay, but felt it could be better, or definitely a lower price. Would I stay there again? Yes - my only downfall was the breakfast. I'd go elsewhere. Walking distance to restaurants - about 3-4 blocks. I'd give this a thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent restaurant, good location”
Reviews.Author: realflash
Reviews.Content: Visited with wife and baby son. It's in a good location for the Napa Valley Wine Train, and is also on the river bank. Check in on Foursquare to the hotel and the restaurant (Cuvee) for free drinks. We asked to upgrade and were easily accommodated at a discounted rate. Room was well decorated, bed very soft and comfortable, something I rarely find these days. Friendly bar down stairs with outside seating. Restaurant in the car park is outstanding value - the best food we've had in ages. Staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Okeh1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn over 2011 Thanksgiving hoilday for 3 nights, I had done some research and read the website description well and some reviews.Our first night started out pretty poorly, the room was very dirty, cutains had black stains across and the chair was disgusting,the furniture had also seen better days, also we examined the bedding and this only consisted of two sheets and thin blanket, not the website description of Goosedown bedding.I informed reception and a memeber of staff came to the room and agreed it was not up to standard and we were moved to a so called premium room, although this was better cleanlimness again was not good, chipped and dirty coffee mug.Breakfast the next day didnt fare well either, cooked breakdfast buffett was very average with items being kept warm too long and a yogurt that was 4 days past its best by date, the server commented oh, but we have now put out some fresh ones. Other problems were no toiletries left one day and even they were not as decribed by the website , not Bath and Bodyworks luxury items but some unknown supplier.Anyway, the hotel fell below our expectations of a "Luxury Boutique hotel" and comparing it to our recent stay at the Rose Hotel in Pleasanton where you are made to feel special in extraordinary surroundings. I would like to add that after leaving I left a review for the Manager but to date had no comment from him or anyone else, so this just confirms to me the lack of customer service at the River Terrace Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SusanCobb
Reviews.Content: A short (2 min) drive to downtown and the Oxbow Market. Great location and friendly staff. They now charge for the breakfast, it was complimentary 5 yr ago, but still a great place to stay. Thank you River Terrace Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisR38
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited this hotel in May 2011. I thought the rooms were very nice....good sized bathrooms. My room did not have a terrace but some do. Nice gym. Very nice bar area and beautiful patio out back with a fire pit. Good location for touring. I found staff and concierge helpful with touring arrangements. We got an online deal where 4th night was free....so I thought it was a good deal overall.

Reviews.Title: “2ND Chance @ River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_M60148
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in July of this yr and hit them pretty hard with a negative review based on my terrible stay. So chances have it that i was going back to Napa Valley for a work assignment and decided to give them another shot, maybe the previous stay was fluke, i'm all about 2nd chances. Oh boy was i wrong, first tried contacting the Sales dept to see if they offer a corporate rate, was greeted by Sandra who was very smart mouthed and rude from the moment she answered the phone, even taking my request as a joke and laughed in my ear about it. Was told to contact reservations to book a room, so i did, after being put on hold twice before being asked the nature of my call i decided to hang up and call the Avia and ending up booking my reservation there. I will never stay at the River Terrace again and one thing i learned is that once a failure, always a failure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nestinarka
Reviews.Content: Very romantic hotel. Spacious, new and clean rooms. Service at reception - ok. The staff could be little bit more knowledgeable. Breakfast - very limited, no healthy options...Mainly pork offered... If you put your DND sign, make sure your door is locked, as we experienced very unpleasant surprises also in this hotel, when someone decided to get in, despite the fact that the DND sign was there... Also, the "central reservation system" cant be accessed from the staff...

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Chamber7581
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a romantic get-a-way for the first time in 3 years. When we arrived we were put into a handicap room right beside the elevator (in which we heard every time it left, but they were generous enough to leave a sound machine) that did not have a romantic feel. Although I understand that under the fair housing compliance they must have these rooms it was not the room pictured when I made our reservation. Long story short, we checked in early, was put into a handicapped room and asked to be moved. The front desk declined our request without an apology or looking for other days within our 5 day stay that we might be able to move. The hotel was clean, but the staff was less than helpful and the experience was equivalent to that of a Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat, near all the downtown hot spots!”
Reviews.Author: IlliniFan81
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the River Terrace Inn based on Tripadvisor reviews and was extremely pleased! My husband and I had never been to Napa and were looking for a location close to the downtown area, so we could check out the restaurants after touring the wineries during the day. The hotel was perfect...very clean, quiet, personable, and comfortable. We were able to relax and enjoy our own bottle of wine on the outdoor terrace before dinner. In the mornings we were able to easily jog into the downtown area and along the historic riverfront. A few other conveniences were that a Wal-mart was right around the corner from the hotel in case you needed to stock up on water or snack for a day trip (a big money saver). Also, the drive to the main St. Helena highway was less than 10 minutes. I would definitely stay at the River Terrace Inn again because of the location and experience. It is a great place for a romantic get-away or even just a quiet retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: belllasadie
Reviews.Content: What a delightful find in downtown Napa. Great lobby with wine bar, attentive staff and very large rooms. We even had a small patio which unfortunately overlooked the parking lot, but I'm not complaining. Clean, well furnished and perfect location near the not to be missed Oxbow Public Market and great downtown restaurants. If you are a foodie or like to cook don't miss Shackfords Kitchen store. Will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious, clean and with super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Muchara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Napa in 2010 with my 2 kids, my sister, her husband and her daughter. I am all about a clean place specially when my kids come along. This place was amazing. The room was very spacious and super clean. The staff was so amazing and helpful. The bar downstairs was great and actually had great food. The outside was super cute with the fire pits. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Napa with Style”
Reviews.Author: jtyler5
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ River Terrace Inn was fantastic! Corner rm w/gorgeous view of river from 2nd floor. Jacuzzi tub w/dbl shower head. Large king bed was super comfy! Walking distance to local restaurants and shopping. Staff very helpful! Would definitely return to Napa!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: Heather O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October 2011. We were greeted when we checked in with friendly and helpful staff. I think I have become so used to receiving bad service in hotels and this experience was a nice exception! The staff continued to be friendly and helpful in the hotel and in the cafe. The hotel is in a great location and our room was clean and comfortable. If we come back to Napa we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Napa Valley boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPoppie
Reviews.Content: The River terrace Inn lived up to our expectations and then exceeded them with outstanding service. The location is perfect with quiet riverside rooms and close access to the town of Napa, wineries and The Wine Train. In addition, the staff directed us to The Marketplace, a lively center with restaurants (including an oyster bar), as well as an organic grocery, bakery, wine and cheese shop and many other shops, located well within walking distance. Their on-site restaurant, Cuvee, was the place where we enjoyed one of the best meals in the valley. All of our requests at the hotel were handled easily by the staff. We hope to return once again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: kiki516
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a girls weekend, rooms are small, fitted sheets came off bed all night, the maids came at 8:00pm knocked once then opened the door before we could get to it! Thank god we were dressed! Tried to eat at the cafe and waited so long for the only waiter to show up, that we left and walked to town. For $300. a night I would expect much better service! I will not stay here again, & would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_S382
Reviews.Content: We loved this Inn! The lobby was warm and welcoming with a beautiful open patio with a fire pit.We came with another couple and loved having the wine bar and patio to sit and visit in a warm inviting atmosphere. We loved the rooms..very clean and comfortable with a great view from the balcony. We especially loved that we were in walking distance of downtown Napa and also just a short walk away from a great Market place with different restaurants and wares as well as fresh produce, meat and cheese. There was also Model Bakery which had wonderful pastries and breakfast fare. We were very satisfied with our pick and would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the Napa area. We can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey...”
Reviews.Author: deenmachine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location within walking distance of Napa restaurants. The room was stylish and clean. The outdoor terrace was great for having the breakfast buffet or happy hour. There's a fire pit out there as well. We enjoyed our stay but for some reason the weekend we stayed the rates were higher than average for this hotel which is why I rated it poor on value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, check-in problems”
Reviews.Author: megkarvo
Reviews.Content: We traveled as part of four couples and stayed two nights. Check-in was a nightmare -- took 90 minutes to deal with four rooms that were reserved weeks in advance. By the time we were done the fourth couple had lost their reserved room (to someone checking in next to us) and had to drive 15 minutes to a back-up hotel. Hotel staff were apologetic, but it made no sense. The rooms were nice, the hotel quiet, the location convenient for walking to downtown Napa. We would probably stay here again despite the mix-up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lori256
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect place to stay and go daily on our little trips to wineries and all that the wine country offers! The nice sized rooms and bathrooms are very clean and comfortable. We did not have a river view but maybe that can be requested. There is a nice warm pool that we didn't use. The daily breakfast was very nice with scrambled eggs, french toast, cereal and lots of fresh fruit to name a few of the irems. We ate breakfast outside on the heated pation every morning. We walked to the Napa Farmers Market from there which is located at Oxbow Market. A place that is a must go to for local flavor even if it isn't a market day. There is a small but adequate fitness room. The staff was very friendly and we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon stay!”
Reviews.Author: KTAnderson
Reviews.Content: Between the two of us, we had never been to Napa. We took a gamble on a non-chain hotel. We were happy to arrive and see very friendly staff. Upon entering our room, we were welcomed with a very spacious, plush room, with amazing beds! Also, the dual showerheads were a nice added bonus. I strongly recommend the river view rooms (the room I stayed in), as the city view rooms do not have much of a view. Also, plan to spend at least one night out by the fire sipping on some wine on their peaceful back patio in the restaurant. The only drawbacks were that the patio in the room was a bit crammed and the air conditioner had a faint smell, but were both minor issues considering the mild whether.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: M K
Reviews.Content: Our room was perfect. Overlooked the river. Was beautiful. They upgraded us without us even asking. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The shower experience was great. A two headed shower...sooo nice! Really enjoyed staying here. Was pleasantly surprised. First time staying here too. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Napa Wine Touring”
Reviews.Author: DesMoines
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in October 2011 with three other couples and toured Napa Valley for four days. This hotel was a real find. Our room was completely renovated and up to date, roomy with a great bed and an outstanding, large shower. The hotel breakfast and wait staff were as good as I have experienced lately. The patio eating and lounge area is on the river and has a great fire pit for those nippy Fall mornings and evenings. The hotel is right off a main artery, easy to find, and within a reasonable walking distance (6 to 8 blocks) of a great variety of downtown Napa restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryan J
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay the girls at the front desk were very helpful and a lot of fun! The location is walking distance to oxbow & downtown. Booked a room in front of the hotel which was fine for us we spent more time outside on the patio which was very relaxing breakfast was good, however there servers are little slow getting us seated but other than that we had a wonderful stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Kelly d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is picturesque from the outside, but going by what you are paying, it is in dire need of some upgrades. In our room the walls were scuffed, dirty, had definitely seen better days. In the hallway by the elevator the mirror was broken and on the floor with dirt all around walls. Honestly, i just feel like when you are paying almost $300/night, these things are not acceptable. I don't think I would come back and would look for another option

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrCo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in late September for two nights as part of our tour of California. We both really liked the hotel and enjoyed our stay. Its in a good location, easily in walking distance into Napa town. At night we got a taxi in. We had a river facing room with a hot tub in the bathroom. The room was really spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a small balcony overlooking the river which was very pleasant to sit out on in the mornings and evenings. I was really impressed with the buffet style breakfast. They had something for everyone and it set you up for the day. The coffee was also excellent. We were quite lucky with the weather and were able to sit out on the terrace for breakfast, which was very pleasant. The staff that waited on during breakfast were very attentive and chatty, which we both really liked. My only gripe with the hotel was the check in process was quite long and drawn out, considering our room had been paid for before our trip. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, do watch out for a few things...”
Reviews.Author: Kiawahbeth
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the River Terrace Inn. It is a very nice hotel, well maintained w/large bathrooms. Walking to downtown Napa was easy during the day, don't know that I would have wanted to walk after dark (we had a car). Oxbow was very convenient. Staff was cordial and pleasant to work with. We had to change rooms right at the beginning, AC wasn't working properly in the first room, but there were no hassles at all in doing so. After having read about the wine "issues" on this site, I knew not to pick up the bottles, hubby didn't...of course he had to examine each of them, despite the warning on the tray that states if the bottles are picked up, they will immediately be charged to the room. The next time we went out, we stopped by the front desk and explained that he had picked the bottles up and if they were charged, we'd like the charge removed from our bill. They checked, no additional charges...it takes about 30 seconds for the tray to realize that the bottle isn't there, so now you have been warned!!! Our other "issue" was with the breakfast...within their website, it does say that there is a free breakfast included in the price of the room (I just checked, it's still there). When we checked in, they gave us the hours of breakfast service and pointed out the room where the breakfast is served, just as if we were at a Hampton Inn or some other hotel where breakfast is included w/the price, no mention of a fee. I asked if it was included and was informed it was $12 pp. I had a copy of the text from the website stating that breakfast was included w/the price of the room...we received vouchers for the 3 days we were there. Evidently, they stopped including breakfast back in April, a few things have slipped through the cracks. It's too bad that these "issues" get in the way of a place that otherwise would have been quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: mands_carter
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Nappa wine train, it's a typical US country hotel. Comfortable rooms and generally good service - very comfortable bed. The excellent Cuvee restaurant uses the same car park as the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price!”
Reviews.Author: Belen_llf
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel in September with my husband. It is the perfect price for a clean hotel. The restaurant and service are very good and it is close to everything! I recomend breakfast in the Oxbow market... www.oxbowpublicmarket.com

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: ogdenre
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and quiet and the rooms were nice. Beautiful bathroom and separate vanity are. We had a view of the river with a mini balcony, very comfortable bed for $273 a night. It's within walking distance to downtown Napa, but you have to walk along a main road or through a not-so-well lit neighborhood. If I had taken the time to map it out, I would have chosen a hotel on the other side of Soscol. Since we planned to walk everywhere, it was an inconvenience. If you're driving, no problem. Over our four day stay we had to get three sets of keys because the keys stopped working, even though we kept them in an envelope and away from cell phones and credit cards. It doesn't sound like a big deal, but after a day out exploring vineyards and biking, that extra 15 minutes waiting to get a new key seems like forever. On our final night, that extra 15 minutes cost us our dinner reservations and a prolonged wait at Grace's Table. We had an incident with something missing from our room that staff were quick to respond to, but the follow-up by the general manager left us less than satisfied. His basic response was we were mistaken, we must have consumed the item and forgot. Definitely not the case. They eventually offered to replace the item, but after two days of back and forth I just thanked them and declined. Then upon check out we were charged for a can of beer from the mini bar. We never even opened the mini bar. When my husband brought it up with the front desk, they quickly took it off the bill, but they "jokingly" asked him, are you sure your wife didn't drink it and you don't know about it? Seems to be a prevalent attitude the customer is always wrong -- or at least has dementia. With a little work on customer service and the key system, it'd be a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You'll want to ask for the upgrade............”
Reviews.Author: ChefKFairfax_VA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her husband stayed here for her honeymoon three years ago and raved about it. She showed us photos of the room, grounds etc. My husband and I booked a room here for one night during our stay in Napa Valley. After a tiring day of touring the wineries, we were anxious to go back to the hotel to relax and find a good place for dinner. When we arrived, the hotel looked just like it's photo, so that was good start. Unfortunately, it was all downhill from here. Check in was ok, nothing special. When we got to our room, I was immediately hit with a smell of stale wine. The carpet was stained, and the furniture was chipped. The room was overall, very plain with no special touches. The advertised "comfy" bed was misleading, the bedcover felt like drapery material, very scratchy to the touch. Our "view" was overlooking the carport. Disappointed, I tried to put away our food items in the fridge and found I couldn't since it was stocked with high cost mini-bar items. I put my food items back into the cooler. My husband and I decided to not complain, just get through the night and leave the next morning, but it was hard to sleep with the strong odor. Needless to say, we didn't get a good night's rest. Check out was even worse than checking in, no one asked if we liked the room or our stay in general. They just wanted to express check us out and be done with it all. We will not be back again......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a professional workshop”
Reviews.Author: LAS55
Reviews.Content: RiverTerrace Inn was the site and venue for a recent professional workshop. The staff were professional and extremely accommodating to all attendees. The meeting space, along with all catered meals, went very smoothly, including satisfying any special requests or needs. And since the facility is within walking distance to downtown Napa, it was especially convenient so that guests could enjoy a leisurely walk to the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Randlyman
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 4 nights at this property and found it very clean and comfortable. They have complimentary valet service but there was plenty of self-parking available (but we were there Sun. - Wed.) The staff were most accomodating and pleasant. There was always a nice 'after hours' gathering on the terrace. LOVE the fire pit and the bar serves beer and wine until 11:00 p.m. (that's all they serve) which is great for us night owls. They have a limited-menu restaurant on site with room service (we never used either) but there's a full restaurant on the other side of the parking lot which offered a nice selection of food at reasonable prices along with a full bar. Loved their location; 3 minutes from downtown but far enough away from the highway that it gave an impression of being remote. The best view was in the back (river-view rooms) and also from the terrace where there were lots of trees. Overall a pleasant experience and we would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, comfortable but uninspired hotel”
Reviews.Author: WkndWarrior
Reviews.Content: This was home base for a quick weekend in wine country and it served us well. It's clean and quiet, the rooms are a good size, the beds are very comfortable. But it has about as much charm as a business hotel. Other than the fact that they had wine tasting in the lobby one night, this place could've been a Radisson in Kansas City. Would've preferred it was a little cheaper, but in this area, the price seems about right.

Reviews.Title: “Check you bill before signing!”
Reviews.Author: mamasal
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the River Terrace Inn. As with most visitors you are out exploring during the day and we really didn't spend that much time at the hotel. Two events to help future guests. Do not even breath on the wine bottles in your room or you will be charged for them. I happened to notice three bottles of wine charged to our room on our bill as we were checking out. I was told if a bottle is moved even slightly you have to pay for it. Our bill was adjusted but just something to be aware of. Second issue was breakfast. As reservation was made months ago I could not remember if breakfast was included. As nothing was mentioned when we checked in I called front desk to check the night before and was told it was not included and would be 12 dollars per person. Another couple traveling with us said that did not sound right, as we were preparing to go eat in town the next morning. Sure enough, I checked my e mail reservation which I had brought with me and it stated clearly that breakfast WAS included. I went to the desk and upon showing them the e mail we were given breakfast "tickets" for both mornings. As I mentioned both issues were resolved, just something travelers should be aware of. The back terrace was very enjoyable for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in lovely part of California”
Reviews.Author: Callycam
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room with lots of amenities and super comfy bed. Decor a bit dark though and view over car park was disappointing but all river view rooms were booked. Breakfast was a bit disorganised, missing cutlery and plates, too few tables and not much choice. Also hot options were actually cold! Yuk! But hotel is in a good location with plenty of decent restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover089
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with big rooms and wonderful amenities provided within them. The nearby restaurant is fabulous and you are walking distance to the Napa Wine train. Swimming pool a little small but staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Summer8204
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. I booked this hotel because it was one of the cheapest in the area with a swimming pool (something that we really enjoy!). I must say we were pleasantly surprised. The location is great, near Oxbow Public Market, the Wine Train (which we didn't do), and close to downtown Napa where there are several wine tasting rooms and restaurants. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go, there is some construction near the hotel so some of the walks weren't the prettiest, but felt safe regardless. The rooms were large and cozy, and there is a bar in the hotel with some great beers and wines. My only complaint was the cost of the breakfast buffet...$12.95 pp! And I had originally thought it was included in my room price so I was a little disappointed with that...otherwise great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nestled in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: I want to start out by saying that our trip to Napa was a dream come true! We stayed at the River Terrace for 2 nights and the rooms were tastefully decorated in warm tones to soothe your soul after a day out wine tasting! The balconies overlook the Napa river and offer a private oasis to enjoy a glass of wine or just take in the peacefulness of nature. Our room included a king size bed that was very comfortable and a beautiful bathroom that included a double shower head and a separate make up area complete with a lighted mirror! The room was very comfortable with no outside noise. We found it easy to sleep in because of the comfort and quiet. The breakfast was separate but offered delicious scrambled eggs, thick cut hickory bacon, pudgy juicy sausages, roasted hash browns, crisp french toast, homemade oatmeal with a healthy variety of nuts, cinnamon, beautiful tray of fresh fruit and organic yogurt...well, you get the picture, many choices and well worth the price. You can enjoy this breakfast buffet outdoors on the patio or inside nestled by the fireplace. The oxbow market is within walking distance and offers many unique eating choices. Also, within walking distance is a variety of specialty restaurants. They also offer a full workout room that includes a recumbent bicycle and a beautiful outdoor pool to cool off in. The restaurant Cuvee was outstanding and located across the hotel's parking lot. The atmoshpere was cozy and comfortable with the outdoor heaters. I chose the sampler which included 4 courses complete with the coordinating wine selection and each was prepared perfectly. The staff was very friendly and helpful and could direct you in your daily activities. As I said this trip was a dream come true and the River Terrace made it possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedRenny
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel and it was very nice. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was perfect, staff were very pleasant to deal with. We would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “High Season”
Reviews.Author: DarleneQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at River Terrace Inn for one night as we were visiting friends in the area. It's definitiely "high season" for lodging in Napa. Room was comfy and clean but not worth the price. We arrived at 2:50 to check in and were advised that our room wasn't ready yet. (Stated check in time is 3pm.) We went to the bar and ordered a bottle of wine (more economical than by the glass. We intended to finish the wine in our room after checking in.) Waiting in line to check in, we learned that other guests who also were waiting to check in were offered complimentary wine at the bar because they had to wait. (one waiting guest was even escorted to the bar to wait.) Why weren't we?? What's up with the special, unequal treatment? There was free wine tasting sponsored by a local winery on Friday night (starting at 5:30). That was nice, but we weren't able to hang out too long as we had early dinner reservations. So I can't really comment on how well attended/received this is. (Nice farmer's market on Saturday mornings at the old Copia parking lot.) Inn is easy walking distance to downtown shops, the Oxbow Market and Wine Train, although Inn appears to have bikes for use (rent?) for guests. Also has a swimming pool which appeared clean and a couple cardio machines if you want to get in your excercise while on vacation. Cuvee restaurant, apparently affiliated with Inn, not in Inn, but just a few steps from the front door. (Didn't try it out.) So, while our stay was ok - It was defintiely not worth the price. At the rates they charge, you would think they would be more gracious - and fair - regarding making it up to guests who have to wait to check in. If your room isn't ready - be sure to ask them to make you "more comfortable" while waiting at the bar - before you buy a bottle :)

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Bambi0920
Reviews.Content: We were told by a family member and friend that this place is good, not great, but totally adequate if you are planning to be out in the vineyards all day and staying here at night. Perhaps since our expectations were set a bit lower, we really enjoyed this hotel. It's nothing too fancy - I don't totally agree with the website billing it as "luxury" hotel - but nice furnishings, clean, and good value. We received a coupon for two free drinks at Cuvee, a restaurant across the parking lot, which was a nice little perk, and even used the hotel bar where you can enjoy a last glass of wine at night seated around the fire pit outside. Breakfast is expensive, but I believe in line with what other hotels offer ($30 for 2 people) and the outdoor pool is small but great for relaxing. Location is probably on the fringe of where you want to be, but it's an easy ride to Route 29 and you'll pass a Starbucks on the way if you'd rather have breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place and I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha919
Reviews.Content: Classy, clean and sophisticated....the River Inn Terrace is remarkable in every sense. The rooms are very spacious and the views are breathtaking. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: famousfamos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to downtown Napa and within walking distance of great restaurants, entertainment and shopping. Enjoyed our stay while visiting wineries in Napa & Sonoma and likely to stay again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and classy”
Reviews.Author: snowstarz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Terrace Inn for three nights this spring. I was in town for a special music and wine tasting event which was sponsored by several of the local businesses and wineries. The staff at the hotel was very welcoming. The room itself was spacious with a large restroom, comfortable beds, good air conditioning, and a decent sized LCD television. The breakfast was very good, the only issue was the dining area was a bit cramped. The evening before checkout, the front desk staff assisted me in printing boarding passes for my flight the next morning. The location is a bit of a walk to the downtown area, but very close to the Oxbow Public Market. I recommend going there for lunch as they have an international variety of eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Plain convenient hotel near wine train”
Reviews.Author: Hidntreshr
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a friendly staff and coupons for free drinkks at Cuvee across the street. The room seemed nice until we heard the dumpsters being emptied in the morning. I think the hotel is worth under 200 a night, the gym and pool make it nice. Make sure you print your confirmation out before you get there so that your rate isn't changed accidentally by the front desk staff. Clarify whether the simple buffet breakfast is included in your rate or not. It didn't feel luxurious, but it has potential. The cheap mini bar and complimentary bottles of water were a nice touch. The General Manager aims to please and resolves issues quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price, wonderful bathroom and shower”
Reviews.Author: maryanne007NewYork
Reviews.Content: For the price we got which was $225/night at the end of August during a weekend, it was a very very good deal! We had no view, but we didn't care. The room was very spacious, the bed incredibly comfortable and the bathroom looked brand new - marble, clean, and had an amazing double showerhead. It is about a 15 minute walk to the downtown area and not much scenery on that walk, but that was fine with us. We enjoyed the brisk morning air and walk back after dinner. I think overall it was perfectly lovely place to stay and given the prices, it was really a very good decision. While I enjoyed Avia Napa better (more modern and in a better location, it was about $80-$100 more a night, which was too steep for us).

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cyberbliss
Reviews.Content: The room was great: roomy with a comfy bed. Oh and the hot tub was fantastic. The staff were friendly and professional. It is located within walking distance of downtown Napa and thus perfect for visiting one of the local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel wish there were screens on the window”
Reviews.Author: Ltiggertaz
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal with book-it.com and was on the top floor. The hotel room is very spacious but to keep the room cool you have to have the ac on, If they had a screen on the window and door it would be better. My room location was right off the elevator which is not bad but on the other side of the wall was the ice machine which could be heard. So make sure you request a change if they give you room 315. I will say that since I got the room for 60 less then any other listing I was okay with it. I would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ella020
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was in a nice setting, breakfast was very poor and the area for dining not adequate for hotel capacity. Had to eat outside and on two occasions it was raining. Rooms were clean. Bathrooms no problem. Had to cross a busy road to get into town of Napa. Nice Oxenbow market nearby with excellent food outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very NIcce!”
Reviews.Author: annie13
Reviews.Content: The River Terrace is a lovely hotel with a great location! The only complaint that we have is that we booked under the pretense that a complementary breakfast was included. When we checked in, they did told us the price of breakfast. After we inquired that the breakfast should be included, they informed us it has been discontinued. They did not give us an email or notice about it and I did complain with no satisfaction. But, we still had a wonderful time and did enjoy our time at the hotel. They had a lovely wine tasting Friday night, and the conceige was good. So, be for warned...if you are planning a complementary breakfast...forget about t!!! But, you will enjoy the hotel without it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in wonderful wine country”
Reviews.Author: KiloAlphaWhiskey
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at the River Terrace Inn. We took advantage of a 3rd night free deal and so the value was particularly good. There wasn't much of a view from our 2nd floor "river view deluxe" room but it was surprisingly quiet despite being right above the terrace cafe. The location was great for walking into town, grabbing the Wine Train (perfect for a group), and for exploring Napa/Sonoma. The breakfast in the lobby had a nice selection (including warm items) and our group had a great dinner at the nearby Cuvee restaurant. The free Internet access and parking were a nice bonus and we enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: lbutani
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice place...tucked away in a corner. Very large room, extremely comfortable. Very helpful staff. Good central location, walking distance to the Oxbow market. A but pricey, but then its Napa!

Reviews.Title: “convenient for what Napa has to offer”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a 9PM French Laundry dinner (~15 min away). It falls somwhere between a more upscale resort-like hotel and your family-friendly Homewood Suites type place with the complimentary breakfast. Apparenly several amenities including free internet and gym (didn't use) besides the breakfast. Room with 2 queen beds was fine, large bathroom. The double-headed shower didn't seem good for anything but wasting water. Our ground-floor room looked onto the parking lot. The location was good for some of the highlights of the town of Napa -- almost just across the street from the Napa Wine Train station, just a couple of blocks down from the Oxbow Market (gourmet food and eating similar to San Francisco's Ferry Building), and then maybe 4 blocks farther down to the 1st Street market area with shops and restaurants downtown. Napa still seems to be a sleepy little town with some empty storefronts, but appears to be slowly coming back to life. After an afternoon exploring the downtown Napa area you'll probably spend most of your time exploring the valley vineyards and other shopping towns just using the hotel as a home base anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: vwillson
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Expedia/AARP and had no guarantee the beds. In fact, we got a king only and had 3 adults. Call ahead to make sure you get what you need...ask for Kevin, very nice. When we got there, they were very accomadating and gave us a king and sofa bed plus a river view room, even on the bottom floor. The shower has a double shower head...heavenly. Dont pass up the back patio for lunch or dinner.Quiet, listen to the birds and the river. Its not a full menu and I think that was the reason it was not crowded but the food is delicious, a wonderful chef. Henry, our waiter, was very attentive and nice. Beautiful, fireplace and heaters all around. We sat outside every night and enjoyed wine, dinner, family time playing cards. They include breakfast but its the typical kind, not by the master chef. I will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Maltesejane
Reviews.Content: our only complaint is about the noise of the a/c unit.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: artnak
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 night stay at the River Terrace Inn. Our river facing suite with balcony was quiet and very comfortable. The room was very clean, spacious and nicely appointed. Bed was very comfortable. Our bathroom had a whirlpool tub and double showerheads. Breakfast was limited in choice, but what they did have was of good quality, especially the fruit and cereals. Short walk to downtown Napa, and next to the Oxbow Market and the Wine Train. Front desk staff and doormen greeted us whenever we arrived or left the hotel. Had a good rate with a 3 night stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mrsslk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn for 3 nights at the end of July. Overall, we were pleased. The room was clean, well appointed and comfortable. My favorite thing about the hotel was the deck/patio with tables along the river. It's very private and quiet out there, no city traffic or noises. We enjoyed a glass of wine out there at night and breakfast in the morning. The breakfast that is included with the stay at the hotel is fresh and plentiful. We had lots of great fresh fruit to start our day - what could be better? The staff were all friendly and competent. The cons: they have to do something about the air conditioners in the rooms. They are noisy, going off and on all night. They are not very good at controlling the temperature at one temperature. Also, the pool is small and in the shade. The workout room is also small.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: CherylOG
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. The staff were friendly and helpful. The view of the river off our balcony was tranquil. The room was clean, and quiet. Loved the double shower heads in the bathroom, and the water pressure was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_M60148
Reviews.Content: Very poor choice to stay here, most of the reviews were great so i decided to give it a shot. First upon arrival, no bellman was on duty, so we retrieved a luggage cart and unloaded our own luggage. The check in process was no better, may i suggest hiring people with customer service skills, the staff you have there now have none. The room was nice, not quite what i expected but it was comfortable. The breakfast and restaurant was a joke, breakfast consisted of eggs and no kind of meat, just some pastries and some fruit, McDonald's is sounding so good right about now. we waited during lunch for 20 mins for an employee to show up we were the only customers waiting and when she finally did just stated oh i'm sorry i was on my break, not to mention dressed very sloppily and uniform was dirty, so we took that as a warning and just went out and had lunch at a nice cafe downtown Napa. And only to be expected our bill was not correct during check out but was in a hurry to leave so i was told to contact accounting and they would fix it for me, so i called when i arrived at my destination and was finally greeted with some professionalism who after hearing me vent my frustration, apologized and took care of my billing issue and made me feel good about someone at this property. The management here definately is non-existing and it shows in the staff in everything that they do. I would most definately not recommend this hotel and will think more carefully about where i stay the next time i'm in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great breakfast, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: ts826
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I stayed here for two nights. The lobby area is warm and elegantly comfortable and our room was really nice. We had a little confusion about our reservation at first (they didn't put us in a room with enough beds for three) but it was quickly fixed. The concierge there was amazing--I called her about two weeks in advance and she made reservations for both kayaking and hot air ballooning. The continental breakfast, served every morning, is plentiful and fresh. We ate dinner at cuvee (the hotel's nearby restaurant) and it was the best dinner of our whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise, great location”
Reviews.Author: jlegendre
Reviews.Content: We were not sure if the hotel was going to be nice when we booked it online. We were kind of late booking for the fourth of July weekend and didn't have much choice, since many hotels were filled. Wow, were we surprised at how beautiful and comfortable it was. We thoroughly enjoyed the close proximity to downtown Napa. We also loved the back patio where we enjoyed complimentary breakfast and our favorite bottle of wine purchased at a winery that we visited that day. We enjoyed swimming in the pool, since it was extrememly hot during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay right near downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: SoFlaFam
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, luxurious-but-not-pretentious little property a quick jog from downtown. Love the stream in the backyard, the generous included breakfast, and the rooms. Really spacious with fabulous, fabulous beds and great bedding! Bathrooms were updated and filled with high-end toiletries. There's a smallish pool in the back and a nice terrace.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: jessicanick
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, staff, breakfast...everything about this hotel. It is nice and quiet. I thought the location was a quick walk to downtown. Beautiful view in the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucie02
Reviews.Content: So far the best hotel I have stayed in in USA. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms large and well equipped. Breakfast included, free internet access, free bottled water. Bathroom spacious and large shower. Balcony .....and view of river if you get a room at the back. Good location for Silverado Trail and the rest of the Napa Valley, including the wine train. Restaurant (Cuvee) located next door is fabulous and well worth a trip too. For anyone doing a road trip out of San Fransisco, it is well worth making the time to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to come back soon”
Reviews.Author: JEH1961
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great from the moment we checked in. The food and service is very good and breakfast outside was wonderful. The room was very luxurious. I really hope to be able to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: knevets
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the River Terrace Inn and found it to be an enjoyable experience and a pleasant place to stay. Everything met our expectations: the location was a short drive to downtown Napa, the staff was courteous, the room was a nice size and clean, and the complimentary breakfast buffet was the perfect way to start the day. Overall a great find.

Reviews.Title: “good not great.”
Reviews.Author: tiger62z
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while touring the wine country. Just as some TA reviewers said, you can walk to the downtown area but it is not a short walk and not much to see on the road. We were given a two-for-one drink coupon at Cuvee when we checked in. The restaurant is right next to the hotel. We went there one night and ordered some happy hour appetizer and the food was quite good. Pro: 1. Quite location by a small river. 2. Nice bar and outdoor sitting area. Con: 1. The room is spacious but there is only one small desk you can put stuffs. 2. There was some cobweb on the room ceiling which was directly above the bed, and some small blackish bugs stuck on the ceiling above the desk. Since we didn’t discover these until late in the evening, and we had to get up really early next morning for the tour, we didn’t bother to call the staff. Those bugs were gone after we came back from our tour the next day but the cobweb was still there. 3. I think there might some training issues: some of the staffs we met were very helpful whereas some of them were not. 4. I think there are some problems with this hotel’s own reservation system. I called the hotel to make the first reservation because my home internet was down at the time. After that, I made the second reservation through the hotel’s website. Later on I called the hotel to cancel my first reservation because my sister couldn’t join me. Then I received two cancellation confirmation emails from the hotel. I thought it was strange so I called the hotel and ask them to check. I was told that the one I made from website was still booked but it used a different confirmation number. When I arrived the hotel after 3pm, I told the front desk I had a reservation, a lady told me that the room was not ready. At the time, I thought it was strange because there were at least 6 other people went to check in after us, all of them got their room keys right away. When I checked out, I was given a bill statement with wrong room rate (expensive than the one I booked). The same front desk lady told me that all my two reservations were cancelled and she gave me a room with the regular rate. If it was the case, how come I could still see my reservation with booked status right before I left for Napa? Why she didn’t tell me at the first place? I wasted precious time to wait for the room being cleaned up. I was not happy obviously. After I told her my side of story, she said she needed talk to the manager. After another waiting, the manager gave the room rate I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: absunseeker
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights towards the end of May and were really pleased! We booked a riverview, whirlpool room on the 'pay for two nights, get the third night free deal' and so it was a pretty decent price for what we got. Our second floor room had a nice view of the river and we even had the opportunity to watch a lovely wedding on the riverbank while enjoying a glass of wine on the balcony. The pool could have been a bit warmer and a hot tub would have been very welcome but we did have some poolside time anyway. Breakfast was okay, it would have been nice if yogurt was available daily and cut fresh fruit would be easier than whole to deal with but overall a decent selection. We took advantage of the bicycles that the hotel has available and they were very handy for touring around Napa, allowing us to see much more than we would have on foot. Definitely a good choice while staying in Napa, proximity to the Wine Train and Oxbow Market is certainly a plus. We loved our time in the Napa Valley and River Terrace Inn was a great part of our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decor”
Reviews.Author: kebert26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RTI for two nights. Other than Travelodge, RTI was the cheapest we found. I was shocked about how loud everything was. Didn't get much rest. RTI has the BEST eggplant panini. It is a must have.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Behavior”
Reviews.Author: francamg
Reviews.Content: We made reservation for 1 night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We did call 3 hours before and nothing was mentioned about any error in our reservation. We got there and front desk made us wait to get our room as if something was wrong. Front desk excused to consult with management, came back, gave us our keys mentioning nothing about any problem with our reservation. Showered us with complimentary service cards. When we entered the room, it was clearly an inferior room, without the whirlpool for which we specifically reserved. We promptly returned to the front desk and let them know about the mistake. Another front desk person checked our reservation said nothing and brought us the general manager who finally came to us and let us know we did not have the specific type of room we had reserved. After ample opportunities, only now as we were upset, it occurred to them to acknowledge their mistake for the 1st time. We were very disturbed by the obvious tentative to fool us into getting an inferior room without mentioning it. Perhaps we would not notice the missing whirlpool and would have paid higher price for an inferior room. Then, the general manager informed there was no room as we requested, informed they were fully booked and offered we get the same inferior room we almost got fooled into taking for half the price.
