After hours of traveling and high expectations, we had no intention to do business with such a management or stay in a hotel with this level of service. We requested our credit card never be charged. And made clear we did expect no error this time around. We do not recommend this hotel or its management to anyone. -Marta Franca, Sunnyvale, CA

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, close to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Soap_In_The_Dish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and it was a good base for exploring the area. Easy walk from downtown after enjoying some happy hours and the nearby restaurants. Breakfast was good, though the same every day...a little variety would have been nice. It was crowded only because the weather was terrible, but on our last day, the rain stopped and the outdoor dining area (especially by the firepit) was quite nice. We paid extra for a "riverside" room, but were disappointed to find that "riverside" and "riverview" were two different room categories. When we checked out the room, it was first floor (2nd and 3rd are the "riverview") and it had a view of the paved cartpath, gravel, but no glimpse of the river. Fortunately, they were good about "downgrading" us to the village view on the 3rd floor at $20 less per night. The river itself is not as bad as a previous review put it, but it's fairly average...mostly because everything around it in Napa is SO beautiful. It may be worth an extra $20 per night, but certainly not the $70 per night that would have been the difference for us (we paid $170). Parking and internet is free, the fridge is a decent size, and the breakfast is good. The rooms, especially bathrooms, are high end. I'd stay here again. Beds were amazing. Pool was small, not heated, and a hot-tub would have been well appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: giban
Reviews.Content: Returned to River Terrace Inn for a weekend getaway. The hotel is very comfortable and the view from the room, overlooking the river was beautiful. It was great to sit outside on the terrace for breakfast and listen to the soft jazz playing through the speakers. Very close to the Oxbow and Riverfront.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: la808
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again only if I had a rental car. The property itself is nice, rooms very good but Property is only about a 15 minute walk to downtown Napa, but it's across the railroad tracks without sidewalks in a smal area, so I would think twice about doing that at night. It is close to Oxbow Market, but the walk over is not very exciting -you cut through a bank parking lot past the Westin hotel, the Napa Wine Train depot and that's it. If you have a car, it's great - 3 minute drive to whole foods, trader joes and the like. 2 minutes to downtown Napa. Small exercise room with free weights, treadmills, elliptical trainers. Nice deck with a roaring fire was a relaxing place to start the day with their free continental breakfast. There is limited seating indoors. Rooms included a mini fridge, free internet, sitting area. Dual shower heads were great. Bathrooms roomy with tons of counter space. Housekeeping was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Beautiful hotel on the River”
Reviews.Author: Plano65
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Napa. We were a tour from Santa fe. Just a few of us. We all loved the hotel. Rooms and view terrific. Huge tub and wonderful showerhead// I had a room on the riverside. It had a deck with two chairs/.Breakfast was a buffet with indoor or outdoor seating. Patio was lovely with a firepit and view of trees and river.There is a beautiful bar area in the lobby. sofa for just sitting around.One night we went to the restaurant by the hotel- Curvee I think- It was very good- meal,service and wine.I would recommend it too/ You can not go wrong staying at this hotel- They make you feel that they are glad you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinda-Mark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of 6, hotel was chosen by a family member. I would not have chosen this hotel on our own as we tend to go for a cheaper option and spend more on the visit itself. That being said, this hotel was extremely clean, well maintained and comfortable. The free breakfast was ok - it's included so who am I to complain - my only recommendation is that they consider moving the food over to the boardroom when not in use. Everymorning it was packed with people and it isn't set up in the most user friendly way. They may also want to consider getting better quality fruit juices. They have a lovely patio with heaters and fire pits and we were allowed to take out our own wine and spend the evening there with no pressure. Walking distance to the Oxbow Market and from there its a quick walk downtown. Everyone seemed helpful at the hotel. In our group we had two people lose items in the lobby and both were turned in by honest guests! One item is being shipped by the hotel as we speak - thank you. I absolutely loved their sound machine and water bottles delivered at nighttime. This is a great hotel and the higher price reflects that. I doubt you will be disappointed if you give this a try.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot To Stay In Napa”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherTripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights recently and was delighted with the hotel and its service. First off, I recommend getting a room with a river view because they have the best view of the river -- much better than the Napa River Inn I believe. The beds are really comfortable and the room had a wonderful decor. They also have a great bar and I'm told the restaurant (especially the breakfast experience) is quite nice, though I did not have a chance to utilize those. Overall, I was a wonderful place and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe any of the good reviews - this place is awful.”
Reviews.Author: Stotie
Reviews.Content: From the outside this place looks promising, grand facade, located by the river, pool and many other amenities. Once inside all changes, uncomfortable feeling on he interior, terrible lift system and a sterile pool terrace. We had a bad night sleep due to the sheets smelling stale, in the morning we complained about it, all we got was some desk clerk saying we would be emailed with some sort of compensation. did that ever happen.... no. Don't stay here, there are so many better places around Napa.

Reviews.Title: “We walked in and walked out”
Reviews.Author: MrsBAM
Reviews.Content: I booked the River Terrace Inn for our honeymoon. As we were driving to the hotel we kept waiting to see what we thought Napa would look like. (A cute little town with shops, restaurants, vineyards surrounding us.) Instead as we drove by the hotel we were surrounded by autobody stores and other commercial properties. We thought we had ended up on route 9 in NJ instead of Napa. When we checked in the staff at the front desk was very young and did not seem knowledgeable about the area. The hotel itself was decent and run of the mill. When we got to our room, which was suppossed to be a deluxe room with a jacuzzi, balcony, and river view we were horrified. The jacuzzi was a tiny bath tub with two jets in a dark small bathroom. The room was average size and the river view was more like a view of a dirty canal. We did not bother to bring our bags in and immediately left the hotel. Luckily, we found a wonderful place to stay in Yountville which is everything we expected Napa to be.

Reviews.Title: “A nice enough hotel, but lacked the 'wow' factor”
Reviews.Author: Pip17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in California. It was a nice enough hotel - the room was clean and well-equipped, and the staff were friendly enough. However the location wasn't great - a bit too far out of Downtown Napa for our liking (it's a good 15-20 minute walk). And the breakfast was quite poor - it was a buffet but it was served just off the reception area so there wasn't anywhere to sit and it felt very chaotic. Overall an ok hotel, but I doubt we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nanmcg
Reviews.Content: The RTI is a very attractive property on the Napa River. There is a lovely outdoor terrace where you can sit , sip wine and enjoy the lovely view. You are very close to downtown Napa which has been beautifully restored and great restaurants--Angele, Fish Story, Celedon. The Oxbow Market is just down the road. There is wonderful wine tasting, bakery goods, a great cheese shop----everything you need for the perfect picnic. We picked up a nice bottle of cabernet at The Back Room for a very reasonable price. The Back Room is just across the bridge on First Street. RTI also has a very nice wine and bear bar in the lobby. Good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Only place I stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Denver65
Reviews.Content: OK. I've stayed at other VERY nice places in Napa, and had wonderful experiences at all of them. However, I travel to Napa in excess of 20x per year on business, and RTI is my go to place. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean and quiet (remember, you are in a hotel and not in a sound proof spa), and the staff is very friendly. I think it is worth the upgrade to stay on the backside of the hotel, as you have a tranquil view of the river, instead of looking at the parking lot on the front side. The restaurant is good, and has recently updated its menu with local produce. The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk to downtown where there are many fabulous restaurants, and about 5 minutes walk to the Oxbow Market where you will also find many, very good food vendors http://www.oxbowpublicmarket.com/.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, Comfortable and Affordable Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berk92
Reviews.Content: The River Terrace Inn is located in walking distance to Downtown Napa. It's location was a key component to a great 3 day wine tasting journey myslef and two others enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: afirsttimer
Reviews.Content: Terrific place-super comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom with marble and glass enclosed double sized shower that had dual showerheads. Extra fluffy towels, mirrors throughout (all sizes) with even a small magnifying bathroom mirror for make-up application. They thought of all the little things one would need to make the stay relaxing and soothing. Even truffles at bedtime. Frig in room and full breakfast each day. This place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: customerp
Reviews.Content: Our second visit in 3 years was even better than the first. The breakfast was downsized, but they more than made up for it with hospitality and atmosphere. The hotel overlooks the Napa river, and it is very, very peaceful. Many people eshew the southern end of the Valley, but this hotel is wonderful, if you need a sure thing at a very fair rate. Thank you, RTI for your room upgrade too, after we mentioned it was a sentimental visit. Professional staff. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Find”
Reviews.Author: SUNFLOWER200116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 10th anniversary here. We were set on discovering Napa, and thinking that we'd be spending most of our time out, I chose this hotel. I didn't expect much since the price was fairly cheap in comparison with other hotels in the area. Surprisingly, this turned out to be a very good find. Our room is clean and adequately furnished. They have free internet and dvd rental. Breakfast buffet is complimentary. The hotel is also very close to downtown Napa. We wined and dined at Morimoto's and Cuvee` (the latter is just within walking distance). Oxbow Public Market is also close - went there just for Kara's cupcakes. We will definitely come back here in the future and recommend this place to family and friends. By the way, they will hold $50/day for incidentals even if you use your credit card. Don't be surprised to see these charges when you check out. They will be cleared from your account within 2-3 days. Thanks to Mr. Jeff Whitehead, GM, who took time to answer questions re: my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Couples Get Away”
Reviews.Author: stargazer668
Reviews.Content: We went using their rail package. Package was a good deal as we got wine train tix, river view room with jacuzzi. The hotel is easy to get to & park (no charge). Location is across street from downtown Napa & close to wine train. The room was very spacious with a balcony facing the river. Great to relax. Robes were in the room for us with a Sharper Image Sound Soother which were nice touches. Wine glasses too. But look out as there are those vending machines in the room so if you move those items, you'll get charged. Nice vanity area separate from bathroom. Jacuzzi tub was great. Full breakfast was nice as they added to the continental eggs and potatoes. Nice patio area to sit outside as well. We had a great time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Use your Credit Card, not a Debit Card, at Check-In!!”
Reviews.Author: livesbythebeach1
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, make sure you give an actual credit card not a debit card when you check-in. They won't tell you this but they put a hold on some of the funds until several days after you've checked out to ensure payment on anything you might charge back to your room (movies, room service, mini bar, etc). It's a standard practice at hotels. The only problem is, if you're not expecting it and your funds are tight, the hold will make money in your own bank account unusable until the authorization is released (what they tell you: 3-5 business days later, reality: 7-14 business days later). We live paycheck to paycheck. We saved and pre-paid our entire reservation. We had no intention of charging anything to our room (not that the hotel would have known that). We have bills due but will now have to be paying them late because of the hold on the money in our own account. I work in a hotel myself. I've dealt with this issue many times. Where I work, we've gone to charging debit cards daily to keep from doing this very thing. I should have asked about it when I checked in. My mistake. But when I called, I was told there wasn't anything they could do. I know that's not true. They could call the bank to have it released sooner. But it seems like they should also tell the guest checking in so there are no suprises. There was nothing spectacular about the hotel. But it was definitely decent, clean and comfortable. Just be forwarned. If you stay here, present a credit card at check-in not your debit card...unless you have so much money that you don't need to worry about things like this. Of course, if that's the case, I suspect you'd be staying somewhere more luxurious anyway.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: jojo60713
Reviews.Content: Pretty good location to downtown Napa - just a few blocks walk along the lovely newly renovated riverfront pavement (a bit of construction but will be lovely when its finished). The rooms at the hotel are pretty spacious with nice layout and lots of space. Great amenities such as free internet access, bottled water with turn down service (even though they just walk in) - not a bad breakfast of scrambled eggs, potatoes, pastries, toast and coffee/juice etc. The only thing lacking was the service at the front desk, the woman at the front desk with gold teeth who couldn't understand English wasn't very helpful at all and not welcoming - first impressions matter! For a hotel in Napa they are not very knowledgeable or have much information on the surrounding area. We live in San Francisco and go wine tasting often either in Sonoma or Napa and like to read up about wineries in the area to work out a route and just expected lots of information for travelers in the lobby - one generic booklet and that was it! Downtown Napa is great now that they have transformed it - great restaurants within walking distance. Again, there was no information in the room about the restaurants in the area - please change that. The gym is very handy on the first floor but only has one treadmill, one eliptical and one bike - luckily I was the only one there and could get a workout in quickly before heading out to the wineries. The patio is lovely on the backside of the hotel - very quiet and relaxing. The only bad thing was the service and the fact that you can hear other people walking around and talking from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: asstlinds
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Napa and only having the internet to rely on, this hotel was an excellent choice. We stayed here for the first few nights of our honeymoon in September. The morning continental breakfast was fantastic and healthy, with many choices. The coffee was actually really good as well. They have a very nice patio with a large fire pit, which was a great way to unwind with some wine and small plates late in the evening when we arrived. It was crowded every night, and had a nice view of the adjacent river. We found the hotel room to be luxuriously appointed, comfortable and quiet. Our only complaint was their policy on spa services (which are outsourced to a local outfit.) Our wine tour was scheduled for a return of 5 p.m. on a date when our appointments were at 6 p.m. Unfortunately, when the tour started to run long, we couldn't get our driver to bring us back in time to make the appointments. I called the Front Desk about an hour beforehand when it was clear we couldn't get back, and they refused to reschedule or refund us any portion of the massages we'd scheduled. We got a fair amount of attitude from the manager and had to forfeit a substantial amount of money without receiving anything, which left a fairly bad taste in our mouths. ASIDE from that, however, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit again”
Reviews.Author: ASR2015
Reviews.Content: We are not normally the type to leave comments but they earned it. They far exceeded our expectations. The rooms are very nice and we enjoyed the balcony and soaking tub daily. If I had to dig for a "con" it would be the bed could have been a little better (I say that after having slept like a baby every night there) The staff is very friendly and always looking to assist. Sitting outside by the firepit in the morning air was perfect. If you are looking for a great place to stay and visit wine country this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ajhatt
Reviews.Content: I recently wrotea letter similar to the one below and as of today have received no response. I don't want to appear petty in my letter but we saved all year for our girls weekend .Mr. Whitehead, The hotel is very nice but I wish I could tell you we enjoyed our visit at the River Terrace Inn but I can't. Upon checking in, I was told since I was paying with a debit card that a total amount of approx $678.00 would be held this includes $50.00 a day for incidentals. I informed Ben and the manager at the counter that this was impossible and I could not afford any funds being held and would not have $50.00 a day for incidentals I did not intend to use. I told them that it was a girls weekend with my best friend and neither one of us could afford funds held in our accounts. She had not arrived since she was stuck in traffic. I informed the staff neither one of us held credit cards and was not aware of this policy regarding debit cards. Then the manager asked if I could pay my portion today and if my friend could also pay when she arrived. I said yes, that would be no problem. I was told nothing would be held in the accounts. Today my friend found that $310.00 is being held in her account which is causing numerous problems. Apparently she contacted someone in billing who told her a different story and that the holding of funds cannot be worked around. Just blew her off. How can that be? As far as I can see no funds were held on my account, staying true to what the manager told me. Why people who do not have credit cards get penalized is beyond me. Then we were told by your staff that Andretti Winery was the winery of the month and "he" would be pouring wines between 5:30 and 6:30...I asked if they meant Mario Andretti and was told yes, and then when I asked another staff member before leaving for dinner, was told yes again...my friend and I went out for dinner but made sure we were back so we could meet Mr.Andretti only to find it was someone from his winery...Mr. Andretti is currently in Iraq...another mistake by your staff. We were unable to use the balcony at night due to the heavy moisture and dew in the air, the balcony was wet and huge drops would continuously fall like rain and we could not enjoy the balcony at night Poor reception on some of the tv channels. On top of everything else, we had constant noise in the late evening and early mornings we assume by a guest and then housekeeping staff.. someone was constantly pacing the floors and moving heavy objects, slamming doors and we could hear the vacuum cleaner going...totally ridiculous! This went on our from Saturday to our departure on Monday. If I didn't know better I would think it was an office or housekeeping room. We tried calling the front desk one evening but no answer. I do a lot of traveling and we were a bit disappointed in the River Terrace Inn. I had high hopes.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: sabrina925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. Hotel was cute and we loved eating breakfast out on the terrace next to the river. Nice, cozy bar to catch up on scores of the game. Rooms were clean and nice bathrooms. My husband forgot his razor and house keeping had one sent up in under 5 minutes. Hotel is within walking distance to downtown Napa. Cute, but next time I would rather stay closer to all the vineyards. Napa is any town USA, maybe a little too commercial. But the River Terrace was a great stay, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but dont know why the rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights starting Jan 4th. Flew international and was a few days early for a conference in Vegas so decided to visit Napa. Rented a car at SFO and drove down. The traffic getting towards Napa on the interstate is bad. Got to the hotel around 630 PM. The hotel is just off Soscol Ave opposite side of Napa Mills. I had booked the room almost 2 months ago but when I checked in I was told that they could not find my reservation!!! Fortunately I had a print out of the reservation and so they created a new reservation for me. I would dread to think what would have happened had this happened in peak season. This time of the year occupancy is very low so they could get me the room. I had a rate of $143 per night. We were booked into a King size with a balcony. A tip for my fellow travelers. If you are going in winter dont bother with the balcony. Its freezing cold and so there is little chance you will ever get to enjoy the balcony. It was cold; at least for out standards; we live in India. Temperature's were hovering between 1 and 8 celsius. The hotel is located about 1/2-3/4 mile from Napa mills area where all the restaurants and bars are present. You cant walk there in winter as its too cold and the hotel did not seem to have any transportation to that area. They have free breakfast which was decent. The food at the restaurant while limited is pretty decent. They have free parking and free wifi. Next morning we went to 2 wineries. I was a bit surprised that the hotel staff did not bother recommending any wineries or give us any coupons. They did give us when we asked for it; but considering this place is so highly rated on TA I would have assumed a more proactive approach from their side. We asked and got 2 coupons from them; one had free tasting and another one had free cheese plate. Here is another tip. The winery will try to cheap out if you are going to use coupons; will give lower quality wine or only 1 kind of cheese. So overall the quality of stay was not bad but I would categorize this hotel as a 3.5 star. There was nothing exceptional about the hotel so I really did not understand why the hotel is so highly rated on TA. I would think that only an exceptional stay should get 5 stars. Dont get me wrong, the hotel is good. The rooms are good. Just dont expect anything exceptional. If you get a room at around 130-150 its probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Napa”
Reviews.Author: springwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Went here in April 2009. Stayed two nights. The rooms were very nice and simple- pretty much what we were looking for. The outside terrace for breakfast was really nice. They have a fire pit which is great for night and heat lamps also. The hotel is in walking distance to downtown Napa, which has some good restaurants and nice little shops. I can highly recommend doing the Platypus Tours. They picked you right up from the hotel and took us to 4 different wineries that were off the beaten track that many tourists go to. Experienced wineries in a very different way than if you just went on your own. Plus, they provide a very nice lunch and you dont have to worry about driving!

Reviews.Title: “Not Much in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: Not-a-Risk-Taker
Reviews.Content: We had the top of the line rooms. One of them had serious plumbing problems. When the wall was opened to do the repairs to the shower, the room stank of mold and mildew. The folks in this room were comp'd a bottle of champagne. Whoopie. Some things were as promised: The beds were super comfortable. The location is great. There was turn down service with a couple of bottles of water. And, there was a hot breakfast. All pretty important stuff. However, the view of the river came complete with some yahoos who stood just over the property line for hours and couldn't go 2 words without cursing. Don't bother to pay for the river view. More importantly don't believe anything on their website, if you are planning to be there in the off-season. For example, there was no concierge, no bike rentals, and the online reservation system doesn't work. The staff was very consistent in response to these shortfalls; they all said the same thing, "Oh, sorry." All of the guests complained about the high-speed internet not working. I asked for help with that too. The response was, "There isn't anyone to help you."

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: KKW2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed at the River Terrace Inn for one night and enjoyed our experience for the following reasons: - Reasonably priced: we prepaid for a kind bed room and received a discount. We felt the Inn was an overall great value! - We arrived to check in early and they easily accommodated us. The staff were very friendly, welcoming, and helpful on dinner recommendations - The room was great with flat screen TVs, a comfortable bed, a little sitting area, and we like the bathroom space. - The front desk area, sitting area, outdoor seating area and bar area had a very comfortable and welcoming décor. I wanted to sip wine by the fire place and look out at the river behind the building -The breakfast included in the cost was above average! - The location was great! It was next to the wine train and a short walk to restaurants -Received two free glasses of wine at their restaurant Cuvee My husband and I we did not like include the curb appeal. It does not have the best look from the outside, but the inside is great. We were happy with our stay and would return if we were not curious to try other locations in Napa. Platypus wine tours were able to pick us up from the hotel. I believe they can set up in room spa services.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with nice little touches”
Reviews.Author: chris1jadesfire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights during a 2 week tour and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It was my birthday during our stay and the hotel provided some little complimentary treats. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and efficiently arranged a vineyard tour for us the following day Our room was a delux riverview suite and was very spacious and pleasantly decorated with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Complementary breakfast was nice, though a little crowded as the seating area was not big enough. There was also an evening turn-down service, complementary tea& coffee and water. The checkin process was quite clumsy - we had booked through lastminute and there was no record of our booking. They remained professional and friendly and accepted our confirmation slip and booked us in, however we received an invoice (in error) on the last morning as we had already prepaid. Staff were however apologetic

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Napa river...”
Reviews.Author: jsaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over Thanksgiving holiday. Location...loved the proximity to the Napa river, downtown, & the Wine Train station. You can walk a mile or so to downtown. There was road construction which made the walk a bit of an obstacle course. Facilities...small outdoor pool, nice work out room, lobby bar, continental breakfast room, outdoor terrace with river view. There is a wide path along the river which can be used for walking, running, or biking. Our room was around 300sf, with flat screen TV, large walk in dual head shower(no tub), sofa, desk, wired computer hookup, refrigerator, & coffee maker. Some rooms have balconies with river views. Valet parking is available. Self-parking is convenient to access rooms. Service...staff @ check-in, lobby bar, continental breakfast, & room service was very good. Overall...like a very good Hampton Inn. We had a great stay. Pricing seems to vary substantially depending on dates & packages.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value, family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: IrisO01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights as a family of five. The hotel is quite nice, centrally located and comes with a lot of extras included in the price: WiFi, DVD rental, breakfast buffet(eggs, potatoes, sausages, fruit, cereal, bagels, pastries, juices and coffee or tea). The rooms were nice, very clean (could be a bit larger) and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: aznnature
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and were very impressed by the hotel and its staff. They were very courteous and helpful. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of the Napa Wine Train station, their dinner selection was delicious, and the option to rent DVDs from the front desk was a nice touch too for me. Overall, my husband and I would definitely go back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Lauren111279
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn right in the heart of Napa from 10/27 to 10/30 and we were very pleased with it. If you don't want to spend $400/night for a 5-star hotel this is such a great substitute. First off, parking is free and they have ample parking. You are in the center of town (the wineries are about a 20-25 minute drive on Hwy 29 which is a lovely and leisurely drive and affords you the opportunity to see so many wineries). The room is clean, modern and spacious enough for two. We had a king deluxe. Our view was the front of the hotel but this is not the Caribbean and I wasn't looking for a scenic view. The bathroom was great...room had all the amenities you need. The staff came around every afternoon with free water and there was a newspaper delivered everyday to your room. Breakfast was complimentary daily and it was just the right amount of food. Coffee, several types of juice, teas, and then your choice of muffins, pastries, bagels, toast and fresh fruit. Not to mention cereal and hot food like eggs and bacon. No complaints. You need to understand that you are getting a lot of items for a great price. It's not the Ritz and they dont want to be. It's a nice, quiet, clean spot in a central location that also gives you some additions free-bee's like breakfast. I forgot to bring toothpaste and they had on site free toiletries to take as you needed. They also have a pool, gym and a bar and free room Internet which was nice. If I visit Napa again, I would definitely stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not Judge a Book by its Cover”
Reviews.Author: mandm070359
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights here wtih another couple while we visited wineries in Napa and Sonoma. When we first drove up it looked a bit like a chain hotel. When you enter the foyer you are greeted by a warm and nicely decorated area with nice comfy furniture and fireplaces. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the rooms were very comfortable. Ours had a balcony over the front entrance/parking lot. If we were to go back I would ask for a room over the river as we were on 2nd floor and we could hear the buses load up early each morning with their guests. Breakfast offers a great selection which you can enjoy inside in a dining area, in the foyer or outside on the terrace. There is a fireplace (with 4 fires) that you can sit by as well. They also offer outdoor heaters for cooler days. All staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and always greeted us as we left and came back to the hotel. I would recommend this Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute, couldn't fault the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonBoy81
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from the 10th October. We arrived about 2pm to be warmly welcomed by the hotel receptionist, i didn't get her name but she was lovely, made us feel very welcomed and gave us good local information. We stayed in room 335, one of there King river view deleuxe rooms. It was exactly what we wanted and more.... The room was huge, big king size bed which was so comfortable, seating area, outside balcony to sit and enjoy coffee in the mornings and wine in the evenigs while watching the river and best of all the Jacuzzi bath. I had arranged for the Champagne and Strawberries package with a little extra... Cara's Cupcakes to be in our room as a surprise for my partner. When we entered there was a little note for him to look in the fridge and there sat a platter of 12 mini cupcakes. Next thing a knock at the door, the bellboy was there with our champagne. We never received the strawberries but i didn't mind as they had gone out of there way to get the cupcakes. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Napa town centre which has some amazing restaurants. The hotel is very clean and quiet which was perfect after 6 days sightseeing in San Francisco. The hotel very kindly arranged for us to go on a wine tour with Platypus Tours, i highly recommend them, there was only 11 of us and we went to 4 small wineries, tried some great wine and meet some lovely people. The tour guide Steve was really informative and laid on a good picnic for lunch. We ate at the Curee restaurant next door the first night, the food was divine and the wine even better. The waitress was lovely, clearly new and made a few simple mistakes but nothing you would complain about. The next night we ate at Celedon, the food and service were great. Everything tasted so fresh. Our last night, we stayed at the hotel and ate by the fire pit, the food was good, a few items they had ran out of but we didn't mind, it was just lovely to spend the last night relaxing in great surroundings, then we got a dvd from the library cracked open a bottle of wine in the room and chilled. A brilliant end to an amazing trip. My only negative point is we couldn't have stayed longer, we will be back and we will stay longer. Tip:Hire a car, create a picnic and head off into the mountains, truely beautiful and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to see Napa”
Reviews.Author: zalna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn from October 4th to October 7th. We had booked the room through Expedia and we were supposed to get a room with 2 beds. When we checked in our room wasn't ready and the front desk attendant informed us that we were actually booked into a room with 1 King bed and that they were full and couldn't accommodate us with 2 beds. I showed her the confirmation and she replied that it would be impossible to get a room with 2 beds but we could have one with a King and a sleeper sofa. Thankfully this was not the tone of the rest of our stay. We returned 2 hours later and we're given a room with 2 beds. All other interactions with staff at the hotel were pleasant and enjoyable. We enjoyed having breakfast outside next to the River and next to the fire pit. The hotel was the perfect place to stay to walk into downtown old Napa and tour wineries. The beds were very comfortable and everyone got a great nights sleep. I would definitely stay at the hotel again and look forward to returning next time I'm in Napa. If I do book through a third party travel agency again I would call ahead to make sure that the requested room is indeed booked with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace Inn - Great choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: ZygerImports
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Napa and decided to stay at the River Terrace Inn. We chose them for the location and reasonable rate (pay for 2, stay for 3 special). The room was very comfortable. Our package included the river view with balcony and jacuzzi tub. The staff was great, and the hotel was walking distance from restaurants and the wine train. They also have a good buffet breakfast. No powdered eggs here.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Basic Base”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: The key to enjoying this (or any hotel) is making an informed choice. I observe that complaints mainly stem from unmet, unrealistic expectations or travelers inability to ask for what they want when they are at a property. Some of the poor reviews that I read here in advance had me worried enough that I sent a query to the general manager. Thank goodness that he reassured me and my husband and we went through with our plans for a 3-night stay. Here’s the scoop; the River Terrace Inn is not a quaint little B&B or a name-brand luxury hotel. Perhaps the Inn does itself a bit of a disservice by describing itself as “luxury boutique,” as it’s more like a Holiday Inn with a few more personal touches. (The elevators and hallways have that sort of feel.) That being said, River Terrace Inn is a super-comfortable medium-sized hotel with a convenient edge-of-town location, ideal as a Napa/Sonoma touring base. We chose their premium room, a Riverview Deluxe Balcony Jacuzzi, a great value for the region with their 3rd-night free special. We indeed had a nice river view and enjoyed the sound of birds in the morning and crickets at night. (I think that I would have found the atmosphere a little too industrial with a “village” side room, but the third floor river view was just pastoral enough, yet within an easy walk of downtown.) The room itself was spacious with places to keep everything from our luggage to picnic supplies and wine purchases. The bed was comfy, but add my husband to the list of guests who found the bed sheet and mattress pad undone by morning. Everything worked well, from Internet service to the Jacuzzi for two, (plenty of hot water) to the in-room fridge and coffeemaker. We had “good neighbors” during our stay, but were aware that noise between rooms was a potential problem. Breakfast was not anything the Culinary Institute of America would endorse, but there were adequate choices to get the day going and it was pleasant to eat on the riverside outdoor patio with the gas fireplace and heaters taking off the morning chill. Parking was ample and convenient and, like breakfast and internet service, included in the room rate. We never saw a concierge at the lobby desk, but had we desired help, there was always at least one staff person in view to ask. We were offered luggage assistance and (free) valet parking when we arrived and I am sure that we could have asked for help upon departure too. My intent in writing this review is not to damn the Inn with faint praise, but to be honest, so as not to raise expectations and create disappointment for future guests. We were looking for a comfortable and quiet, but not fussy base for our wine country getaway and that is what we found at the River Terrace Inn. We would be happy to return

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Hoser
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. It's in an awesome location with only about a 10-15 minute walk down to all the great restaurants on First and Second streets. We enjoyed our top floor (3rd) room facing the river. Very quiet and peaceful for a glass (bottle) of wine! 10 foot ceilings are a great touch. Huge room and bath. Very nice and boutique like. |The breakfast is very good and I know hotel breakfasts as I travel 100 nights a year on business. Lots of hot options like eggs, bacon/sausage, hashbrowns. Nice outside terrace to eat breakfast if you'd rather eat outside. Patio heaters at each table for those cool mornings. Found the staff to be excellent and very informative abour tours, restaurants etc. Make sure you try the restaurant on site for dinner! It was absolutely awesome. So much so that we told our server we would be back the next night. He politely told us we really should try a couple of restaurants in the downtown area. We were gald we did as they were amazing too! Celadon had the best food we have ever had and we have traveled all over the carribean/hawaii/USA/Canada. Amazing food there but also amazing at the hotels restaurant. Try both! We had a mid week special (Mon-Thurs) where you stay 2 nights and get the third night free. Our rate was $179 per night and we felt it would have even been worth it had we had to pay for the third night. We stayed in the main building. I think that would be better than the sattelite building. We are 3,500 miles from Napa but we WILL return and we WILL stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Helena8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days, whilst staying here we got married in St Helena, we stay here with our young child and several other family members. All I can say is the service we received from all the staff were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. Very flexiable as we made a few requests and these were all dealt with very quickly. The room was very clean and well laid out, our beds were very comfortable. Food available at the bar was excellent, staff were flexible and extremely helpful. We could not be in a better location for all the good restaurants, little shops etc.. (just a walk away). The pool although small was hardly used, always clean with good pool towels to hand (we used the pool everyday). Our wedding was beautiful and it really was really nice to come back to the hotel. A special thanks to Tony who managed to get my belongings which I left in the room and arranged to Fed Ex them to another address in CA (received a couple of days later) he was very helpful and made the necessary arrangements to send to me. We didn't get to do as much as we would like, as there is so much to see & do. We will definitely be back for future anniversaries!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn while on tour with Uncommon Journeys, which is a fabulous tour operator. We arrived late in the evening after a long train ride, so we were happily amazed at how quick our check in proceeded. The rooms were very roomy, very clean, but our view of the parking lot wasn't a perk. The only problem was with the down pillows, which once changed with lumpy foam ones took away from a great night's sleep. The lobby and bar area is very cozy with a large fireplace. They do not serve any alcohol except beer and wine, so if you prefer a liquor, you'll need to bring your own. The outdoor patio area is the best spot to sit above the river and enjoy an excellent meal. It has a large gas fire pit and heaters, which were very appreciated on the cold evenings. In the morning, they provided a huge free buffet, and the fireplace was lit when chilly. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “It was just lovely”
Reviews.Author: beachgalSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very clean. The setting is beautiful. I appreciated how quiet it was. Breakfast was super! Also the staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rooms have bad chemical smell -- avoid this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lh_1996
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, both had bad chemical smell. One is so bad that my son had to hold his nose when he stepped into the room. We switched this room. The smell in the other room is not as bad. Which, actually made things worse. As my parents stayed in that room and only my mom was bothered by the smell. She thought that she had to live with it as she thought that this is a cheap hotel... Apparently the air quality in this hotel is pretty bad. Feel sorry for the people who could not smell the chemicals, which got into their body without knowing. Also, the "4 stars" hotel has "2 stars" hotel bedding... unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: flashy001
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were touring California and this hotel was the best out of the seven others we stayed at during our two week holiday. Facilites were great, room large and immaculately clean. Many thoughtful touches added to a wonderful stay and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “it was OK”
Reviews.Author: reymic
Reviews.Content: good value for the money if you are really just there to visit wineries. typical small hotel, our room as OK. the cleaning service was the only negative i had, just didn't do a good job with replenshing items in the bathroom, cleaning up, etc. this was our first trip out to napa, having been there now - i would not stay in this area. there was tons of construction out front on soscol avenue. i would have stayed more in the downtown area, or in sonoma for more of a relaxed country feel. the breakfast in the morning was appreciated, it wasn't great - but bagels, eggs, cereals, coffee and juices were better than having to leave the hotel. there was nothing wrong with the hotel, i would probably not stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: suzykzr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the River Terrace Inn was wonderful - the staff was so friendly! Eric, the bartender who helped us the first night, was so much fun to chat with. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the location!”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in mid-July and were very pleased with the hotel. The setting is beautiful with the fire pit on the lovely patio area out back, next to a walking trail and the river. The breakfast buffet was hearty and tasty and we enjoyed our food out on this patio each morning. The hotel offers free DVD checkout from the front desk which we took advantage of. The staff was always pleasant and helpful with restaurant recommendations and locations. Our room was large and overlooked the river. The bed was out of this world comfy and I loved the unusual bath products! I ran the Napa to Sonoma half marathon and took advantage of the whirlpool tub in the room after my run and it was pure heaven! The hotel was close enough to walk to the Oxnard market and into downtown. Our friend traveled with us and stayed in the room across the hall from us. We took advantage of the swimming pool on the first day and it was small but perfect for lounging and sunning. I would definitely stay at the River Terrace Inn again if staying in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: j_r_j_2626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn last July to celebrate our first wedding anniversary, and had a wonderful stay. The river-view room we stayed in was very clean, comfortable, and luxurious, and we wish we could have stayed more than the 2 nights we did! The continental breakfast each morning was good, and we especially enjoyed being able to dine out on the back patio, then take a stroll along the river. The hotel's location to the "city center" of Napa was very close, and it is literally next door to the Napa Valley Wine Train station. The only drawback is the price - but it is well worth it! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: terriam
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Friday Night at the River Terrace Inn, for a Saturday Visit to the Napa Wine Country. This was my first stay in Napa and I had sticker-shock from at other B&Bs. We stayed in a River View room with a jacuzzi tub, the room was tastefully furnished and with included buffet breakfast, it had the class & romance to start off our getaway perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: travelingteachers24
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at this wonderful hotel. Property perfectly located in Napa, not far from the main Highway 29 . Rooms were very spacious and well appointed. Bathroom was huge and included a double head shower. Great morning buffet breakfast. A nice touch was the bikes they offered that allowed you to take a quick spin beside the Napa river. A wonderful patio is located at the back of the hotel that overlooks the river. An ideal spot for nice glass of wine and wonderful company.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed yet reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: vlh57
Reviews.Content: From the first friendly interaction at the check-in desk, to a delicious complimentary breakfast on the rivers edge, our stay was a total delight. I wish my bathroom at home was so beautiful. The bed comfort was exceptional. The balcony (even on the parking lot side) a beautiful feature. A perfect location for all that is Napa Valley. We will be back and stay longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Wine Country getaway to Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the River Terrace Inn - Napa over the 4th of July weekend, and were very pleased with our choice of this hotel. I'd looked online for hotels that had nice amenities, and were easy to get to. I selected the Riverview Deluxe room with Jacuzzi and Balcony, which was on the 3rd (top) floor. The picture of the view on the website was exactly the view from our room...a lovely setting overlooking the Napa River. The room was very comfortable, with King size bed, sitting area with couch and desk, and a small deck. The description of the room on the website was very accurate. The bathroom had a granite counter top, tiled floor, and a large Jacuzzi tub with 2 showerheads. There is a bar on the main level with a nice selection of wines or most spirits...and the atmosphere is great. The staff were very attentive to our needs, and front desk clerks were very helpful and efficient. We didn't use the services of the Concierge, but I heard him assisting another couple with setting up appts. for wine tasting and dinner reservations...sounded very helpful. Each morning there was a complimentary full breakfast...scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage, bacon, fruit, pastries, granola, and yogurt...plus a variety of juices, etc. We loved our stay, and would go back again. It was very nice to get the special package price too...stay 3 nights for the price of 2.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JzW
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that there is nothing bad about the hotel, just that it is not worth the price of the river view room. Basically, the hotel is a Hampton Inn type hotel on the Napa river. If you go in with that expectation, you won't be disappointed. The hotel is clean, the staff is nice. The rooms are (in my opinion) average in size and furnishings. Our rate for a river view room was around $300 and the room we were provided had a view of the river, but was located on the 2nd floor directly over an awning and the patio. There was not another room available and we decided not to stay at the hotel. The staff was very good about it and canceled our reservation with no charges. We then went to another hotel in downtown Napa and for about the same price got a room that was larger in a newer hotel with amenities (like central air conditioning) and furnishings that literally blew the doors off of the River Terrace Inn. We did sacrifice the view, but it was more than worth it. In summary, if you like the Hampton Inn and Courtyard by Marriott class hotels and are ok with the River Terrace Inn prices, then you will probably have a good stay at the River Terrace Inn. If you want something nicer for the price, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: krbPalmDesert_CA
Reviews.Content: River Terrace Inn in Napa, CA is a winner! After reading poor reviews of several hotels in Napa, I came across good comments on this one. I booked & paid ahead online to get a very good rate (for Napa area!). Lobby with wine bar very attractive, check-in early was no problem, room was wonderful with small refrigerator, and bathroom set-up very good. Cleanliness was not an issue! Full breakfast was included. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the cost for the river view”
Reviews.Author: MNTourist08
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location and the room was large and clean. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We were able to walk to the wine train in just 3 minutes. Breakfast was great and enjoyed on the outdoor patio. Didn't use the free wine tickets for the neighboring restaurant Cuvee but thought it was a nice gesture (menu looked great). Only complaint - not sure that it was worth the $340 that we paid for a riverview deluxe balcony with jacuzzi (Room#203). The balcony was TINY and my only view from the chair was of the railing and parking lot below. Also, I could smell my "neighbors" out smoking on their balcony. Total disappointment because I had envisioned sitting out there to enjoy my morning coffee as suggested on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: acorreia984
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Napa and we chose to stay at the River Terrace Inn based on it's price and great reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel was great. We got checked in right away. We had a standard room which was really quite nice. The king size bed was very comfortable. There was a cute little balcony with two chairs and a table. The bathroom is very nice. Great tile work and a nice large shower with double shower heads. The hotel has done a very good job with upkeep. Included with your stay is a free hot breakfast every morning which is great. It's good to get food in you before you start your day of wine tasting! As for the location....River Terrace Inn is located in downtown Napa. It's about a 5-10 minute drive to the Silverado Trail which is where the wineries begin. This is the reason the price is so great. If you want to stay up in the hills where the wineries are you will easily pay $400 a night for a decent room. We enjoyed the location. The drive isn't bad at all. It's actually really beautiful. And the location of the River Terrace Inn within downtown is great. You can walk everywhere. We walked to dinner every night. There was a chef street fair one night off Main St. that was great. We walked there as well. Overall the hotel and stay was fabulous. When we go back to Napa (we're already plannin another trip next year during harvest season) we will definitely stay at River Terrace Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff"”
Reviews.Author: lehpares
Reviews.Content: Really nice place, me and my girlfriend stayed there for one night but we would love to stay a couple nights more, the hotel is very peaceful and is near of everything you need in Napa. Everything is in walk-distance from the hotel. The consierge was very nice and kind, always with a smile on his face. The breakfast was really good, not a classic continental, but a very good breakfast with scrambled eggs, fruits, juice, bread and cereal. The best part: included in the fare. The hotel is a little bit pricy, if you compare with other hotels in California, but due to the location, area and what you would get, is ok, you wouldn't find something better in Napa for that price. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to the High-Priced Spread”
Reviews.Author: threeonrtheroad
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here with my husband & teen daughter. We had a lovely suite with a small balcony overlooking the river. The room was large and comfortable; the bathroom was spacious and offers a double shower head. The stone terrace was a great place to enjoy breakfast, or a glass of wine in the evening. The fire pit and heaters keep the space comfortable even on a chilly evening. The location offered easy access to both St. Helena and Silverado Highway and is walking distance to the wine train and Oxbow marketplace. Best of all: it's about half the price of the "big name" hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bellababyflorida
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband were celebrating his 60th birthday in March and we waited until the weather was warmer in California. Since we are from Florida and are use to hotter weather. When we got to our hotel they were so pleasant, our room was a balconey over the back of the hotel w/ view of the Napa River. Very peaceful. The hotel decor was very neutral, comfortable and pleasant to be in. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the bathoom w/ jacuzzi and dbl headed shower. We had plenty of space, counter space and quiet. We loved the breakfast display daily, though the options didn't change daily, it had plenty of choices. We ate outside daily in lovely surroundings, gas lite fireplace outside as well. We had dinner outside there w/ our bottle of wine on 2 of our nights we stayed there, no driving a bonus! But really the ambience was enjoyable. and the staff were all very pleasant. I would definately stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: uig2003
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this place I had high expectations and was not disappointed. We had a king river view room with a balcony. The room was extremely spacious and had all of the amenities that I was looking for (Jacuzzi tub for two, mini fridge, balcony with view, couch area for sitting). The only thing I didn't love about the room were the pillows. I didn't find them comfortable but that was probably more personal preference than anything. There was breakfast available every morning which was a nice touch. They did serve the same items each day so toward the end of our trip it got slightly monotonous but overall it was good. It would have been nice to see more of a variety from day to day. We ordered room service one evening which was very fast and quite tasty. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They helped us ship our wine back home for us which was a really nice feature. I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingcouple01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I researched and researched places to stay on our trip to Napa. We wanted to stay somewhere nice and memorable, but not end up spending a fortune as hotel prices in the area can easily soar sky high. The River Terrace Inn is defintely worth the reasonable price. The hotel was very clean and new with huge rooms with high ceilings and granite countertops. The service was impeccable and every staff we encountered went out of their way to enhance our stay. The complimentary breakfast was also very good and added to the value of the price of the room. The heated outdoor pool was a great touch to our stay as well. The restaraunt was good and with our check in came two complimentary passes for a glass of wine to use during our stay. The hotel is walking distance from downtown which was convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly hotel near downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: When I made reservations for the hotel I was a little concerned about traffic noise as the hotel property was close to a busy Napa street. But it's far enough away to be quiet. I paid extra for a room on the river and I'm glad I did. The room was large, the bed very comfortable and the bath was excellent, as it had double shower heads by Speakman. They also had a small refrigerator for our wine. You are a short walk to downtown Napa which was pretty dreary. It is a short drive to wineries on the Valley floor, and Yountville restaurants. Service was great. The concierge checked us in and made a reservation with a local wine tour company when I had trouble connecting with them. He gave us good recommendations for a local wine tasting room and a place to get food for take out. The included breakfast buffet was excellent with scrambled eggs, potatoes and meat, along with fruit and pasty. Coffee was so/so.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Napa, River Terrace”
Reviews.Author: lonestar_country
Reviews.Content: If you plan overnight stay in Napa, we strongly recommend River Terrace Inn. Top notch, just few blocks from downtown shops/restaurants/etc. Everything about RT Inn was great and morning breakfast-coffee was delicious. Also do the wine-train tour, you will love it, great food,relaxing ride, a must for everyone. Also Sterling Vineyard is terrific too, we recommend. Enjoy downtown Joes-Pub and consider Taqueria Rosita for tacos/rice-beans just 1 block away, Tue's is $2 night and deliciously good food, don't let the decor scare ya away. Enjoy Napa, we did, drive safe. Nelson

Reviews.Title: “Excelent, Excelent, Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: avidjeeper
Reviews.Content: My fiance's parents payed for us to stay here last year for her birthday (Napa limo wine tour) and loved it. It has a full service bar and a very nice outdoor area with a fire pit next to the river. The rooms are top notch. Very clean and comfortable. This year their getting us a spa room with a balcony facing the river!! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value”
Reviews.Author: peonyqueen7
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the River Terrace Inn in Napa twice, once in 2004 right after it opened and at the end of our honeymoon in 2008. We have stayed in a city view room (really parking lot view, but enjoyed the cozy terrace anyway) and a river view room. Both were clean, quiet and comfortable. Simple but elegantly appointed bathrooms, friendly staff, great bar. There is also great wine in the mini-bar should you not get your fill during the day! This is a perfect place from which to explore Napa, especially if you are doing tons of activities and/or a wine tour. It is a lot less expensive than the hotels up-valley but unless you are spending a large amount of time in the hotel, it is a fantastic base. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: CtRunning_Man
Reviews.Content: The Inn was comfortable, clean, and the room was very small. The breakfast was good. We had a special fall rate, which made the cost acceptable. I'm not sure I can say the Inn was up to the rave reviews I read before and after we stayed. Maybe we missed something. We would stay there again if we were able to get in on a special rate, but not the normally advertised rates. The room was the smallest room at a hotel, motel, or Inn we've stayed since a B&B in Scotland many years ago. Only one chair in the room and barely room for that chair. Must have been the time of year, as the Napa River would be classified as a quiet, slow moving creek in most of the country. Glad I didn't pay extra for a river view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms, Good Value, Great Housekeeping and weak front desk”
Reviews.Author: Karkman
Reviews.Content: The rooms were up to date, very clean and housekeeping was top notch. Would stay there again without hesitation. All the staff was very nice and really wanted to be helpful. Cons: Inexperience at the Front desk. Did not help on request for more pillows and when called for other questions they would let the phone ring way too long. Also no help on recommendations for dining in the area. Buffet Breakfast is overly average as are all hotels that do not have a regular restaurant. Go to Black Bear Cafe down the street for breakfast. Please know that they get the really important things right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie54_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to the Napa Valley and had a wonderful stay at the River Terrace Inn. I was a little nervous because I had read a few, although not many, unfavorable reviews on the internet. The hotel was fabulous and the staff was very friendly. The room, a double queen with baloney, was very nice and although the balcony looked over the parking lot, it also looked toward the mountains and we saw lovely sunsets in the evening. The hotel is conveniently located and we had no trouble getting around. Breakfast was wonderful with a nice selection. There was not a large variety from day to day, but the food was good with a choice of eggs, potatoes, a meat, fruit, pastries, granola, and coffee cake. don't miss the coffee cake, especially if you can get it when it comes out warm - yum! We got a great rate with the AARP discount. Be sure to check all rates before booking!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value near Napa River”
Reviews.Author: davisbikie
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for business and pleasure! We stayed for one night to celebrate a family birthday. The staff was wonderful. Upper end hotels are still charging for internet access. This one does not. It provdes wired and wireless connections for free. They even lend out fully loaded laptops for free...amazing. There is even a computer and printer in the lobby for easy use. The decor is very nice with a gas-fired fireplace and ample seating in the lobby and a gas-heated outside seating area adjacent to the Napa River. The Napa Valley Wine Train is a 5 minute walk to the South. There are also numerous dining choices within easy walking distance. If you don't care to walk, I heard good comments about the Cuvee restaurant next to the hotel. The Sunday buffet was the only weak spot. The pastries were stale, the granola partially burned and the rest rather unexciting. The rooms were spacious and beds comfortable. We didn't try the pool because of the wether. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was there now!”
Reviews.Author: lynnlorr
Reviews.Content: We had a 3rd floor room overlooking the river. After we settled in, we went down to the patio and enjoyed appetizers and wine next to the fire pit. It was one of the most enjoyable meals of our trip! Then, morning coffee on the balcony, a soft drizzle of rain on the river, the sounds of nature...so very relaxing!!! The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: vette77
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed staying here. When asked, the front desk attendant didn't hesitate to help us plan our one full day in Napa (great suggestions, too!). The hotel and room were both attractive and clean. Our room faced the river, and had a king bed, jacuzzi tub and a balcony. We found the hotel to be exceptionally quiet. Loved the double headed shower! Food is available in the main floor bar area, and room service from the nearby restaurant is also available. The complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent. You can spend a lot of money for hotels in the Napa area.This hotel is well located and offers great value. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sweethearttraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. I honestly have no complaints. There were so many perks.. The front desk was very helpful. We were allowed to check in a little early, which was nice. It was our Anniversary and we were upgraded to a River View King room with Jacuzzi Tub; there was complimentary champagne for us also!! The view was very nice and the balcony had enough room for us to sit and sip some wine. The bed was so comfortable and the block out shades were a nice touch. The breakfast was really good too. Housekeeping did a great job and they even have turn down service. Free internet, a huge DVD movie library and a nice bar in the lobby. We ordered room service.. that was even good. I could hear the tv next door some of the time..but that was not a strike against the hotel at all. The area is convenient.. close to the wine train and Oxbow Market. We did some wine tasting and it was only about 10 min drive to any wineries. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; excellent breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Desertparty
Reviews.Content: River Terrace Inn provides great value for the $. While you could find fancier rooms and hotels, this place provides great bang for the buck. They provide numerous freebies, including a buffet breakfast, DVD rentral and internet service. Service at the hotel is outstanding. The rooms are good, but the bathrooms are great with the jacuzzi tub and double headed shower. Get the rooms on the top floor, as the walls are a bit thin, and we heard noise coming from the third floor to our room on the second. We would stay there again. It's a great way to save some money to spend on wine!

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, cozy, accommodating”
Reviews.Author: chichilv
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything that we wanted for a relaxing, romantic trip to Napa Valley. It was easy to get to and the staff was excellent. All of the bartender/servers were very accommodating. Everything that the hotel offered was of good quality. The breakfast was very impressive. Good food and lots of variety. Fitness room was clean and spacious with water and towels. We had lunch outside on the terrace twice, overlooking the river, and the paninis were delicious. Some of the rooms have balconies in the back overlooking the river. The firepit on the terrace was really nice, as well as, the fireplace in the bar area. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Wine Train”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Marius
Reviews.Content: It was clean, and our room had a view of the river and a jacuzzi. We only stayed over night, so we didn't have the opportunity to get a good feel for the place. It seemed desolate, but then again all of Napa was like a ghost town. I'm guessing that is to be expected during the off season with the economy the way it is. Not the best place to stay if you are looking for some night time action (which I suspect doesn't exist in Napa), but if you're looking for a quite, clean, and EXPENSIVE place to rest your head, then I suppose this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CarolinSt
Reviews.Content: ... and nice people in the reception. The concierge helped us to organise our wine tour last minute and we had a really good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: jcplaywright
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast. Lots of options. The room was spacious. Comfortable. Nice bathroom. The front desk was helpful, polite, going the extra mile when asked. The hotel has an array of travel books - that I borrowed. They also have winery tasting coupons - ask them!!! We were disappointed to find our room was bottom floor, facing parking lot, by the generator. Front desk was unable to move us - until night 2, so we kept the blinds closed and didn't bother. Strongly suggest RIVER VIEW!!!! Location wise, it's convenient, BUT right off a main road, so not a particularly pretty spot (although the back is nice)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: j57
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The staff were execellent. The hotel and grounds were pristine and the hotel iteself looks like it has been remodeled in recent years. A great place to stay. However, the walls between rooms are incredibly thin. I was awoken the first night we stayed there by the people next door. We could hear every single word they were saying, and they were not terribly loud. I'm suprised a hotel of this calibre would have such cheap and shoddy walls, especially since the rest of the hotel and furnishings are so nice. If it were not for that, the experience would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: This hotel really has it all, location, staff, and grounds. The hotel has amazing river view rooms and it seems like every extra you can imagine. Free parking, free internet, free laptop rental, free dvd rental, free breakfast etc. The bar is very well priced, a store bottle which runs 20 bucks is only 30 bucks in the bar, not to bad a mark up.I would suggest having a bottle outside under the heaters or near the fire pit, great time. The hotel itself is spotless and nice, its an Inn with the feel of a 4 star luxury hotel. The Westin next door was extremely stuffy when I went. The Westin appeared to be more geared towards the over weight dudes in expensive suites with plastic wives type group. I really don't enjoy the pretend we have money in a leased car crowd. I highly recommend the River Terrace Inn, its got a great location and you can walk anywhere you want. I suggest staying in the downtown area, some outer lying areas seemed to attract the homeless drinker crowds. You must go to Bounty Hunter Wine and BBQ it is unbelievable, sampling BBQ with Wine was a hit for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Inn Experience Probably Ever!”
Reviews.Author: runnerchic79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at a number of nice hotels/inns/B&B's/etc. for business and pleasure, and the River Terrace Inn is one of the best experiences we have ever had. The room decor is very nice and the bed perfect, a not too soft pillow top mattress. The included breakfast is very good and substantial, eggs, potatoes and sausage or bacon every morning along with their homemade granola, fruit, and an assortment of breads and pastries. There is turn down service including bottled water for an extra special touch. The huge fire pit and heaters out back make the back make the back patio really enjoyable even in cooler weather. We also liked the huge binder of free rentable DVDs to choose from. Any need that my husband and I had was met with quick and friendly assistance. We were able to walk to anywhere we wanted to eat downtown, and it was a convenient drive to HWY 29 or the Silverado Trail for all of our winery visits. Also, parking is plentiful and free. I would stay there again and would highly recommend it to any friend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury little Italy!”
Reviews.Author: rillabylund
Reviews.Content: Incredible!! Clean great service, comfy beds, double-headed showers, bath & body works products, continental breakfast, walking distance to downtown, marble bathrobes, DVD rentals, complimentary turnover and bottled water!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Windfeld-C
Reviews.Content: Many online booking sites had higher rates for this hotel compared to the Marriott not far away. It takes a lot to impress me but maybe I just didn't expect much. The rooms were not huge, but large enough for a any European traveller :) I liked the wooden lobby with the fireplace - breakfast was served here in the morning and in the evening it made a great gathering spot for a drink and/or conversation. You're not far from the vineyards at the River Terrace Inn. It takes probably 10-15 minutes to get to the main highway going North towards St. Helena. Quiet location, great staff and in general an impressive place to spend a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Two Sista's having a girls Weekend of Relaxation and wine”
Reviews.Author: LliketoGO
Reviews.Content: I just have to say this hotel exceeded me and my sisters expectations! We stayed for only one night just to have a girls weekend in the wine country away from kids..we wanted a place that fulfilled our relaxation needs: Quiet, near water and greenery, lots of wine, jacuzzi bath tub, bath and body work products, GREATEST customer service, huge King size bed, spacious room, flat screen tv and in house massages! We didn't want to leave the room, we rented complimentary dvds and hung out. Our first day we went to Greenhaus Spa - I don't recommend it..TOO pricey and the service was below average, my muscles still ached and they seem like swindlers, I asked for a basic 30 min. facial and Stephanie took it upon herself to give me an hour one which was 100.00-OUch! Well, that was the only negative about our weekend rendezvous..We ordered delivery from Cuvee..it was So-so..nothing to brag about. You really need to stay at least 2 nights, but we're on a budget with this suckey economy so we did what we could. Again, the staff at the hotel were excellent, the walls of the room are somewhat thin, so I could hear the tv in the next room (around 2am) I'm an extremely light sleeper, so I called the front desk and they took care of the problem within 5 minutes! Gotta Luv It!! It was well worth the money for one night of quiet wine country relaxation-$209..beautiful view of the river, mountains and trees and a full YuMMy breakfast-eggs, sausages and potatoes-I want to go back right now!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: megan9927
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King Jacuzzi room on a trip to Napa for our 5 year anniversary. The rooms were very clean and pretty with a balcony overlooking the Napa river. The free breakfast is a nice way to start the day. They also give you a few coupons for free tastings/glasses of wine when checking in. The free dvd rental was nice too for nights we wanted to relax. My husband and I each had a twilight massage where they come to your room which was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel when staying in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful inn”
Reviews.Author: smacks17
Reviews.Content: service and rooms were great. the complimentary breakfast on the terrace was especially relaxing. we even got a voucher for a free glass of wine at couve, the restaurant across the street. the restaurant (great food) also delivers room service! we had a great time and would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Base to explore the Wine Region”
Reviews.Author: Oxford_Member
Reviews.Content: Really nice, clean Hotel which makes a great base to explore. Friendly service and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn for New Year's Eve and the following night. They had a very nice and affordable package that included New Year's Eve dinner at Cuvee next door (an elegant and excellent restaurant). This hotel would have cost a lot more before the recession, so now is definitely the time to go to the Napa Valley. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations on things to do on New Year's Day when a lot of businesses were closed. We found the bed to be a bit firm for our taste but other than that, we loved the room. The Inn is walking distance to downtown Napa and there is also a movie theater nearby.
