It's a nice place to stay if you want to do some wine tasting at tasting rooms downtown instead of driving to wineries and having to worry about drinking and driving. The wine bar at the hotel is very nice and reasonably priced, too. The DVD lending library is a very nice touch, as is the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “So Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: queenoftheu
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went up to Napa for a romantic getaway, and we couldn't have been more pleased with the River Terrace Inn! The service was top notch, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms had everything we could possibly want, and the breakfast was outstanding (Make sure you try their granola!)! We're already planning our next stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: bgAlaska
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most comfortable hotels/inns that I have stayed in! The room was everything you could need or want. Great bathroom, huge shower, great water pressure. The king bed was extremely comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast was good. Beautiful setting on the river, free internet and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on River in Napa”
Reviews.Author: HoustonFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We had a second floor room that overlooked the river. The hotel is well kept, with a nice lobby/bar and outside patio overlooking the river for eating, drinking or just meeting friends. Front desk was efficient. Our room was nice, clean and quiet with sitting area, desk, king bed, mini-fridge and coffee area and a nice bath. Parking was plentiful. You could walk to the nearby markets to buy meals or to buy picnic supplies. There is a running/walking path along the river but it is rather short - hopefully it will be extended in the future. The only meals we ate here were the buffet breakfast which had a good selection and seemed to always be fresh. The "gym" was tiny and the outdoor pool small. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: she1gal
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my husband and grown son while visiting my daughter. Although she is in the wine industry, this hotel was new to her (built four years ago) and even she was impressed with the atmosphere. It is in a wonderful location, within walking distance of both food and entertainment. Our rooms had river views, as requested, and were spacious and comfortable. Free DVD and wireless were just two of the many extras we discovered here. The complimentary breakfast was adequate and had fresh fruit & juices. The hotels backs up to the river, with benches and a paved walk along the river. There's a fire pit on the patio; If you're looking for wine country ambiance, this is a nice start. And, Cuvee, just in front of the hotel, was excellent for lunch or dinner. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SWfromSV
Reviews.Content: River Terrace Inn is a great value for Napa Valley. Conveniently located in downtown Napa, it is within walking distance of Oxbow Market, restaurants, wine train, farmers' market and tasting rooms. We have stayed at this hotel twice and were impressed with the speed of check-in and friendliness of the staff. Rooms and baths are clean and spacious with comfortable beds, pluch linens, refrigerator, coffee maker, and nice toiletries. Our rooms have had walk-in showers which are safer to enter. Hot breakfast buffet and wine tasting afternoons are also a plus. Great indoor and outdoor seating - outdoor firepit - wonderful area to congregate when traveling with friends. We will definitely return to River Terrace Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: peggymack
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in Yountville but found this hotel on Trip Advisor in Napa and thought we would give it a try. We were not disappointed. We had a lovely room with a balcony overlooking the river. The room was large and comfortable complete with refrigerator, I-Pod docking station, robes. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel is quiet and cozy. The buffet breakfast was good with wonderful homemade granola but seating was a bit haphazard. During peak times it was difficult to find a place to sit. The lounge was comfortable and the front desk would store wine for you. We paid just over $500 for a 4 night package, which is incredible value. They were running a mid-week special of stay three nights, get one free. The only disadvantage is that it is in Napa instead of the heart of the wine country. It is located right next door to a new Westin. We ate dinner one night at the Westin but otherwise travelled into the wine country for our meals.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Inn in a beautiful town”
Reviews.Author: JodyHatter
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in the River Terrace, staying 2 nights as part of a honeymoon trip around California. We had a deluxe river view king and it was very roomy, with a great view of the river and a wonderful bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and we were delighted. The Inn itself is in a fairly central Napa location, great for the (very over-priced but lovely) wine train, Oxbox market and Copia. Its a 10 minute walk to the town centre, which is very laid out and pretty. Great restaurants (can't praise 'Bounty Hunter' enough!). There is ample parking outside and although the Inn looks a bit dated on the outside, its really beautiful inside. The breakfast is free and plentiful as is the Wi-Fi. The staff are exceptionally well-trained and professional as well as being friendly and interested. They had great recommendations and every single one of their recommendations were spot on. There is a great wine list at the bar along with a folder full of local restaurant menus (a really nice touch when you are just a bit too tired from tasting to trudge around finding restaurants). There is a restaurant in the car park called 'Cuvee'. Initially we had dismissed it (partly because it was in the car park and partly because we thought we should be more adventurous and venture into town...). Its a brilliant restaurant with excellent special offers (half price wine list on Thursday is a MUST!!) We wish we had stayed longer in the River Terrace Inn and, had there been availability to stay another night, we would have changed our plans and stayed in Napa another day - you can offer any bigger recommendation than that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fibe019
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Napa before heading down the coast and finishing our holiday in LA. The River Terrace Inn was a lovely hotel, although Napa itself was a little disappointing. Our room was very clean and a really good size with a small balcony. The free breakfast was excellent with really nice outside seating area. On our first full day we went to reception to ask about the best vineyards to visit and was given the friendliest service by Jo, he really was a lovely helpful guy, as were all of the staff. The DVD selection was another great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Napa in Oct 09”
Reviews.Author: betsyg
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance to downtown Napa. Right on the road to travel up Napa or to go to Sonoma. Helpful and friendly staff. Rooms were wonderful and immaculate. Comfortable bed, shower and sitting area. I wouldn't bother with a River view since there really isn't much to see. We had a King Garden view. The breakfast selection was very good (pasteries, eggs, cereals, yogurt and fruit.) Depending on the time and reservations there may not been enough seating for everyone - but you can sit outside (weather permitting).

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace Inn is excellent”
Reviews.Author: martinebrody
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the River Terrace Inn was excellent. The accommodations, amenities, hotel staff, location, value and everything elsw was top notch. We received a wedding group rate which was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “not the nicest location”
Reviews.Author: jacers1
Reviews.Content: My husand, another couple and I decided not to stay at this hotel after we arrived. First I do want to say that the staff was probably the best part of this hotel for the two/three hours we were there. Now for why we left..Our rooms smell of the chemicals that is used to clean the carpeting. My friend is asthmatic. There were stains on the comforters. Outside along the river were beer bottles and cigarettes laying on the ground. The ashtray was overflowing with butts. We used tripadvisor for our decisions on hotels for our trip. After seeing the location, we were surprise that other reviews have no mention about the area where River Terrace is located. This might not bother many travelers but for those who it might, travelers should know that the area where the hotel is, is not the 'cleanest'. Even though the hotel is supposed to be walking distance to where the shops,etc is, walking there is not the 'cleanest' either. We started walking for about 5-10 minutes and decided to return and checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding retreat near Old Town Napa”
Reviews.Author: Travalue
Reviews.Content: Had reasonable rates and a very nice room. Balcony was small, but usable. Bed was average and service from all staff was outstanding. Mini-fridge in room was very useful. Napa river is right out back, although the walking trail is limited. A lot of bees out back, but they have traps out. Free bikes to use for visiting local sites. Very good breakfast included with room cost. Great bathroom and dual-head shower - no tub in my room though. The recently opened Weston hotel is right next door and the Napa Wine Train station is very close. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A good modern efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martinandsue
Reviews.Content: Rooms were good size and well appointed. Ideal for an overnight stay. No restaurant on site, but a good breakfast buffet Staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Your luck will be in at the River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: Aikster
Reviews.Content: A very relaxing stay - very close (walking distance) to the Wine Train pick-up point. Well furnished room & bathroom and relaxing dining for both breakfast & evening meals. A beautiful terrace for whiling away the hours with helpful & attentive staff and ample (free) car parking. Downsides? A pretty small gym for anyone wanting to burn off calories gained from the great wine & food; and a small pool that is mostly shaded in the afternoon (when you may want to sleep off your wine sampling weariness!). Otherwise, a lovely hotel in a great area of California. The Wine Train is worth the trip - expensive at first glance but top notch food, sampling of boutique wines & some great scenery from a well maintained train ... all served by knowledgeable staff. Top!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bruggy
Reviews.Content: River Terrace in was a very enjoyable place to stay in Napa. You can't beat the location. And, the service was great in every aspect of the hotel. If you call the front desk for something, they respond quickly and try to resolve your issues. Not that there were many. The breakfast buffet was as good as you can expect for a complimentary breakfast. No complaints there. And their signature granola is very good, like they state on their website. If you are looking for a nice place to stay in Napa withing walking distance from the Wine Train (Also recommended!), some good restaurants, and shopping, River Terrace Inn is a GREAT place to stay. They also have a very nice outdoor terrace to sit and have breakfast at the beginning of the day, and end your day with a nice glass of wine by the fire at night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly headquarters to enjoy the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: wilsonor
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room w river view and jacuzzi on top (3d) floor. Room size is perfectly adequate for a vacation spent outside, and the amenities are terrific. Great beds, great bath with extra vanity, big flat panel TV, and everything worked as it is supposed to. Excellent full breakfast. Staff is helpful and friendly with lots of ideas and recommendations. There is no business center but each room has wi-fi and the front desk printed out my boarding passes when it was time to leave. Medium size makes it a little cozier than its big neighbor. Location is about a minute and a half from Silverado Trail and 5 minutes from 29. Quality furnishings in lobby and open bar area. Will stay here again as there is a 3d nite free program that made cost less than Yountville spots but only about 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to end a day out among the vineyards”
Reviews.Author: tei1988
Reviews.Content: August is peak season for wine-tasting / touring in Napa, so I felt lucky to have found a centrally located hotel that allowed a 1 night stay (through a third party website) over the weekend. Under normal circumstances, this price range would have been beyond my budget. Having said that, Napa is expensive, and given that, the River Terrace Inn lived up to expectations. The room was lovely: spacious and nicely decorated. We were on the third floor, facing the parking lot. We had a little balcony and window that opened (which we prefer to air-conditioning), and we enjoyed that in the morning. No problem with noise. Dual shower-heads and spacious bathroom. It took us 20 minutes to walk to the Riverfront area (where we had dinner). It wasn't the nicest walk - very quiet and dark, but we never felt in danger. We enjoyed our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: smorrison_ca
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. We were travelling as a group of 4 couples. The check-in process went smoothly and our rooms were ready at a decent time. We all stayed in rooms on the 3rd floor overlooking the river with a view out to the hills. The rooms were very comfortable and well maintained. The bed was awesome! Boy that was comfortable. The pillows, less so, but we still slept well. the bathroom has a nice layout with a huge tub. We didn't use it for anything other than showers but I'd have to say its a two person tub. There was a large sink and counter in the main bathroom and another counter outside of the bathroom for makeup/hair and the like. There was also a coffee maker in the room and you would get complementary water every day. The hotel provided a self serve breakfast in the morning. It was very good. They served fruit, yogurts, scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausages, cereals and a broad selection of breads and bagels. They also had a coffee and juice station that was very nicely laid out with some flavored creams. We chose to eat all of our breakfasts on the outside deck. Overall, I really appreciated the good breakfast as it started our day off with a good meal. The only negative that I have on the hotel is their wireless internet connection. Several of us in our party use iPhones and we were never able to connect anywhere other than the lobby and even then we would get disconnected very frequently. They need to fix this. I would go back to this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: AbYorkEngland
Reviews.Content: Really cant praise this hotel enough..Stayed 2 nights on fly drive, in river side room with balcony and spa bath..Everything from service to standard of room and complimentary breakfast was first rate which made our stay very enjoyable..In fact the standard of the room was equal to a much higher graded establishment...The only oddity was that the hotel promotes its green credentials throughout and has several patio heaters and a fire pit blasting away on the terrace overlooking the river each evening...PS if want to visit some vineyards during stay, dont drive, try Platypus Tours for an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Brit-Born-Cyp
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, centrally located hotel. Room was a great size - 2 extremely comfortable double beds & fabulous bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was the best start to a day - great coffee & not a dry doughnut in sight! Plentiful comfortable seating outside overlooking the river for an al fresco brekkie. Staying 4 nights, we dined 2 nights in the adjacent restaurant - Cuvee - an absolute must! . Couple of minutes walking distance to the Wine Train - which is another must if you're in the area. Also handy for staggering back after all the sampling! Only downside for us - the hotel's air-conditioning outlets seemed to be directly outside our 1st floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: trainertrash
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel-lovely spacious room with luxurious bathrooms and all the latest mod cons. We had a river view balcony and they gave us a bottle of bubbly for our honeymoon which was nice! Front desk staff were fine but could have been more helpful. Breakfast is plentiful and there's a decent variety of food too. All areas og the hotel were well maintained but we found it odd that they have all the 'green' eco chat with regard to towels then have patio heaters and a huge gas fire on outdoors during 90c heat-strange. The pool looked tiny but nice Hotel didn't have spa brochures when we were there which was a shame, given that this is one of their selling points. I'd suggest you pop up to Calistoga for a mudbath and massage anyway-heaven! The actual town of Napa is actually quite dull and dead-it's fine to spend a morning walking about but not much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “River view suite was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: DSB25
Reviews.Content: Generously, the hotel upgraded us to a river view deluxe room as it was our Honeymoon. The room was spacious with a huge jacuzzi bath and nice views of the river. Although I would say that the hotel has a somewhat bland, coprorate feel, it was comfortable and suited us for our 2 night stay. The communal areas of the hotel are rather brown and have a bit of a dated feel but the room itself was modern and bright. It was well equipped and the staff (particularly the consierge) were helpful. I would definitely recommend the larger rooms and providing you are not looking for a boutique hotel, this is a comfortable and good standard option.

Reviews.Title: “Right in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: tjibbs
Reviews.Content: A lot of people mistake the city of Napa with the entire Napa Valley. As others have pointed out, Napa is on the Southern edge of the Valley, so most wineries are a drive away. This is right on the edge of downtown, which--despite the city of Napa's bland resonance--has had a nice revitalization. Walk to the Oxbow Market--nice spot. Also, Coles, Celadon, and Uva Trattoria are terrific restaurants only a few blocks away. The rooms here are nothing special, other than the two-headed showers. Best part of this hotel is the continental breakfast, which is diverse, and one can enjoy on the back patio by the fire pits. I stayed here after visiting two four/five star hotels in California, so this was a step back, but for $175/night through expedia, it was a nice find and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for trips to Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: trip_rep_8
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st stay at the hotel, and from now on this will be our 1st choice for visits to Napa Valley. We live in a Bay Area, and visit the Wine Country approximately once a year, with out of state friends. I selected this hotel based on good reviews at the Tripadvisor. I was concerned about location, however I found it perfect. The setting of the hotel has resort-like feel to it, with beautiful river side. Driving to Napa Vineries is easy. We've stayed on the 2nd floor, with the view of the parking lot. I wasn't disappointed: the hallway has big windows with pool side and river view. It was sufficient to create good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The Getaway Girls ABSOLUTELY LOVE The River Terrace Inn! BEST HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Girlcations
Reviews.Content: The Getaway Girls, Tara & Shawna, stayed in Napa at The River Terrace Inn and absolutely loved it! It is BY FAR one of the best hotels we've stayed at! If you're looking for a diamond in the rough, with reasonable rates and all 5 star amenities... then look NO FURTHER than The River Terrace Inn in Napa, CA! Our check-in was seamless, our rooms were OUT OF THIS WORLD AMAZING (DEEP jetted tubs, bath and body works products, terraces, ceiling fans, the most comfortable beds we've ever slept on, friendly staff and the perfect location to walk to downtown Napa, The Wine Train, and many GREAT restaurants). Having stayed at MANY hotels, we find that the River Terrace Inn HAS IT ALL! Our private terrace, over looking the river, was the perfect way to unwind after a day of wine tasting!!! We opened a bottle from Flora Springs and enjoyed the cool night air and the beauty of the region, while talking and laughing in the comfort of our hotel room and our pajamas! The full breakfast each morning is the perfect way to refuel for the day and the back patio/lounge area is perfect for a nightcap! With great rates, an incomparable location, friendly staff, comfy beds, fabulous bath products that highlight the relaxing jetted tub... The River Terrace Inn is IT! Look no further for an amazing Napa hotel! The Getaway Girls HIGHLY recommend The River Terrace Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay...kind of dream-like!”
Reviews.Author: Yodee
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 3 nights at the River Terrace Inn. It was an ideal stay from start to finish & was just what we were looking for. We had their best room (celebrating 30 yr anniversary) with a jacuzzi bath for two, king-sized bed, balcony with (kind of a) river view (more on that later). The room was fantastic- comfortable, spacious and sparkling clean. The jacuzzi was indeed big enough for two (that's not always the case) and was a relaxing way to wind down at night. The view: Well, I guess it's kind of no one's fault in particular, but the view was only available when we stood up! Once we sat down on the chairs, we couldn't see anything because of the construction of the balcony. Weird...why hasn't anyone noticed that before? It was a minor irritant, but you can't advertise a river view if there really isn't one when you want to sit & relax! The breakfast buffet was better than most we've seen. Eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, granola, dried fruit, yogurt, pastries & bread. Vegetarians would be very pleased. It was a great way to start the day & not have to worry about eating again until late p.m. or evening even. The service was excellent and gracious. We ordered room service from the RT cafe one night (with not too high expectations) and were pleasantly surprised...prices not too bad & the food (one hamburger & one pizza) were delicious. The pool is very nice, but pretty small- same with the gym which kept calling my name but I didn't really use. Free weights was a nice touch & not usually seen. The concierge was helpful in pointing out what non-drinkers can do in Napa. We walked around the downtown area- very sweet and unpretentious, visited the Di Rosa Preserve (about 20 min away & well-worth it), and visited Yountville which was very nice. All in all, a perfect stay, completely relaxing & enjoyable. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, good breakfast, convenient location, will come back again”
Reviews.Author: PIA_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway in April. We stayed in a room with a private jet tub, and enjoyed relaxing in it in the evening. The room was clean and spacious. There are DVD available for rent (free of charge) at the front desk which we made use of as well. The beds were very comfortable (like the beds at the westin). Breakfast was delicious and there is a good variety of bread, hot food (eggs, sausages), fresh fruit, coffee and juice. My husband and I drove out to the wineries during the day and as such, we did not really take advantage of the location and the attractions that were within walking distance such as the Napa wine train. We will definitely stay here again. I would recommend this to couples and families. It is good value for the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: viross5000
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our one night stay in the River Terrace Inn. It's in a great spot near the centre of Napa so you can walk into town for some food and drinks without worrying about nominating a driver. The room was spacious and clean, with a nice balcony (albeit overlooking the car park) where we sat and had lunch. The bed was really comfy too! Nice touches like a DVD library were appreciated. Breakfast perfectly fine - hot stuff perhaps not as hot as it could have been but that's the only criticism, and it was one of the few places on our trip that we did get breakfast included in the price. In terms of Napa itself, just a warning to European visitors, compared to the French wine regions we had visited we found Napa wine tasting, and even wine in restaurants/bars, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms...good breakfast on the River and close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: byoung3rd
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights...had a very relaxing weekend. Enjoyed the Riverside location, the good breakfasts (on the terrace if the weather permits)...and the proximity to town. Compares favorably to the Napa River Inn (except not as close to downtown...but larger rooms and breakfasts).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Mid-Week Value”
Reviews.Author: Beachy18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Terrace on a recent trip to Napa and we were fortunate to get a fantastic mid-week rate and it felt a little good to be true, but the hotel definitely lived up to the great reviews we had read. I think it is brand-new, because everything looked and smelled that way. We were thrilled with how everything turned out. ROOM: Our room with king bed was rather large and also included a desk and a sofa/coffee table, flat-screen TV, wet bar area across from the bathroom that was stocked with bottles of wine and a ton of snacks and drinks (on automatic sensors that charge you if you remove, but a good option if you need the convenience of it). Newspaper delivery every morning. There is also a refrigerator, closet, and a safe. The bathroom was large and actually quite luxurious with a huge glass-enclosed, tiled walk-in shower with double shower head, a large vanity with lots of storage, Bath and Body Works toiletries, and a separate toilet area. The bed was quite comfy, but the pillows were down-filled, which you may love, but we didn't because they were a little too squishy and tended to get flat as you sleep. Decor was very nice. Housekeeping kept the room spotless, and even came by in the late afternoon each day to check if we needed anything. I had seen some reviews that complained about thin walls, and I could see how this could be true. We were on the corner of the building on 3rd floor, so for us we dodn't have much of a problem, but we did notice that we could hear some noises from the room on one side of us a few times. I do give River Terrace props for being aware of this though, because there was a very nice white noise machine on the bedside table that you could set to practically any sound you wanted to down out noise while you sleep. We use one at home, so we loved this touch. High-speed internet access was also included in our room rate. FOOD/BAR: Didn't use the bar there, but we did get coupons for a comp glass of wine at Cuvee, the hotel's restaurant (on the property, but not attached to the hotel). Breakfast was included in our room rate, which was a fabulous value, and it was decent. Not anything super impressive, but an average medly of pastries and breads, eggs, sausage, cereals, fruit, etc. A large outdoor terrace that you can sit and eat. GENERAL: Friendly front desk staff. We didn't use valet much because the parking lot is pretty much right outside the hotel doors, but when we did they were quick and helpful. Good location near downtown Napa, it was easy to get to. Also, it has a pool and small fitness center which both looked nice but we didn't use. The back of the property was very pretty, with the Napa River running right behind it and a nice walking path running alongside that begs for a leisurely stroll. Overall, we had a terrific stay here and it made our trip to Napa all that much more relaxing and easy going!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recemmend Selecting River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: jlherlein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn for 3 nights in March. It was our first trip to Napa and we wanted it to be convenient to drive to vineyards and also wanted to have the option of walking downtown for dinner. This hotel allowed us to meet both goals. The location makes it easily accessible from San Francisco and it's at the southern end of Napa Valley, with vineyards minutes away. We got solid recommendations from the hotel concierge and she also booked a variety of tours for guests. The hotel itself is very nice. It has a well-stocked bar and a lovely outdoor area with fire pits and heat lamps. We had the tasty complimentary breakfast buffet out there each morning and loved it. We also enjoyed the outdoor pool one afternoon. The rooms are comfortable and nice. Everything was spotless and seemed rather new. We will absolutely stay here again and have recommended it to friends who are making the trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “My top pick for affordable yet upscale Napa hotel”
Reviews.Author: LocalWally
Reviews.Content: First, my credentials - I write a local's guide on Napa (www.NapaTouristGuide.com) so I take my hotels seriously. I won't put up with a roach motel, and I've been to far too may hotels that look great on the internet but horrid in person. In the past I used to stay at Villagio and Vintage Inn, both top rated hotels, but as their rates kept going up and my paycheck kept getting slashed I needed something that was less expensive - but I didn't want to give up the comforts of a 4 star hotel. I was glad to find River Terrace Inn. The downtown location makes it close to the restaurants (Bounty Hunter for Monday specials, Hog Island Oysters for happy hour, Celedon for a romantic night out, Cuvee for $5 happy hour appetizers) and it's located right on the river. Inside the hotel it's nice and upscale, and the rooms feature trendy decorations, great linens, and a flat screen TV. Terrific free breakfast, and an outdoor patio that's perfect for starting your day. The only things missing are a fireplace in the room and a giant romantic bathroom (though the bathroom is nice, it's not spa-like as you would find at Vintage Inn). I also liked the staff a lot. They went out of their way to help the visitors and business people staying there. And the rates! Yes, the rates are downright affordable. River Terrace Inn is one of my most favorite places to stay in Napa - you really can't go wrong if you are looking for a solid hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: MalinSweden
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay at River Terrace Inn in Napa! Good location, friendly and helpful staff, great complimentary breakfast, spatious room and great bathroom - comfort at its best! In fact, you'll find everything you need here; fitnesscenter, pool, great lounge, free wireless internet and even a complimentary glass of wine at the restaurant Cuvee! Do stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to recouperate...”
Reviews.Author: comfortlux
Reviews.Content: After a vacation in Thailand I choose the River Terrace Inn to rest and relax and adjust to the 9 hour jet lag. The hotel is very comforable, extremely friendly and like a wine country lodge. One evening there was a wine tasting in the lobby bar, that was most enjoyable. There were lots activities available through the hotel, that kept me and my partner busy.

Reviews.Title: “All it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: neatntidy
Reviews.Content: After looking for a few days for a place to stay on our trip to Napa, I decided on this hotel. We stayed only one night and are satisfied with our choice. The Village Queen Balcony room was small, but clean and everything seemed to be pretty new. I was a little disappointed to find that the balcony (that I paid more for) overlooked the parking lot, instead of the river or at least something more green. I probably wouldn't spend the extra money again...and would have been nice if the room description stated that 'village' equals parking lot. The complimentary breakfast was a treat and we were surprised at all the choices they offered. The hotel has a restaurant and serves dinner, but didn't have that many choices. Instead, after a long day wine tasting, we opted to eat at the restaurant just a few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we were made very welcome”
Reviews.Author: ynyshir
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11am. (booking in time is 3pm). there was no problem, we were given a room straight away, and what a room. We had a junior suite overlooking the river. Everyone working at the hotel were very friendly and welcomed us every time we came back from our trips out. The concierge,LINDA,was very helpful, and booked excursions for us at the drop of a hat. Breakfast was free and very nice,plenty to eat and drink. A refreshing change from the other hotels on our tour. We could not fault this hotel, nice swimming pool, small fitness centre,lovely river views,good food,great staff. Even a shuttle bus to the town and outlets! Anyone who complains about this hotel are very hard to please. I would recomed this hotel if you want to tour the vineyards of Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn Great Price”
Reviews.Author: napa1978
Reviews.Content: We just had a 3 night stay at the River Terrace Inn and had a fantastic time. Great location in Napa, very short drive to town centre, shopping outlets and Hwy 29 for the wineries. Good impression walking in through the front door, checked in very smoothly. Shown to our room, ponting out the lounge on the way. Room perfect size. 2 queen beds on village side of the hotel, big bathroom and a good sized fridge for your own food as well as a mini bar fridge. Balcony that we could see hot air balloons flying over the valley in the morning. The bathroom had very nice bath and body works products and you can borrow DVD's from reception at no charge - very useful with an 8 hour time difference and a 5 year old that woke up at 3am. We just walked down to recpetion, manned by 2 staff and picked out a film for her to watch until breakfast time. Breakfast is offered in the lounge, a combination of tables and chairs and then some armchairs and sofas to eat at. Food offerings very nice - scrambled eggs, sausage links, potatoes, home made granola, fresh and dried fruit, then pastries, bagels and toast. Juice, tea and coffee to drink. Although the weather was not good - rain, rain and rain! My daughter still wanted to go in the pool. The pool is heated and very warm even in the rain! Towels by the pool for guests use. I booked the hotel at a special rate direct from their website and paid $99 a night, for the service and comfort we received it was a bargain. If we return to Napa, the River Terrace Inn will be the top of our list!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: jkfhope
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Jr. Suite Facing the River. We had a large room, large bathroom and nice little balcony overlooking the River. The room was clean and stocked with Bath and Body Works products. The staff was friendly and helpful and and the continental breakfast was awesome (hot and cold options, seating indoors and on their terrace overlooking the river. The pool was in a poor location-no afternoon sun. But that is truely the only complaint we had. Overall it was a perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: TCP-GDI
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Napa - the first time we stayed at the Inn on First, but opted for this hotel due to the good reveiws and the great price we were able to get. The outside of the hotel looks like an apartment complex, not really a hotel. However, the interior was very nice, with the main lobby having the feel of a lodge. Our room was very spacious and the hotel even upgraded us to a river view room. The breakfast buffet was very generous. There is a free shuttle that will take you into town, but we opted to walk each time, since it only takes about 6-7 minutes to walk. The hotel is great for a nice, clean comfortable stay, but we didn't think it was a "luxury" hotel. We would definitely stay here again for a weekend trip, but would opt for one of the B&B's in town if we wanted a more romantic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: midasmith
Reviews.Content: I have to say, it took me a month to chose where we would stay for the weekend! I'm glad we stayed at River Terrance. We were given a room upgrade with the river view and it was a beautiful scene..and all I had to do was asked. It's nice knowing that they would accomodate, if a room is available. We had a great, serene, relaxing weekend and a great way to celebrate our 15 year anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price and Offerings”
Reviews.Author: TX_Travel_Monkeys
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a girls weekend and really enjoyed our stay. We pricelined this hotel and got it for $100 a night on a big event weekend. It was the perfect location and was very quaint. The staff was AWESOME -- so nice and helpful. The front desk staff and valet were superb and Miguel, the bartender, was so friendly. The rooms were nice, cozy and comfortable. Other reviews complained of noise at night or paper thin walls, and this was not an issue for us. The breakfast was more than just continental as it served eggs, country potatos, a variety of breads, an assortment of juices and coffee, fruit and cereal. We didn't get a chance to use the gym or swimming pool, but it looked nice from what I could tell. I didn't see any kids at the hotel, but that could have been due to the time of year. Overall, this hotel blew my expectations away and I will definitely stay there again. You should stay there too--- you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: DayHiker2
Reviews.Content: nothing bad to say about it. great continental breakfast. beautiful lobby for the size of hotel. great terrace on back overlooking small river and partial view of mountains. nothing to complain about

Reviews.Title: “More than expected...”
Reviews.Author: beautea97
Reviews.Content: Our son-in-law booked our stay while we were in town for the Napa Valley Marathon. Although I had this location recommended in the past, we had not been to Napa until now. This hotel was indeed a pleasure - interior design was very tuscan and warm. Our stay included a continental breakfast that was presented well. Since the hotel was sold-out the night of our stay, we did have neighbors who could be heard. Luckily most guests had a very early morning so lights were out early, making things very quiet. Our room had very nice appointments; iPod music player; in-room sound soothers and a jacuzzi tub. My ONLY dissapointment was that our stay was only one night ~

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a river, but a nice inn”
Reviews.Author: happyrobot
Reviews.Content: I somehow landed a corner room on the top floor here and it was a great room. Windows on two sides, a nice couch and coffee table, and a nice desk for work stuff. My room faced the front and the street, so there wasn't much of a view. I am not sure if the view would be any better on the "river" side. The river wasn't looking so great. That said, the room was clean and seemed to have been updated recently. Very comfortable bed. Good sized bathroom. In the mornings they offer a complimentary breakfast which was more than adequate. What else? Friendly staff. They have a big book of DVDs that you can borrow if you want to watch a movie. Nice sheets and towels. The pool looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamer80
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel. However, the walls are extremely thin! We could hear the rooms on both sides of us when we first check in. Then at night, we could hear someone snoring in the next room! Other than that, the room was nice, clean & well maintained. Breakfast was great! Alot of options and the food was good. They have a great selection of movies you can borrow and watch in the room. Overall it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: august808
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel just a couple of day ago. It was in a convenient location, close to markets, restaurants and shopping. The hotel has very pleasant staff, it was no problem checking in, they even let us check in a couple hours early. The room was very clean and pretty big for an average room size. We got a king bed and a balcony. Driving to Napa wineries is about 15 minutes which is pretty good. I would recommend the hotel's Cuvee restaurant, we had lunch there is was about $15 per entree. The ONE negative thing I would like to let future guests of River Terrace Inn know is that the ceilings and walls are thin. I stayed on the second floor and I could hear children running around upstairs on the third floor for hours. It was very difficult to take a nap. You can hear the people up above walking around and moving things, sometimes it was a little irritating. My recommendation is that if you're going to stay here you should ask to be on the 3rd floor or make sure there's no one else above you if you're on the first or second floors. Overall it was a great experience and if I went back I would probably look into staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: We went to Napa for a day and night of wine tasting. We booked the River Terrace Inn because of the location right in Napa town. This is a great hotel, with very comfortable beds, and an excellent breakfast included with the price of the room. We booked a room with a balcony, which wasn't necessary, as the weather was so damp, we couldn't use it. The King size bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept on. There was also a sofa in the room and a large flat screen TV and a work desk, if anyone wants to work. There are boutique bath products in the large bathroom. Our room also had a machine where you could choose what sound you would like to hear to sooth you to sleep, waterfalls, waves, wind, birds, etc. The lobby area has a nice size bar area with a warm fireplace. The breakfast in the morning included hot food , eggs, potatos, as well as a choice of cold foods, cheeses, tomatos, meats, various breads, muffins, fresh fruit, etc. It was delicious. My regret, we stayed only one night. I would return to Napa, just to stay in the River Terrace Inn. we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Wine, Cheese & Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Misspotatohead
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn hotel for 2 nights as part of a road trip around California. We decided to splash out a bit and fancied the idea of staying somewhere a bit more luxurious than the average motel. We certainly thought it was one of the best decisions we had made! We arrived early but were still allocated a room and allowed to check in with no problems. The room was lovely and I have to say I think the beds were the most comfortable beds (including the pillows!) I've ever slept in (apart from my one at home). I guess our experience must have been very different from the previous reviewer. We didn't have a problem sleeping either, but perhaps that was something to do with all the wine we had been sampling... The bathroom was lovely with atmospheric lighting and a fantastic shower head. I made the most of the bath too as the bathroom was significantly nicer than the standard motel. The River Terrace Inn offers a luxurious atmosphere with a nice lounge area where we spent the evenings drinking wine and sampling their cheese platter (highly recommended). The breakfast included is spot on with a wide range of hot cooked food, cereal, continental breakfast and fresh fruit. The hotel also offers complimentary dvd service which is a nice touch and allows you to make the most of the large flat screen tvs in the bedrooms. There is a heated outdoor pool, and attractive patio dining area with outdoor heaters to add to your comfort. We booked a wine tour through the hotel paying perhaps slightly more than average, mainly for the convenience. It was a fantastic experience though with a knowlegable and friendly tour driver who took us to see 4 wineries and lunch was included. We had originally thought of hiring bikes but as the Napa region is so vast, we were glad we did the driving tour in the end. Overall, the River Terrace in offers extremely comfortable accommodation and is excellent value for money. It is within a 2 min drive to downtown Napa and daily excursions are easy to book via the hotel. The staff are friendly, and you really wont want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...but there is 1 thing”
Reviews.Author: MayaJinCA
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this place was. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom (especially the dual shower heads) was great! The front desk was quick and check in and out was a breeze. The free breakfast was good, but the seating was limited. On the other hand the night's sleep was not great at all. The walls are super thin apparently when I and my boyfriend woke up several times to the noise in the hallway. We woke up once to the neighbors on one side and then woke up again at 3am to the neighbors having a discussion that seemed would never end on the other side. I would recommend bringing earplugs! The bed and pillows were less than to be desired. If you can, bring your own pillow. I would stay here again, but I would be prepared to bring the items mentioned above. Oh, and this hotel is within walking distance to the wine train.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: holden545
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel within walking distance of downtown Napa. There's a lot to love about this hotel. Though small, the rooms are clean as a pin and the beds are very comfortable. The front desk is accommodating and friendly. When you're traveling, finding a breakfast spot can be a chore. But at the hotel there is a free breakfast buffet (2 rooms of freshly prepared food and beverages!) every morning. And to work off the breakfast, there is a small work out facility on the lower level. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: ChathamFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace for three nights and enjoyed the hotel. We booked their buy two get one free special and it was a great deal. The room was so clean and comfortable and well appointed. We found the staff to be very helpful and attentive. The breakfast (which was included) was a nice buffet with eggs, breads, cereals, yoghurts, etc. OVerall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: Zizgig
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night. Had a Deluxe room with a balcony and a lovely view on the Napa River. Jacuzzi in the room did not work though (this is why it gets a rating 3 and not 4). Ideally located close to Napa downtown (10 minutes walk). Great breakfast on the terrace of the hotel, just by the river. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ J
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded for actually a lower price upon arrival. The place is in a great location and it definitely surpassed our expectations. The rooms were spacious, had a great decor, and were very well kept. Nice ambience and breakfast was included every morning. They have a great little patio right on the river. We would definitley stay here again and it's a great value for what all that the place has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Warm rooms, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Rigi34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the River Terrace for three nights during our tour of wine country. PRO's: Large rooms & bathrooms with jacuzzi tub. Lobby and room were very warm, clean, and inviting. Lobby has large fireplace and nice bar. Rooms have large LCD TV w/complimentary DVD library for loan at front desk. Complimentary breakfast buffet with potatoes, scrambled eggs/bacon, cereals, fresh fruit, breads & spreads, etc. Small exercise room. Great location - about 2 blocks outside of downtown Napa next to Napa River. Very quiet in AM & PM. Hotel staff were accommodating and friendly with tips & complimentary coupons for local restaurants & wineries. River Terrace runs several promotions on their website. We stayed free for our third night and spent the free night's $$$ on dinners & wineries. CON's: Comparable hotels in wine country offer a complimentary wine & cheese happy hour. Overall a great value & great location. Will stay here again & recommend to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property for the money, service somewhat lacking”
Reviews.Author: wineandfoodie3
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the River Terrace a week ago. Property is well located in Napa, and our room had a nice view of the river. Overall, property seemed well maintained and furnishings were in good condition. Our bedroom was clean and the bathroom was immaculate and well-appointed (we had a large tub with jets and all have double-headed showers). The pictures of the property on the web site were representative of what we experienced. Breakfast was better than I expected with a selection from eggs and potatoes to fresh fruit and their homemade granola. The only thing I would fault is guest service. I contacted the concierge before arriving to see if they could be helpful in planning my trip, and found them to be the least helpful I have encountered just about anywhere. In discussing a potential dinning reservation, the woman asked if I had tried Open Table, and when I said I had, she suggested I just keep calling the restaurant myself to see if there were any cancellations. As it turned out, I did later call and got a reservation for the day and time I wanted on the first try. What a hero she could have been, if she only had not been too lazy to pick up the phone herself! She was also of so little help in discussing wineries that I gave up trying. The only thing I can think of in her defense was that I learned that I called about twenty minutes before she left for the day on a Friday. I also never saw anyone at the concierge desk in the lobby during our entire stay. Also, of interest was that the hotel had free valet parking on Sunday afternoon when we arrived, but not when we returned Sunday night or any of the rest of our stay thereafter. Otherwise, I would say that the staff did an adequate job, but perhaps they are on a skeleton crew Sun-Tue when simple things like greeting the guests, sincerely asking if they could do anything to make our stay more pleasant, etc., would have gone a long way to upgrading the experience. Overall, we thought the property was nice and a good value for the money. If you don't need any help planning and arranging, and are satisfied with the level of service you might receive at any budget hotel, the River Terrace is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traveler_30
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the River Terrace Inn while exploring the Napa Valley area and visiting wineries. My room was exceedingly comfortable: great bedding, modern television, minibar, etc. I was on the second floor, and I even had a balcony with two chairs and a small table, a great place for a cup of coffee in the morning. The bathroom was very neat and clean. There is a shower only, no bathtub, which didn't bother me. My only complaint is a minor one: the hairdryer was awful. It took forever to dry my hair, so I highly recommend bringing one from home. The back of the hotel features a wonderful deck area complete with tables with umbrellas and warmers so it is easy to enjoy breakfast outside even on a cool morning. There is a beautiful fire pit, and I took the opportunity to drink some wine and visit with friends around the fire in the evenings. I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Inn / Hotel! Greatest birthday present:)”
Reviews.Author: vchi611
Reviews.Content: My bf planned a trip to napa for myself and a few of my girlfriends for my 30th birthday. It was an amazing weekend and we loved our stay at the Inn. The room was just the right size and was extremely clean. The common areas were pretty and comfortable. Unfortunately we couldn't make use of the pool, but I took at look at it and it was in a nice private area and would have been great to use, if not for the rainy weather that weekend. I have to comment on the breakfast - it was REALLY good for a buffet breakfast. We ended up eating breakfast at the Inn every morning even though we originally planned to go out for brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the valley”
Reviews.Author: Jnewshel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the River Terrace Inn in mid-September. We were pleasantly surprised on how well-appointed our room was. The bathroom was spacious and goregous, and the rest of the room was also large and very nicely decorated. The bed was extrememly comfortable and the room had a large flat screen tv, dvd player, sound machine, alarm clock with ipod dock, refrigerator, sofa and coffee table, and small patio. We had the most basic rate, so we weren't expecting much. But, we were pleased. Breakfast is basic, but complementary. The pool is small, but adequate and the fitness room is pretty tiny. The location of the hotel is nice and you can walk into the downtown, but you will need a car to get other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrmomx2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn for two nights in early September. It was our first visit to Napa. Based on reviews we read on this website we chose to book a room and we have no regrets at all. The hotel room we were given was well appointed and maintained. The bathroom was very large and again very well appointed. We found the staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate and it was so nice to be able to sit outside in the morning and enjoy it. Overall we found our experience at the hotel to be lovely and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice location, great breakfast, but not special”
Reviews.Author: WestVanMan
Reviews.Content: While we have traveled to California many times, we were all newbies to the Napa Valley. We're not even wine aficionados, but it was a part of the state we thought we should visit. For 4 days, we were not disappointed. Of course it helps to have a love for seeing new places, good food, beautiful scenery and interesting sights and for that, Napa filled the bill. So we were hoping to find accommodations that matched the appeal of Napa without breaking the bank. With the recommendation of a friend, the River Terrace Inn served as our base. The location was right outside of the central business district of the town of Napa and located on the Napa River, a smallish river with a lazy Mississippi flow. There is no access to the river, but it seems a romantic place, more so than in reality. It's too bad as it's river location is something that should be better taken advantage of by the hotel, if indeed it is allowable by those who have jurisdiction over the river bank. Also close by, within walking distance is the Oxbow Market and COPIA, both excellent attractions for food and wine. On site is an outdoor pool which loses sunlight a couple of hours before sundown, a small exercise facility with 3 or 4 machines and few free weights, a large lobby lounge area and outdoor patio where the complimentary breakfast is served and consumed. There may be some meeting rooms, but otherwise, it's a 4 storey wood frame building that's fairly attractive. Our room, unfortunately was on the Ground Floor adjacent to the Exercise Room and turned out to be one of the 'accessible rooms' for disabled guests. The room itself was comfortable for the 4 of us parents and college age kids and was fairly well appointed. Strangely, the two lamp bedlamp between the two Queen beds would not allow to only switch one lamp or the other, both were either on or off. A little annoying. While on lighting, the bathroom was very dimly lit. We also had to ask for an arm chair which due to the disabled access requirements was not provided on arrival. There is no wireless internet signal, but the hardwire is complimentary. There is a large flat screen TV. Our room being next to the Exercise Room, was not completely sound proofed, being able to hear the muffled pounding on the treadmill. Newspaper provided to the room is USA Today and the Napa Valley Register is available at the Lobby. There is I believe an on-site restaurant, Terrace Cafe, however we did not give it a chance with so many other culinary options available in the area. However the complimentary breakfast is, in my mind, the best thing going here. There is plenty of selection including hot and cold items, good variety of fruit and baked goods and all well prepared, but not made to order. There is complimentary wine tasting too I believe, but again we were out for this activity enjoying the Napa sights and smells. If you have to work off some of the calories from dining in the Valley, there is a 1.2 mile pedestrian path that follows the same river shoreline that starts about 4 blocks north of the hotel on Lincoln Ave which makes for a nice flat jog. All in all, the River Terrace Inn was a nice stay, however not one to really "write home about". Staff were nice and generally helpful, although they do not have a concierge. The breakfast made it for us. In this price range, there is not much in the immediate area. However a Westin is just being completed immediately next door, also on the river's edge, which I'm sure will give cause to the RTI to step it up a notch. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Goodchip
Reviews.Content: For our first ever trip to the Napa Valley, this was the perfect base. It is in kind of a commercial part of Napa, but once you turn the corner and enter the parking lot, you are in kind of a little oasis of comfort. I'd compare it to a Hilton Garden Inn, or a Courtyard Marriott. The room was very large and quite comfortable. We had a king suite overlooking the river. The deck was quite small, but it was nonetheless pleasant to sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine enjoying the view of the Napa River. Nice bathroom with marble counter tops, and an additional vanity outside the bathroom. Great jacuzzi tub and a double headed shower. Stocked mini bar, plus a separate fridge for our own stuff. Very nice touch that I've never seen before. The outdoor patio is very nice, with a large fireplace that the bartender is happy to fire up. Top marks so far. Now a couple of nits: There were tiny red ants in our bathroom (saw about 6 or 8 of these little critters over a 3 night stay.) I despise wall mounted air conditioners. This room had one, and I'd say it was a bit noisier than normal. The breakfast buffet was kinda lame. I've seen better at Holiday Inn Express, and waaay batter at Spring Hill Suites (Marriott). We did drive by a Best Western and an Embassy Suites. I think the RTI looked far better than both of these. I'd have no hesitation in recommending the River Terrace Inn

Reviews.Title: “Champagne on a beer budget”
Reviews.Author: NiceNYer
Reviews.Content: We join the chorus of TripAdvisor readers (who guided us here) in recommending this hotel for its value, location and good natured staff. My wife and I used it as a home base for three days in July 2008 for wine tours and hiking in Napa Valley, having also considered some super-luxe options just beyond the Napa city limits. We took advantage of a third-night-free promotion and saved many hundreds of dollars that went, instead, toward dinners at nationally prominent restaurants Ubuntu (vegetarian) and Angele as well as a local crowd pleaser called Tuscany--all highly recommended, and all within a short walk of the hotel. Our room was on the third floor, where the ceilings are a bit higher, and faced the river, which we recommend, as the only other option is the a parking-lot view in the front. Room size and amenities were impressive for the price. The pool and excercise room aren't much to speak of, but the morning breakfast buffet (complimentary) was varied and high quality despite the expectable "excuse me" and "pardon me" issued every few seconds as you bumped into the teenagers (and their parents) jostling for the best muffin and cheese-covered scrambled eggs. But the dining terrace with water-view (check out the resident geese) makes it all worthwhile, not to mention the generous selection of DVD's to rent (gratis), the marble bath with jacuzzi, and the overall fit and finish, spotless with turn-down service to boot. If you don't need massage-on-demand or a view into the mountains then stay here and save a bunch. Tip: the view from the picnic tables at Rutherford Hill winery is identical to that of the most expensive rooms at Auberge du Soleil, which is on the same road as the winery on lower ground.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Otown_Adrian
Reviews.Content: Buy 2 nights, get the 3rd FREE. Complimentary valet parking...Complimentary buffet style breakfast with eggs, bagels, variety of pastries, fruit, herbal teas, coffee and juice. We stayed in a junior suite with a king size bed, balcony with river view, jacuzzi tub, bath & body works toiletries and vanity area separate from bathroom area. Two refigerators, one stocked by hotel and one empty for local purchases. Walking distance to downtown Napa, restaurants and grocery. Easy drive to most of the wineries in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be Back”
Reviews.Author: AustinSue
Reviews.Content: The hotel markets itself as a high-end spa experience, but it's a wanna-be. The hotel looks just like the web site pictures except it's more run down. Our room had a stained carpet, which made me think the room was all dirty. The room smelled moldy, so we had to buy some room freshener. The balcony was unusable as it was too narrow and overlooked the tented dining area. A day of wine-tasting softened my opinion of the room a bit, but I still wouldn't walk on the carpet bare-foot. Our TV had bad reception and although the front desk told us they would fix it, it was not fixed when we returned. I had to jiggle the wire going into the wall to fix it. The bathroom was nice. Good shower and tub. Great water pressure. Towels were stiff, but not paper thin. Sheets and robes were very soft, which made me think they weren't fresh. I like crisp sheets. Breakfast buffet was so-so. Overall ambiance in the lobby reminded me of an upscale nursing home. Piped-in music (elevator style show tunes) was annoying. We had to request a channel change each night we were there. Some staff knew how to do it and some didn't. I would not stay here again and do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel - Views So-So - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Samuelmorris
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 3.5 out of 5 stars, over all. It has the most decent price for what we wanted, a junior suite with a river view and a jacuzzi. The staff was young and nice and helpful - but their concierge, which is only in one day a week, is virtually non-existent. Don't rely on the concierge making your plans, unless you speak with them via phone weeks beforehand. Our junior suite was a good sized room, with a balcony...but the 'river view' isn't really all that hot - though it must be better than the parking lot views. The jacuzzi can fit two people, but is not all that long...but is pretty good. The shower in this room came with double heads, which made for a great shower. Finally, the brunch is pretty good too - though they didn't have any form of bacon. And the location is outside of Napa proper, but its only a minute to highway 29 (main Napa drag), about 10-15 minutes from all the great highway 29 wineries, and is about as far from Sonoma/Carneros, so its a good middle location for both Sonoma and Napa. If I went back, I'd try to find a more romantic B+B - but we definitely had a good stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: ninabruja06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn for the first part of our honeymoon in California. We stayed there for three nights as part of a package (book two nights get the third free). The room was large, had a nice bathroom with separate vanity area, jacuzzi tub and a small private balcony. We had one with a river view and it was very quiet. Each morning we had breakfast there and it was great. Bagels, pastries, eggs, potatoes, cheeses, fruit, etc. On the second night we ordered the in room spa service for a couples massage. It was wonderful!! The hotel is convenient to Oxbow public market, Copia, and downtown Napa. It is a bit drab on the outside, but the inside and the rooms are lovely. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 66AMS
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and service, the only negative was that a conference was being held at the hotel when we were there and the and the attendees were noisy in the bar area which was under our room

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: kmann08
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! Great location and wonderful room. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, but quite pricey.”
Reviews.Author: gpm13
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong, this is a really nice hotel. But it was quite expensive for what you get. I could not fault the room - it was large, with a good size bathroom. We had a balcony which was a bit on the small side, but adequate for two chairs with a table between. The view in the medium to long distance was nice - it's just a shame that the hotel didn't do a better job of landscaping the car park below - it's a grey gravel outlook from all rooms with balconies and this kind of lets it down - not that we even saw any cars out there - the car park at the front of the hotel is more than adequate. Why they haven't made this more attractive, I dont know - it spoils what would otherwise be a nice view. Breakfast was very nice - a serve yourself affair. we had great weather in April, so ate breakfast outside both days - the fire pit gave us a bit of warmth that the sun lacked at that time of year. Because we had overspent on the hotel (it shot up by $100 for the Good Friday night and we hadn't realised), we didn't eat out - instead we went to Whole Foods Market and bought some food to take back to the room and ate it outside on our balcony - two of the best nights of the trip! Definitely take a drive up the Napa Valley. Stop off at the wine shop in the Napa town first - and have a glass of wine. Its on the corner of Randolph St and Clay Street - ask for some recommendations and they'll give you some coupons to exchange for free wine tasting. We had one for Cosentino and they gave us 11 free wines to taste! While up in the Napa Valley stop at Dean and Delucas and pick up some lunch - it's a fabulous deli. The vinyard across the road at Vintui is also worth a look around - or even pick up lunch there and eat it on their lawn.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - great DVD collection but not too child friednly”
Reviews.Author: reedfamilyboa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Terrace Inn for 3 nights in July 2008 as part of a family holiday in California. Overall the hotel is clean and well presented but proved to be quite pricey as we booked at relatively short notice and ende up paying $270 per night. Buffet breakfast was included and provided to a good standard. Didn't eat at the hotel in the evening as it a short walk to downtown Napa (about 10 mins) and found a good pizza takeaway a few mins away (Papa Joe's). Rooms were comfortable but air conditioning very noisy - especially if you end up in one of the rooms ajoining the atrium (which we did !). Pool is rather small for the size of the hotel and is located to the rear (river) side of the building which means by late afternoon the entire pool area is in shadow. Also worth noting that a new hotel is being constructed next door so sitting poolside during the day means you suffer constrction noise and workman looking in from the building site. Suffice to say not very private. The hotel have a well stocked DVD library and films are available to loan at no charge - although they do take a $30 refundable deposit. I would stay here again in certain circumstances (eg: travelling with my wife on a hiking trip). We had our 11 year old son with us and the hotel lacks anything for kids (of any age). Not a hotel for families unless it is a one-night stopover stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on the river...”
Reviews.Author: Anita40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this inn for my neice's 21st birthday trip to Napa with seven other gals in my family. The hotel is located in the town of Napa not far from all of the wineries and sights that everyone goes there to see... The rooms are VERY comfortable for a hotel of this price range, the lobby is really nice with overstuffed chairs and couches, a fireplace, and a wine bar, and there is a rear patio for dining that is right next to the river. We had dinner by the fire pit and also breakfast which is included with the price of the room. Great big bathrooms with big showers and multiple shower heads...if I need a place to stay in Napa ever again I'll make a beeline to this hotel - it's just right!

Reviews.Title: “above average but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jiffy1969
Reviews.Content: The River Terrace Inn is better than a standard hotel, but nothing extra special. The staff was satifactory, but again nothing extra special. The continental breakfast was fine, but once more nothing special. Our room was nicely decorated. We booked a river view room, but it wasn't worth the extra money. If you are going to stay here, just stay in a courtyard room and save your cash to buy more wine! The pool was also nice, but it was on the cold side. A jacuzzi would be a nice addition. The location was good. We could walk to the downtown part of Napa, but the city shuts down after 6 pm. Next time we are in wine country we will stay further north or in Sonoma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle R
Reviews.Content: When we first pulled up to the hotel I was a little bit worried because it doesnt look like much from the outside. Once you go inside though that totally changes. We had a great suite with a balcony overlooking the river. The room was above and beyond what I expected. Also, the breakfast was way more than a normal continental one, it included eggs, hash browns, cheeses, and all kinds of other good things. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that wants a nice hotel in napa without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: rosieg18
Reviews.Content: We were guests at this hotel for 2 nights - we were VERY disappointed in the service and upkeep of this hotel. 1. Upon arriving the bell man made NO effort to help us and suggested we pull around the sided and go in that way. 2. The concierge was VERY unfriendly and cold/curt. She seemed annoyed that we were asking ?s and sent us to a restaurant for lunch that was actually closed! She also made no effort in giving good directions - it was "just turn on first street and you will find it..." And of course we couldn't. 3. She was often on break and again was not helpful at all in asssisting w/ dinner reservations for both nights. We ended up doing it on our own. 4. The room itself was "tired looking". The bedspread was worn and the pillow shams were actually ripped. The room had a musty smell. 5. This hotel was VERY expensive - save your $ - book elsewhere. I would NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel:”
Reviews.Author: MJRTZ
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! This hotel is phenomenal. The room was spacious and very clean. I do not remember the last time I was so relaxed. The food in the hotel was great and the cheese, crackers and wine delicious. Downtown Napa is nice and they had a fabulous Farmer's Market on Thursday July 3rd that was spectacular. Lot's of food, wine, music, fruits, and much more. It was excellent. The pool was small but I must say that the water ws divine. I couldn't believe how great the water felt. This hotel seems to have amost everything pretty much perfect. Even the mini fridge in the room is inexpensive... $1.59 for a cold coke. Many hotels I have stayed in charge $4.00. My only complaint would actually be with the Manager that happened to be working the front desk when we arrived. She was not rude but she was not welcoming either. Very dry and seemed to be bothered. The male Manager was excellent. He came over and apologized for some slight noise that they were making when fixing a light fixture when we first arrived. It was no bother really, but he was gracious. I recommend this hotel 100%. It is one of the best that I have stayed in and I travel frequently. I hope that you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bcforce
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the River Terrace. For the price, it was excellent! Our room was large, clean, and comfortable. The jacuzzi tub was a nice addition. We ate breakfast at the hotel, and were pleasantly surprized. We ate dinner at Cole's Chop House, which was a little pricey for us, but the dinner was tremendous... well worth the extra few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Trvltex
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Napa. My friend booked the hotel through Hotwire therefore, I knew I wouldn't be disappointed but the hotel was more than I expected. Front desk personnel was very courteous. The lobby is spacious with plenty of seating areas. From the lobby you're able to see the inviting -courtyard like- seating area on the other side of the hotel overlooking the woods and hills of Napa. I'm very critical when it comes to hotel pillows. Most hotels provide flimsy pillows, not here. The rooms are equiped with over-sized and comfortable pillows. Our room had a nice balcony, mini bar and an LCD flat screen tv. One small detail I particular enjoyed is the fact that the complimentary coffee with the complimentary breakfast is served in coffee mugs and not sytrofoam cups like most hotels of the same class. Only because the hotel experienced a power failure the morning we checked out that I don't rate it excellent, but my experience there nevertheless was above average. I definitely recommend this hotel for your next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLANEMAN10
Reviews.Content: By far this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. It is like a lodge/winery. It is very beautiful. The lobby is elegant and very appealing. The staff were extra friendly. Our rooms were very well appointed and very comfortable. The hotel is situated on a river, the patio and outside terrace is on the rivers edge. Your rate includes breakfast, you can eat outside and enjoy the view. It is in town. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wilburforce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn, Napa, for 5 nights in June 2008. The hotel was very clean and the room and bathroom spacious. The staff were friendly. We took advantage of the free buffet breakfast which consisted of fruit, cereal, pastries, eggs and ham along with tea/coffee, juice etc... We ate on the outside terrace which was a nice way to start the day. We had considered spending extra on a river view room with balcony but I don't think the extra money would have been worth it because our room was really nice. We used the pool a couple of times and found it clean and tidy. The only critisism I would have of the hotel is that they only served wine and beer at the bar. All around, a very good hotel - worth the money - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but great things to say about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristenNJ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn over Memorial Day Weekend. It was our first time to Napa and after much research, I decided on the RIver Terrace Inn because the price was reasonable and it looked great. The pictures do not lie! The hotel has the perfect balance of modern yet Napa Valley charm. The rooms are spacious and our room included a balcony. The bathrooms are very luxurious and the room includes 2 refridgeraters and flat screen TV. The hotel itself is lovely. The lobby is warm and inviting which lends itself to a great bar and seating area next to the fireplace. There is a room attached that has tables for breakfast, etc. The outside seating area is the best- it over looks the river, has a fire pit and we ate breakfast out there all three of our days spent here. And the breakfast! It's delicious and you can eat as much as you want. The scrambled eggs with sundried tomatos were my favorite. The muffins were also very fresh and tasty. Unfortunately, we didn't have the time to utilize the outdoor pool but it's a perfect size for hotel and looked very clean. The service at hotel was also very good. The staff is fairly young, but they do try to accomodate you from organizing wine tours, restaurant reservations, etc. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jiq4430
Reviews.Content: Room was good. Spacious and clean. Bathroom was likewise. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: pigtails216
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I recently stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Although the room was a little small, the price and the staff more then made up for it. Everything we asked for to make our stay more comfortable was provided quickly. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to crash after a long day of wine tasting! Also, they have small refridgerators in the room so you can store your own food. Huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptively Nice”
Reviews.Author: sachikowong
Reviews.Content: When we looked at pictures of the River Terrace Inn on the internet, the rooms seemed lovely and spacious, especially since the prices weren't as high as many of the hotels in Napa and it's surrounding areas. Everything was all booked up in Yountville and Ruherford so we went with the River Terrace. The inclusion of a jacuzzi tub and balcony with a view of the river didn't hurt either. When we pulled up, I was skeptical because it looked like a rather large hotel and I figured it would be cheesy. I was wrong. The rooms are incredibly spacious. Our king sized bed was amazingly comfortable, the bathroom was large and nicely lit with an awesome jacuzzi tub and the balcony is a great place to take in the view with a glass of wine.
