There was even a nicely lit vanity area outside of the bathroom for me to do my make up. We walked around and checked out the fire pits and pool area and although we didn't hang out in either, they looked like great places to gather with friends and gab. All in all, the River Terrace is great. Staff is friendly and efficient and rooms are comfy, quiet and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: pghweb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Terrace Inn on a trip to Northern California. The rooms and bathrooms were very nice and well-equipped. The complementary breakfast was open early and had something for everyone. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CordeliaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in suite on 3rd floor, river side with balcony. Very nice room, FANTASTIC jacuzzi tub, snack fridge with drinks (for a fee), another empty fridge for food you bring. Quiet, comfortable. Included breakfast well above and beyond what was expected. Croissants, bagels, pastries, mini muffins, variety of breads, lox, capers, scrambled eggs w/sun dried tomatoes, green onions, breakfast potatoes, cheese plate, mozzarella and tomato plate dressed in olive oil, all kinds of juices, coffee, teas...etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay while enjoying wine country”
Reviews.Author: TripNdazy1
Reviews.Content: The River Terrace Inn was a great place to stay. My wife and I came to Napa Valley for our honeymoon and we could not have been more pleased with the River Terrace Inn. The hotel staff was amazing and went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms were very clean and we had a beautiful view overlooking the Napa River. The complimentary breakfast was very good and the best part of all, it was free. Also, if you felt like staying in after a long day of wine tasting, they had tons of DVD's you could rent for free. I would recommend this place to anyone going to the Napa Valley area. The only slight downfall is that its not extremely close to the wineries, but that is only a minute problem.

Reviews.Title: “the river was great”
Reviews.Author: mattncsu1
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay. Nice room and great breakfast in the morning. Staff was helpful with resturant ideas. Good location to the wineries. They had alot of nice details. They had DVD's at the front desk to check out for free. I did not bring my laptop on the trip, but again they had one at the front desk that you could check out for free for the 1st hour. Plenty of time to check my email. it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ocknotgirl
Reviews.Content: When I first read some of the reviews posted here, I was very skeptical! But I loved the Inn! We were on the side where the construction was (nearly finished) and have no complaints. We were nicely greeted by the Front Desk. The room was very clean, smelled fresh and comfy! The room comes with a free breakfast which was nicely waiting for us in the morning. The breakfast although small ( again free so I wasn't expecting the Grand Slam at Dennys) was good. They had scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, and large array of pastries. Beverages included coffee, juices and milk. There is a large fireplace in the lobby and bar. The lounge is very cozy. Outside of the hotel (rear) there is a river (although not the Mississippi) its pretty and relaxing to view. The Inn has many tables and chairs, should you wish to have breakfast lunch or dinner outside. Also, the Inn has a large booklet of dvds you can rent for free (each room has a dvd player)! There are I would totally recommend the River Terrace Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Napa Valley Marathon”
Reviews.Author: marathonfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn for Napa Valley Marathon weekend. The hotel offered a terrific marathon rate. The staff was helpful immediately upon check-in with maps to the marathon expo and information about their shuttle service to the starting line (a real bonus). On race morning, the hotel offered a complimentary breakfast to the runners, beginning at 5 am. After the race, the hotel gave us time to shower and check out at our leisure. The rooms were large, clean and family-friendly. And the location is convenient to the finish line of the marathon. We were extremely satisfied with our stay and will stay again when we visit Napa in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Romance”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the River Terrace on our Anniversary. After staying here, I can not imagine staying elsewhere while in Napa. The hotel staff was one of the friendliest that we have encountered (inside the U.S.). The breakfast was delicious, the wine and desserts divine, and the room was beyond our expectations. This hotel MADE our Anniversary. Cheers to one of the only hotel staffs we've met that could rival the hoteliers in Thailand!

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: PebblesFolsom_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room approximately 2 months prior to our stay at the River Terrace Inn. A river view with a terrace was requested. When we arrived we were told that we requested a Villa view. The Villa view overlooked the parking lot and Interstate. When we entered the room it had no view at all. The only view overlooked the top of the car port over the entrance to the Inn and a lone flag pole. So we went back to the reception desk to let them know that this again was not anything that we had requested 2 month earlier. The receptionist told us that she agreed that the room didn't have a view. Note: This was the same receptionist that gave us the room 10 minutes earlier. The receptionist told us that for a small fee we could upgrade to a villa view. AKA view of the parking lot and Interstate. The room was okay, nothing special. The customer service was horriable. We read previous horrible service reviews about this Inn but we had to find out for ourselves. One good thing, we didn't let it ruin our time in Napa. We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: BsyB
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to write a positive review for this hotel up until check out day. At check-in, I had requested a late check out for departure day. I was asked to call back the night before check out to confirm if this was possible. I did as I was instructed and received the okay from the night staff (friendly Pete) that we could stay an extra hour and check out at noon. Check out is regularly at 11:00am. At 11:15am on check out day, I received a call from reception informing me that if we were not out of our room in 15 minutes, we would be charged an additional nights stay. I informed the clerk that we were approved to stay in the room for an additional hour and was rudely advised that I was misinformed. The clerk hung up before I could say anything further. Rather than argue over 30 minutes, we finished our packing and proceeded to reception to check out. As I was lined up waiting to be served, I could hear the same girl (Niki) calling other rooms that had not checked out at 11am. It was clear from her conversations with these guests that a late check out was also granted to several other hotel guests. And, like me, they were rudely told that if they were not out of their rooms soon, an additional night's stay would be charged. I could not believe my ears. When I finally got to the desk, i informed Niki that she should understand we were approved the late check out. Rather than apologize for the inconvenience, she brushes off my comments by saying Pete had no authority to okay late check outs. As a frequent international business traveller, I have had my fair share of hotel issues. I can honestly say that Niki is hands down the rudest hotel staff I have encountered in memory. I was willing to forego the misunderstanding on the check out times as well as the clear problems they have internally on who is authorized to do what, but I could not ignore the rudeness. Rather than effectively turn an unfortunate situation to a positive by simply apologizing for the error, she denounces a fellow colleague and angers a guest. My advice to the hotel management of River Terrace. Reassess your staff's communication and customer service skills. My brief and highly unfortunate encounter with Niki was enough to sour my entire experience at this hotel and ensure that no positive endorsements will be coming from me.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Crawf0rd
Reviews.Content: I read several bad reviews of this hotel before our trip and wasn't sure what to expect. I also felt like I needed to write a review to defend this hotel. We had a great trip and we loved this hotel. The staff was great, helpful and pleasant. The decor is cozy and tasteful. The rooms are very nice and spacious. We booked through priceline and I did not feel that this hotel discriminated against us like many other hotels do. We received the king bed that I requested with no problems. Our room also had a couch, a coffee table, a desk, chair, a built in bench, a fully stocked mini-bar and another refrigerator and 2 bottles of complimentary water. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the bathroom was nice and spacious. Our hotel room was spotless as was everywhere in the hotel. We hung out in the lobby by the fireplace and at the bar and sitting areas and it was a very relaxing atmosphere. The lobby area isn't large but we always found a place to sit (there were 5 of us in 2 rooms). We had a great stay and we will definetly stay here next time we come to Napa. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast as well. I couldn't beleive how nice the hotel was for the price. Even at full price this hotel is a great deal. The only thing I was disappointed about was this hotel does not have a hot tub but it does have a heated pool that was very warm. Excellent hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We got the amentities advertised and more...”
Reviews.Author: MuffyMo
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews, I feel I must defend River Terrace Inn. We came here for our honeymoon and were surprised by a bottle of Champagne and a card from the staff. The staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast was better than nearly any complementary breakfast I've had, and the hotel decor is beautiful. We were fortuante enough to come around Christmas and were welcomed by a very cozy lobby and bar decorated for the holidays. Our room had a great jacuzzi hot tub, a king bed, plasma tv, and balcony with a river view. We also had a refrigerator and seperate wet bar. So the amentities advertised do exist and the cost is reasonable. We booked 2 nights and got the 3rd free and I felt the value was amazing for what we received. Perhaps it was the time of year we went, but if you book the right kind of room, you will definitely enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: HalfMoonBayJane
Reviews.Content: OK, it's been a month since I wrote to the manager of the River Terrace Inn, telling him of my problems with his hotel, and he has not bothered to reply. This represents my main complaint about this place -- no one cares about you and your problems! First, the occasion was my husband's 60th birthday. I planned to take him on the wine train and to sample some of the great restaurants in the valley. We had sailed our boat up the Napa River a long time ago, and enjoyed the whole experience. I was entranced by the River Terrace Inn website, and reserved the very best room, "with a balcony and view of the river". What we got was a ground floor room with a view of a pile of gravel. I went to the front desk to complain that this is not what I had asked for. They looked at me blankly and said that was all that was available. There was no apology or expression of concern. While I was there I inquired of the activity desk about Copia, and the woman was unfriendly and uninformative, had nothing about Copia, and didn't offer to find any. Next, my husband's cell phone disappeared during the pleasant breakfast they provide on the terrace (on very tiny plates), and when we reported it there was again a total lack of concern. Given the type of clientele at the hotel (well heeled) it is likely a staff person found it or took it. And when we called its number, it was busy! It was not lost, for sure. It is too bad the staff has had no customer service training -- it would make it a much nicer place. The room was large, and it had a tiny screened in balcony, hardly wide enough to sit down in, but who wanted to look at the pile of gravel? And the walls are paper thin. It was possible to hear every sound in the next room. The bathroom is pleasant, but on the first morning, my husband had to clean ants out of the shower. Please note that the hotel is not at all that close to the downtown area -- you really have to like walking to make that a true statement. It is also close to a lot of construction (there is a plan in place to completely renovate the riverfront). I would come back to this place if they would give me the room I asked for, if they would train their staff to be a little more pleasant and concerned for the comfort of their guests. The price they charge implies service, but there was none of that quality. I don't think I'll give them a second chance. There are lots of other places in Napa with a good reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Just Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Galindenba
Reviews.Content: This was a good location as a "base" to tour the nearby wineries. The accommodations were nice, but not incredibly luxurious and not for what they were charging. The staff we encountered were very nice even putting together a fair dinner after we arrived late. The buffet breakfast in the morning is a nice touch before one goes out exploring. Some of the rooms have a view of the river, but only one side of the building. frankly even the river view is nothing special. As has been said by others on this site, if you're on the wrong side of the building, you will be looking at the parking lot. It's a fairly nice place, I think one could do better in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, just don't expect the river view”
Reviews.Author: leighlee0829
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a friend's wedding and was very happy with the experience, despite a bumpy start. Our first room was on the first floor, right off the lobby. It was a nice room -- comfortable bed; nice, clean bathroom; and a little balcony that looked out onto the river. But this also meant it was really loud -- we heard everyone outside on the deck, everyone getting breakfast early in the morning, and everyone checking in. We requested a different room and they graciously checked us into a place on the second floor. Unfortunately, we had no patio and our view of the river and woods was replaced with a view of the parking lot, but it was quiet. And you really can't overrate a good night's sleep, even with no view. The breakfast was above average for your usual hotel, with scrambled eggs and hot dishes as well as pastries, bagels, coffee and tea. I loved the back outside area with picnic tables and fire pits -- a great place to chill out with friends and a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “was mislead by the hotel”
Reviews.Author: pifutravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises rooms with river view AND balcony which do NOT have either view to the river nor balcony. We had booked one room with riverview and balcony to find out when checking in that 1st floor (that is ground floor) rooms do not have balconies and although located on the river side you do not see the river but have an overview to the car park or some sort of sidewalk. When I complained at the reception the very unfriendly staff gave me a lecture that at the time of booking ( i.e. 2 months in advance)they ran out of the riverside rooms with balcony and view so the only available RIVERVIEW ROOM W/ BALCONY was without those 2 things that I had chosen this hotel for!!! Let alone that I had paid the higher price. Is that fair? I don't think so. Is the hotels's website misleading? I think so. You don't get what you have paid for. On the flipside, the hotel is nice, rooms alike

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the River Terrace”
Reviews.Author: raydle
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the River Terrace Inn. We had a lovely room with a balcony overlooking the river. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was luxurious. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but I was very pleasantly surprised. Breakfast was also a surprise, the food was more than your average free hotel breakfast fare, it was fresh and included a variety of good options. The hotel also offers free DVD rentals for the room, which I thought was a nice bonus since there isn't a ton going on in Napa at night. I also loved the location, it was walking distance from downtown , which was great for venturing out for dinner and drinks in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1unhappyguest
Reviews.Content: I had reservations to stay at the river Terrace Inn, but decided to stay else where when i was greeted by a very rude front desk receptionist. She ignored my request to speak to the managr on duty. Finally I was able to speak to the manager, Jeff along with the assistant manager, Dawn. They were both very rude and did not take my complaint seriously. They both were out of line and showed poor management skills. I believe guest should be treated with respect and courtesy. It was the worst experience I've ever had in Napa. I would NEVER stay there again and would NEVER recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcoltrain
Reviews.Content: I will start with, I had no clothes for 4 days in San Fran. Airline Lost my luggage - that's a shocker! On 4th day we arrived in Napa. This hotel was a huge step up from previous one we had in San Fran. People could not be more nicer to us with instructions, directions, and places to go. Room was big, great view of city. A little loud in room above us, but that happens anywere you go. There is a Westin being built next door, I believe this hotel has to step up in quality (comfort, cleaness, and friendleness) to keep business. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Would stay here again if needed. Also, Silverado trail is not far from this hotel. Best route to take for Wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: el2t
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The lobby of the inn looks like a big ol log cabin. The rooms were fantastic. The walls in the room were light yellow in color; almost tuscan. There was lots of granite counter tops from the bar to the bathroom sink. The bathroom was wonderful. The shower area had a sliding glass door and their were dual shower heads. The bed was quite comfortable and the room was spacious. The tvs were okay. There was free rentals from their dvd library. The hotel is right next to the Napa river. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: cami1978
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, spacious rooms with soft modern decor. Very comfortable bed. Nice Sony sound machine (waves, birds, etc.) Large, clean jacuzzi in the balcony rooms. Large DVD library with free access (two at a time). Very nice balcony overlooking the Napa river and grapevines (ask for a balcony room away from the communal outdoor breakfast area if you want a quiet morning in bed). Great hot breakfast included in the price of the room with a variety of food (mozzarella/tomato, salmon, eggs, bagels, etc.). Beautiful lodge atmosphere in the common areas with a fireplace and huge wooden bar. Very nice wooden deck with many tables for breakfast or anytime. Good location -- a little too far to walk downtown to eat, though. However, there is no doorman to speak of. For $300/night, a doorman/bellman should be available to help unload bags. Very young staff, occasionally outspoken to the point of being rude. We also found the price to be very high -- The room was $229/night on a weekday (a good value), but jumped to $319/night for a Friday. That feels an awful lot like price gouging.

Reviews.Title: “Website is misleading...”
Reviews.Author: NYC13
Reviews.Content: We booked a River King Balcony room at the River Terrance Inn last week. Our room was disappointingly on the first floor and there was no view of the river, just a dirt road and parking lot. It is very misleading because a "balcony" room does not seem to imply the first floor. Moreover, the pictures on the website are shot from a low angle which leads the viewer to believe it is more of a country setting. While the accommodations are very nice and clean, the hotel is by no means in that serene of a setting and has more of the feel of being in a strip mall. We were both very disappointed as we booked based on the pictures on the website. The staff even reiterated to us that the website is misleading and that they have complained to Corporate about it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our trip!”
Reviews.Author: smes1102
Reviews.Content: We were on a trip down the coast in California and started in Napa. We stayed in 5 different hotels on our trip, including 2 different 4-star hotels. The River Terrace Inn was the best hotel we stayed in. The rooms were large, the beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were clean, the breakfast had a great selection, and last but not least -- the staff was EXTREMELY helpful! My husband is a hotel snob and loved it! He was hesitant because of the great price and even went in to check out the room before agreeing to stay there. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tubesteak
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the River Terrace Inn was fabulous. The rooms are spacious with large bathrooms, are tastefully furnished and have good linens and towels. Our room did not have a balcony as we were in one of their less expensive rooms but it had large windows so it was still bright and airy. The breakfast buffet is included in the room price and was very good with a good selection of healthy and not so healthy choices. That same quality extended to the food service for lunch and dinner which is served on the terrace which actually is right on the Napa River and provided a good venue for wildlife viewing. There is also a wine bar with a good selection of wine by the glass. The staff is outstanding. They are pleasant, helpful, friendly and efficient and the housekeeping is exceptional. The place shines with cleanliness and no request is too small or too large to get immediate and efficient attention. The pool is a bit on the small side and the inside seating area for breakfast can get crowded but I would highly recommend staying here, the only caveat being that currently there is a large ongoing construction project right next to the hotel and the noise was a problem from time to time. However, there is no doubt that if we stay in Napa again we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will return!”
Reviews.Author: skijmm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay here for our Honeymoon and it was a wonderful choice. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly faces and felt like we were important to their business. This was our first trip to Napa so we were constantly at the front desk asking for recommendations to restaurants. There was an extensive DVD selection, which you could view for free in your room. We had a King suite with a balcony and jacuzzi. The room was large as well as the bathroom. We had a view that looked over the Napa River there are however balcony rooms that over look the parking lot and street. The breakfast in the mornings was nice, however we stayed for 5 nights, and they did offer the same thing everyday so we went out to breakfast as well to have some variety. I can see how if you had a standard room this hotel could be like any other hotel you could stay at for a lot less. I suggest spending a little more to get the nicer accommodations, it's worth it. Staying on the weekdays is less expensive than on the weekends. The only complaint we had was with the valet. There were a few different valets we interacted with, 2 were fine and very helpful but there was one that everytime he helped us asked us if we were checking in (mind you this happened 4 times), never opened the passenger door, and always asked us if he need to park it (well yes you need to park the car your the valet!) Other than this one valet we enjoyed our stay and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: plinebaugh
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and comfortable rooms. We had a balcony room overlooking the river which was very nice. In addition to the cleanliness, it was the little touches that mattered. A DVD player in the room was a welcome ammenity as was the sound machine. I had never used one before, but slept like a baby while it was on. The breakfast buffet was extremely welcome and eating out on the back patio was the way to start a great day. The geese were a good touch and fun to watch. Sitting out on the patio in the evening after dinner, around the fireplace with a good glass of wine was romantic and relaxing. The staff were very friendly and helpful with advise and tips for the day. The cleaning staff were very good and attentive. Another nice touch was FREE bottled water delivery to the room each evening. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay at a hotel rather than a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: queenyaya
Reviews.Content: This was such a good find for us. We have stayed in Napa and Sonoma many times, but were traveling with our 2 year old this time. It is a good location, has a wonderful free breakfast, and nice pool area. The room service is even reasonable (and great food to boot). The staff was very kind to us and the rooms were spacious and up to date (bathrooms included). I highly recommend it and we plan to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: TAMUSC98
Reviews.Content: I went with my mom, my cousin and aunt for a nice mother daughter weekend. Lets start with the two bellboys/valets that stand outside at the valet stand and do not move an inch when you pull up your car. I had to get out and ask if this was the valet area and the response (still not moving for the valet stand) was "yeah or you could park it yourself over there." We parked ourselves and struggled with our bags up the stairs to the entrance while the two young "valets/bellboys" continued their conversation and did not offer to help. When given our rooms we were told there were no rooms with double beds. The manager - SHEILA M. - came over and could not have been more condesending, rude and unhelpful. She insisted that I booked the room for one bed, when I showed her my expedia print out showing I booked with two queens she actually shrugged her shoulders at me. I had to get extremely loud in the lobby before they miraculously found a room with two double beds. I would NEVER go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: busymakingwings
Reviews.Content: We decided to pay more than we would usually for this hotel as we would be staying here for three nights ( we were doing a 17 day tour of California) so we thought we would splash out and treat ourselves. When we checked in we were given a very nice room but it did not have a bath only a shower. It was a nice shower area but after a five hour drive I like to bathe my aching limbs so we went back to the front desk and asked for a room with a bath. The very young staff on duty dithered and said none were available unless we paid extra which we were not prepared to do. They told us to call back but each time they kept saying come back again.The most annoying thing was one young lady kept saying 'Checking out' each time we went back - she totally forgot who we were each time even though once it had only been 30 minutes since we had enquired. The following day an older member of staff was on duty and she told us the hotel always give 'Expedia' bookings the rooms with no baths. We complained that was not detailed in the booking so she then immediately found us another room at no extra cost. So it became clear that the inexperienced young staff the previous day were aware of that but did not have the authority to change our room or did not have the flair to take the time to address the problem and take responsibility themselves. The rooms are very nice and the beds are extremely comfortable. However, there are signs warning you not to touch various goodies like the mini-bar etc are you will be charged - it was abit like a mine field! The balconies are like window boxes and overlook the car park. There is a new hotel being built next door and the building site overlooks the very small pool which is shaded for most of the day. A long floating pump was a nuisance too so you could not swim easily. The breakfast was good even though they kept running out of things quickly and there were no trays to ferry your goodies outside. There were also no large spoons to eat cereal only teaspoons. The terrace is next to the river but you can hardly see it and it is only sunny at breakfast time not in the evening which was a shame. The young porters were very helpful drawing maps etc to get into town which is quite a long way away from the hotel if you don't want to drink and drive. We took a Platypus tour of the wine valley and we would thoroughly recommend it. The lady driver was excellent and the other ten people on the bus were great fun. It was the best day of the trip and we didn't have to worry about driving all day. Lunch was thrown in too. Our opinion was that the hotel catered alot for corporate functions (there were plenty of people staying at the hotel who were on courses etc) but for the people who pay with their own hard earned cash the hotel was quite expensive for the service provided. We would not stay here again but would stay in Napa town or in Sonoma town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Eventchick
Reviews.Content: I booked a group event at River Terrace Inn in Napa, California. It was a very complicated event with some folks arriving a week early and some guests spending only one night. The River Terrace Inn (RTI) jumped through hoops to get me what I needed for my group and then make changes to my guests' schedules. All this in a time when the hotel was sold out over my dates. RTI was always straight with me about my contractual obligations and worked with me to make sure my company had a fair deal. They jumped through hoops to re-sell my released rooms. River Terrace Inn has a very sweet property and the guest rooms come with breakfast and access to the fitness center. There are no hidden fees. The staff ranged from helpful to superhero. The property is within walking distance to restaurants, downtown Napa, and some major event venues. If I had to find something to knock them about, it would be that the lobby bar does not stay open late enough. Although, I'm sure I could have asked them to do so. In all my years of corporate event planning, I've yet to find a "perfect" hotel, but RTI provided everything we needed and with good attitude. My company was so happy with RTI and the value provided to our guests, that we are already looking to book a big event for 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with RTI”
Reviews.Author: CObeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn for three nights at the beginning of July. After reading some poor reviews, I was a bit nervous, but we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The location was centrally located, and an easy drive to both Hwy 29 and the Silverado Trail. We had a Village Side King room- I would not pay the extra money for a river view, didn't seem worth the $. We immediately requested a room away from the construction next door (a new Westin) and we were glad we did, since you can hear the hammering, which starts very early, even on the far side of the hotel. They do provide high-end noise machines, which helped. Our room was quiet, and comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful, with nice bath products, robes, etc. The bed was very comfortable. We thought the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate, and we enjoyed the free DVDs provided at the front desk. My only complaint was the inconsistency of the front desk service- it was very hit or miss, depending who was working. We also were glad we checked our bill carefully- we were charged $30 for a DVD we had returned. I'd recommend this hotel- good value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - great experience”
Reviews.Author: bcgtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Napa and stayed here. I wasn't expecting much as I heard that the town of Napa wasn't so great and it was too far removed from the main stretch of wineries. I was pleasantly surprised that this hotel ended up beeing a great pick. It was pretty convenient to to all the wineries (we just started as far north as we wanted to go for the day and worked our way back south toward the hotel) and the staff was unbelievably helpful with all questions, taxi & dinner reservations, and wineries appointments. The fire-pit on the back patio was also a nice and relaxing way to end the night with a glass of wine:)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: umichfan
Reviews.Content: Our group had eight rooms at the RIver Terrace Inn for three nights after a long business meeting in San Francisco. We got a great deal on the hotel's web site--three nights for the price of two in their deluxe king suites. The staff was terrific. The rooms were very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. There is a great spread for breakfast which is included. It was very comfortable to lounge outside on the patio next to the river with a newspaper for an unhurried breakfast. The lounge and bar were very comfortable and the bartenders were extremely informative. The only problem was early morning noise due to construction next door. Unfortunately I never got the chance to enjoy the wonderful looking spa tub and I would have felt guilty using all that water because it was so large. I never turned on the TV, but I would have expected a nice flat screen TV. I highly recommend the place especially for the great deal we got. There are so many great restaurants nearby that it was not a bother to not have a restaurant in the hotel. Who ever eats at the hotel restuarants? Le Cuvee in front of the hotel was very good. Zuzu's had great tapas--just skip the lamb. It was tough and not very flavorable with a very heavy, sweet sauce.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nive Hotel, Great Price For the Area”
Reviews.Author: M102129
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located at the bottom of the Napa Valley, close to all the wineries. The hotel is very new and the staff was excellent. The staff did everything expected of a nice hotel but then exceeded my expectations. The staff was helpful and very friendly. One example of how I felt the staff when above and beyond was when my wife and I had returned from Wine Tasting with two glasses (they were dirty). We went out the next day and came back to a tidy room, in addition, the cleaning staff had also cleaned our wine glasses. We will return to the Napa Valley in the future and we will stay at this Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel from a VERY PICKY TRAVELER...”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Smith1969
Reviews.Content: Greetings. Following are my random thoughts on my stay here... I took my mother and sister to this hotel for a 2 night stay and we loved it. You can see from the many traveler photos that it is quite nice. It is not as inexpensive as some other hotels around which we found online for about $70/night, but since they were very basic and far from where we wanted to be and looked questionable as to their quality (leaving us wondering what we might find under the bed or sofa cushions and things like that), we ended up choosing the Napa Valley River Terrace Inn. It has a great location and a very very nice atmosphere for a tight "Napa Budget" (hotels are more expensive in Napa than in San Francisco where there are lots of business travelers and competition). Our room with two very comfortable and clean beds during high season was $129/night (including a free FULL continental breakfast) and we had 3 people in our room (the third was at no extra cost). We booked directly through the site as it offered the best value AND it allowed us to cancel up to 24 hours before our arrival (in case there was a problem or schedule change) with no cancel fee (some other sites on the net would not let us cancel for a full refund if we had booked this hotel through their site). The outside parking area and approach was quite nice with palm trees lining the driveway, and the lobby was quite beautiful too... the large leather chairs and the the large lodge-like fireplace were great!! It added some nice atmosphere to the lobby. The river and the tall trees in the back added a very quiet mood to the hotel and there was a nice jogging path and rather large park next to the hotel corner in the back. Some people prefer to pay more to have rooms that face the back and its view, but we had a room on a higher floor and on the end (our request in order to get the most privacy) with a view of the parking lot... normally this would NOT be so great at some other hotel, but their parking lot was quite clean, and beautifully landscaped... and the backside had lots of people in the morning walking around and eating breakfast anyway, so we felt the parking lot facing rooms were by far the best value... besides, they were cooler in the mornings as the sun faces the back side of the hotel making the front side in the shade and comfortable to sit on the balcony and watch the world... the backside I would imagine is too bright and maybe warm in the mornings and with the all the people below and noisy geese, I would choose the parking lot view without any hesitation. Besides, if you really want to sit and watch the river, then go downstairs and use some of the benches provided on the very edge of the river just behind the hotel... you will get the same effect and save yourself some money. The only problems were totally minor... 1)a free dvd we borrowed from the front desk's wide English and Spanish dvd selection was scratched which meant it kept skipping during play... a bit annoying, but since it was a free rental, what could I say.... besides, we just went downstairs and got another dvd and it was fine... and 2) the hotel staff was a little bit too casual I felt in how they stood around behind the front desk... HOWEVER, they were very friendly and kind and helpful about things to do in the area, but it just seemed that if they had been a bit more professional then this hotel could up its star rating... afterall, professionalism costs nothing, but it is what separates a good hotel from a GREAT hotel. It makes a strong positive statement which makes customers feel they participated in a quality experience and ABSOLUTELY want to return (a bit picky, I know, but if these two problems are the only negative points I could find with this hotel, then you should NOT hesitate to stay here... you will be quite pleasantly impressed I think). The breakfast was all totally continental, but it was so great and not cheap by any means. It definately would fill you up and the selection was wide... oh, and the juice was so good... I think it was 100% juice, NOT concentrate. The bathroom was nicely done with stone tile in the shower area, NOT a plastic surround!! It felt rather luxurious... Overall, this place is NOT a 5-star hotel. In reality, it is a 3 star hotel that has a 4.5 star quality feel. It really feels like it is trying its best to be something memorable, and so I would give it a definate high-grade hotel rating, and for the money we spent on our room which included a very satisfying breakfast, we felt we got a very very good deal, esp for the location and beautiful surroundings. PS, THE ROOM BALCONIES HAVE NICE COMFORTABLE CHAIRS AND A SMALL TABLE ON THEM AND THE WINDOWS AND DOORS ARE PANE GLASS WHICH ADDS A TOUCH OF CLASS TO THE ROOM AND BALCONY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting”
Reviews.Author: pauljaz1
Reviews.Content: Business trip 5 nights week of June 18-22, 2007. Quick, friendly, courteous check-in. Easy parking, valet offered. Cuvee restaurant is a 2 minute walk in front of inn. There is construction on the property south of this for another hotel. The work begins at 7am during the week. Although the hotel has great sound-proofing double-pane windows and solid exterior, you may want to ask for a room in the center or towards the north end. Ask for a rear room facing the river on the second or third floor to see the river, some have balconies. There was nightly turndown, fresh linens and two small water bottles brought to the room each evening. Four wines offered in an electronic stand on counter, with a stocked refrigerator, and a separate personal refrigertor in the room. Sharper Image sound machines in each room. Continental breakfast- fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk, scrambled eggs, diced potatoes, bread, pastries, muffins, asorted juices, coffee. Dine outside on patio or inside. The on-site cafe I did not try for dinner. Free DVD selection. Concierge available. Ask for special winery tour coupons (ie 2for1 tasting) and other freebies from the front desk too. Convienient to Wine Train and downtown district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hotmamaof2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the River Terrace in was nothing other than fantastic. The front dest was extremely warm and friendly as soon as we entered the door. They were very knowledgeable about the Napa County. They went above and beyond with anything that we needed help with. They booked a day at a wonderful spa for us. All we had to do was tell them what treatments we wanted and they set it all up for us. They helped book a day of wine tasting that was simply amazing. They were nice enough to give us discounts for the tastings at local winerys. We enjoyed a relaxing day by the pool. Since it was so hot, the pool was the perfect thing to refresh us. The food service was great. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner on the terrace. Our room was exceptionally clean. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel is close to downtown Napa where there is shopping, movies, restaurants etc. Our stay was so wonderful that reading the other reviews on this website really surprise me. If and when we return to the Napa Valley, the River Terrace Inn will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Napa”
Reviews.Author: bigwheelz
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to stay the night in Napa on the way to my friends wedding, which was the next morning in Sonoma. As I drove down what appeared to be the main drive through downtown Napa I saw the River Terrace Inn off to the right. It was a newer looking hotel nestled next to the Napa River. We checked in with the friendly front desk staff and were able to get a room at a reasonable price. Prior to going to our room we had a drink at the hotel's bar. They had a nice array of wine and beer on tap. When we got to the room we found it to be very nice and clean. The bathroom had a cool Jacuzzi tub which was perfect for two! The bed was more comfortable than my own at home. Overall we enjoyed our night at the River Terrace Inn and would definitely stay there again. Chris Roseville, CA

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tyler01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the best Honeymoon Experience ever. We got to the hotel and in our room was a Complementary bottle of Champagne with a nice card, now that is called going over and beyound there duty. Our room was very nice, talk about having a comfortable bed to sleep on, never gone to a hotel with such nice beds!!!!! Got to sit on the terrace that over looks the creek that was flowing with a glass of champagne, that was so nice a peaceful. Plus the view was very beautiful!! My husband and I have decided to go back in a couple months because we loved it so much. Thanks Again to the Hotel Staff for all there great hospitality. We'll be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous River Terrace Inn in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: ldlp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I showed up at the River Terrace Inn without a reservation and were immediately given a very clean, comfortable and well decorated room for the night last week. The bathroom was also very clean and large with a nice separate vanity area. The staff behind the desk were quite friendly and helpful. We had drinks and an appetizer at the bar and were impressed with the selection and variety of food and wine offered even though there is no traditional type of restaurant in the inn. The bartenders were extremely knowledgable about local wines. Although small, the grounds extend out to the Napa River making the inn seem larger. We enjoyed our stay so much, we booked a return visit later this summer for our wedding anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: onenamillion
Reviews.Content: It was just terrible. The front desk staff should all be terminated and rehired. They were rude and errogant. I can understand why since their role model, the Assistant GM, was the worst. She had a attitude that does not fit the hospitality industry. Doesn't the owner care about how his staff treats the guests. The breakfast was okay if you like moldy bread and cold eggs. There was no place to sit inside and the service was very disappointing. Maybe the food staff was new because nobody seemed to know what they were doing. I thought I would go swimming and the pool was just gross. I didn't want to even get in it. There were some type of huge dead bugs at the bottom of the pool. Luxury hotel?? Yeah right more like big mistake. I would definately try one of the other hotels that where you don't hear the rats are in the walls and people being intimate in the room next door!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: volleyguyny
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the River Terrace Inn well in advance on a well-established internet website. When we arrived, we were told that they were "overbooked" and they would be forced to put us up in a "comparable" hotel down the street. This comparable hotel ended up being a total dump with none of the same amenities that were offered at the River Terrace Inn. And we were not even refunded any of the price even though the place down the street was much cheaper! Thankfully the reservation was only for one night. I guess it's a great way for them to make some extra money: Charge you for their hotel and then accommodate you in the cheap dump down the street!

Reviews.Title: “avoid this dump”
Reviews.Author: myvieenrose
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just a crop and not worth the money at all! very bad service. The breakfast was awful! The serving table was messy. They served bread that had mold already!!!! The lobby was just a mess. No one cares when you demanded a service. It was a big dissapointment staying there over the weekend and spoiled our holidays.

Reviews.Title: “So, so experience”
Reviews.Author: chriscoe30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the River Terrace Inn with my mom over Mother’s Day weekend 2007 and found that their room rate was priced high at $249 per night. We were booked for a room with two double beds and balcony, which was funny, because I’ve never had a balcony room on the first floor before. Anyway, after visiting our room (on the 1st floor as mentioned) we found that we had a great view…of the parking lot! Our so called “balcony room” was actually a concrete slab with a wooden wall built around it…what a joke! If you stay there and request a balcony room, make sure that they give you one on the 2nd or third floor. I stayed at the RTI in June of 2005 and had a wonderful experience, maybe new management or staff? On a more positive note thought, their beds are about the most comfortable hotel beds I’ve ever slept on. The rooms were clean with nice bathroom fixtures and overall design. And as mentioned, their continental breakfast is pretty darn good. RTI not only serves breads and bagels, but they also have a small hot food selection as well. It’s a pretty good way to start off your day! Overall, I’d recommend this hotel; just make sure you do your homework to see if there is anything else in the area that might be a little closer to downtown and maybe a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Brian_the_Travel_Guy
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely wonderful. We had a King room overlooking the Napa River. We had a small balcony with a table and a couple of chairs for lounging on a lazy afternoon. The hotel also featured a free DVD library at the front desk. Each room had a DVD player and the list of movies was very good, lots of new releases. The best part of the hotel had to be the continental breakfast. This was the most elaborate free breakfast spread I have ever seen. It had your normal bagels and pastries, but that was complimented with scrambled eggs, potatoes, home made granola with different mix ins, a large cheese platter and a large antipasto platter. Of course there was also coffee and tea and juice. They have an outside patio with tables for dining by the river and a big fire pit going to keep you warm.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Saramhs
Reviews.Content: The pool looks big in the picture but is very small and gets little light since the hotel shadow covers it most of the time. The water is not kept at a warm temperature at all. The front desk staff was really rude especially a girl named Kendric that worked there -- what a [--] Housekeeping cleaned and turned down our room the first night but did not the other two nights we stayed. I usually am a happy go lucky person and have worked as a front desk agent for over 5 years. So I usually don't complain unless it is major. BUT STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE -- I even wrote a letter to the general manager of the hotel over a month ago with no response. There are many other better places to stay - and sadly I can say I wish I would have stayed at a Best western or motel 6 than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: DA_1957
Reviews.Content: I really liked the decor of the River Terrace Inn, as well as having the balcony and a river view. The bed was very comfortable, room was clean and we liked lobby area with the wine bar and fireplace. A little disappointed with the complimentary breakfast - the hot food was luke warm and there was no where to sit so we had to bring our food back to our room to eat. We experienced a problem with the air conditioner being too loud -- it woke us every time it came on automatically throughout the night (wish we would have thought of turning it off and opening a window...). We also had a problem with the jacuzzi in our room in that the jets and water would not turn off completely. We reported these problems to hotel management and hopefully they will be corrected. I realize this doesn't sound like a glowing review, but we did like the hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay and great value!”
Reviews.Author: OSUTwoOne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Napa for the last two nights of our honeymoon tour through northern California. Were greeted promptly and enjoyed the complimentary valet parking, although we realized it's not very necessary since ample parking is available and extremely close by. Our check-in was smooth and the front desk was extremely helpful in answering questions. The room itself was much larger than expected, although was appointed as a typical hotel room. However, many of the items appeared new or in very good condition. The jacuzzi tub in the bathroom was incredible! Very deep and powerful jets, definitely check it out! Bed was fairly comfortable, although sleep was somewhat disturbed throughout the night. Our mini fridge (nice, by the way) was VERY loud when it would run its cycle. Unfortunately, we had food stored inside, so we couldn't simply unplug it. Not a huge hassle, but noisy enough to keep us on edge for most of the night. Breakfast was also outstanding. Not sure about all the complaints - this was perhaps the best "complimentary" breakfast we've ever had. Tons of pastries, muffins and bagels; scrambled eggs and potatoes, yogurt, several kinds of juices, coffees; lots of fresh cheeses and cereals. Very filling and great quality. The DVD rental option is a fantastic idea - we got a couple of newer DVDs for our stay and returned them on our departure. Definitely an excellent idea and we're surprised more hotels and inns have not offered this form of entertainment. This was definitely a great place to stay and we'd be back. Good value for off-season prices in Napa and it surely didn't disappoint! Will recommend to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: kevytheman
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Napa. We got a great rate and the service was fantastic. I'm not sure I'd stay in Napa again but if I did it would be here.

Reviews.Title: “Third time as good as the first two”
Reviews.Author: Brugal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the River Terrace on Feb 24th, the third night of our most recent California trip. This was my third stay at this property, the previous two being for three nights each in October of 2005 and 2006. The hotel is located in the city of Napa so if you're expecting a quaint little inn located in the middle of a vineyard or dead end country road this might not be the best place for you. That being said the property is located far enough off of the street where traffic noise isn't an issue. This time we had a third floor room facing the front of the hotel. No problems with noise and you get a great view of the mountains in the distance. Even better, if you sit out back on the heated patio to enjoy a glass of wine, or if you have a room on the backside of the inn you're rewarded with a nice quiet river setting. The location of the River Terrace is perfect for exploring Napa, either by car or by foot. A few restaurants of note are within walking distance. Cuvee, which is good right across the parking lot and Celadon which is outstanding maybe a mile or so away. Also the Copia Center for Wine, Food and Arts is just around the corner. If you enjoy wine tasting I suggest booking the 3:00pm barrel tasting at Del Dotto Vineyards. The tasting takes about 60-90 minutes and is both informative and VERY generous. By the time you have finished the tour I imagine you would have consumed about a bottle of wine on your own. The good thing is you're only about 4 miles away from the hotel at this point so it's easy to get back and rest up before dinner. As has been mentioned by others the River Terrace is a beautiful hotel so I won't repeat most points. The beds here are some of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Noise has never been a problem for me but then again I usually use the nature sound machine that's provided in the room to help me sleep. The gym is small but sufficient. A treadmill, elliptical, and two bikes. The only weights provided are dumbbells which range from 2.5 to 60 lbs. Wireless internet access is available free of charge in all rooms. The bathrooms are decorated with beautiful tile and marble and contain a huge two headed shower. We loved our stay here and highly recommend the River Terrace as a great stop for exploring Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Edmond_ET
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly Surprised (at this price point)! We stayed for the a night during the long president day weekend. Booked a room through hotwire.com which we found the price being rather reasonable ($150 plus tax). Check in process was very efficient. Staffs were very friendly. Lobby: Very stylish and elegant, almost felt like staying in a lodge. The patio at the back is cool, perfect for enjoying the complimentary breakfast. You can hear the birds while eating at the patio (as the patio is facing the quiet street) Room: The room is not huge but spacious enough for the 2 of us, 2 queens heavenly beds, nice furniture, granite countertops for the bathroom, love the double head shower in the tub, very comfy (with good water pressure). There was a nice balcony (overlooking the parking lot for hotwire customer, unfortunately, but still pretty cool) Breakfast: Don't miss out breakfast in the morning - the smoke salmon was delish! As a side note, please log on to (--)to print out tasting coupons for various vineyards in Napa. We saved $200 bucks in total for our tasting! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mukmuks
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days at this wonderful hotel and the accommodations were fantastic. The breakfast assortment in the morning was more than adequate. The workout room has all new equipment, The main lobby dining area is a great place to come back and relax after a day out shopping and visiting the many wineries. The rooms were well spaced and nice. The location of the hotel is actually is in great proximity to the downtown area and the southern end of the Napa wineries. From the hotel to Calistoga was a pleasant 30-40 minute drive up Hwy 29. In closing thanks to the entire staff for their warm hosptality and the comfort of the rooms was more than we expected. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vingale
Reviews.Content: We're local, but my son always wanted to stay at a hotel in Napa. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was well appointed, free internet, jacuzzi tub. The highlight for the kids: the outdoor pool is heated year round. It was a somewhat warm January day (we call it Indian Summer) -the kids swam for two hours! Reasonable rates for the honor bar. One of my inside tests. If the kids ask for something from the honor bar and I say "yes" then the hotel get's kudo's :) Good room service. The Napa Trolly (free) picks you up from the hotel and takes you downtown, to Copia, to Fuller Park or the outlet stores. Made for a great location. The outside of the building doesn't do it justice, so don't judge the book by the cover.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely try here!”
Reviews.Author: karenlo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while we visited the wineries. It looks okay from the outside, but we were really pleasantly surprised with the interior. The rooms are typically spacious, clean and modern. The bathroom was great with loads of towels etc. We did not eat here except for breakfast which was buffet style, with toast, muffins, fruit etc. We had a great stay, and would recommend to friends and family, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: j_flo77
Reviews.Content: Thursday 11/23 – Sunday 11/26 We stayed at the River Terrace Inn for 3 nights and I couldn’t think of one negative thing to say. In fact, for the price ($140 1st two nights, $150 the 3rd night) it was amazing. The lobby is elegant and warm, the front desk staff very courteous and helpful, etc. Our room (346, village King) was much nicer than I expected. The fabrics were luxurious, the bed was perfect (I slept like a rock), and the bathroom was gorgeous. About the bathroom, it had nice tiling, beautiful granite, and a large stand-up shower with two nozzles. I should note that the pictures on the hotel's website give an accurate impression of what your room will like. Too many hotels show pictures of rooms that look much nicer than what you end up with. I thought the wines available from the mini-bar area provided a nice, well-balanced selection and were reasonably priced. A half bottle of a nice pinot noir was about $20 and bottles of good reds and whites were anywhere from the mid-20s to the upper 40’s. They were more than you would pay in the store but a lot less than what you would pay in a restaurant. Bottles of water and soda were $1.60. The Hotel provides a DVD library for its guests. Just make sure to return it and there’s no charge. They had somewhere around 150 -200 titles to choose from. The pool is probably kept a little too warm for exercise, but if you think of it as a large hot tub, it’s very nice. The exercise room is a bit small, but they made up for that by providing high-end, new equipment (Lifefitness). There’s a treadmill, elliptical, recumbent and regular bikes, and nice dumbbells with an adjustable bench. The breakfast at this place was excellent. They have an assortment of danishes, muffins, bagels (w/ lox, capers, etc), scrambled eggs (w/ sun-dried tomatoes, scallions, and cheese), breakfast potatoes, cereals, various dried fruits, fresh fruits, and yogurt. Plus several fruit juices, coffee and teas. Everything was fresh and delicious. I’m usually picky about breakfasts, but this one was truly great. When we went on the wine shuttle we saw several other hotels as we picked up and dropped off other wine-o's. It made me feel that we had a made a very good choice, as all of them were either no where near as nice but the same price, or not much nicer for twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: zeul
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights @ the River Terrace Inn in one of the "Junior Suites". It was a nice room, not over-the-top. Had an extra in-room refrigerator for storing your own stuff (in addition to the mini-bar) & a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. We were a little bummed that the small, heated hotel pool was out-of-service while we were there. The free morning breakfast was good, with fruit, bagels, eggs, & potatoes. The DVD collection was great for relaxing in the evening! I would definitely stay here again. Checked several websites, and rates were cheapest on their own, plus there were some special package deals on their site as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for a group reservation!!”
Reviews.Author: hl1575
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I booked a group of rooms for a wedding in the area and the accomodations were fantastic. Beautiful, clean, comfortable rooms, and a GREAT value for the price. Close to downtown with modern conveniences close by. The staff was polite, the lobby, welcoming, and the river view was so enjoyable at breakfast. I've stayed at other hotels in the area, but from now on, River Terrace Inn will be at the top of my list .

Reviews.Title: “Impecable!”
Reviews.Author: SalvadorDaliFan
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the hotel and can't wait to go back! I can't say enough good things. We've stayed at places like The Venetian in Vegas, and Atlantis in the Bahamas, and this resort is definately in the same league. From the moment we arrived the service was excellent. The vallet even made a special trip to our room to return my husband's cell phone to him; which he didn't even know was missing! The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The room was to die for! We were on the 3rd floor facing the river. The river runs behind the resort. What a view! The bed was one the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The room was immaculate. The shower had 2 shower heads and a large jacuzzi tub!! The room had a refrigerator AND a wine cooler. You could skip dinner and have the free cheese platter, but we actually cancelled our reservations at another restaurant and ate right there at the inn. Dinner was delicous. We ate outside. There was a fire going in the pit and ducks swimming in the river. The complimentary breakfast was very good as well. The lobby, sitting areas, and breakfast nook are all beautiful. The fitness room has good equipment and a nice view of the pool area. We will DEFINATELY stay here when we return to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “A great base.”
Reviews.Author: recycled-teenagers
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel - we only spent 2 nights here (8th & 9th October) but the rooms were superb, the staff very obliging and the American buffet breakfast a good start to the day. There was free use of a lap top computer for an hour to check our e-mails. Even though it was October, there were heaters out on the patio and some brave souls sat outside to have breakfast. The best winery we visited was Via Sattui - no charge for tasting (except for the very expensive wines) and an extensive deli where we were able to purchase everything we needed for a picnic in the grounds on a very warm day. It was also very near to the Shopping Outlet where we ladies were able to have a bit of retail therapy before driving off for the wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “lovely gettaway”
Reviews.Author: RiversideGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful two night stay mid september. We arrived and had a delicious lunch on the terrace overlooking the river Napa. We upgraded to a junior suite and enjoyed the jacuzzi bathroom and luxury surroundings. The staff during breakfast were really helpful and got me boiling hot water for my earl grey tea. Delightful breakfast with a special napa twist - unlike the normal non descript usa breakfast. Courteous friendly staff who gave us informative advice on how to get the best out of our stay in Napa. This hotel is a MUST!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, Ants in room”
Reviews.Author: mzaums
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while wedding planning. Made us wait for our prebooked room for an hour claiming it wasn't ready. This was at 6 in the evening well after check in time. They finally took us to a room after we complained about having waited for over a half hour. Room they took us to had ants. Another customers food had been left in the refrigerator and it was covered in ants with ants all over the carpet and running along the wall. They were not apologetic nor did this phase them. We had to go back to lobby and wait another 15 minutes to be given another room. Customer service through all of this was terrible, breakfast only mediocre compared to other hotels in the valley and we've stayed at quite a few of them. Would never go back nor recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace was great!”
Reviews.Author: PennyandLeo
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Yes, it's fairly expensive, but it's extremely reasonable when you consider the prices of the other Napa hotels. We're not B&B kind of people and didn't want to spend a fortune - River Terrace is a perfect in-between hotel. Every member of the staff is extremely courteous - every time we ran into one of them in the halls, in the elevator, entering or exiting the hotel, they always said hello and smiled. The rooms are good sized with a refrigerator, comfy king beds, and a very nice dual-head shower. They offered complimentary breakfast each morning, which was great - a good selection of bagels, muffins, fruit, cheese, eggs, potatoes, coffee, juices, etc. We loved having breakfast outside on the patio! They also have a pretty large DVD library that they allow you to check out movies from for free. Sounds unnecessary, but our favorite way to relax each night was with a glass of wine, the cheese plate (make sure to order this from the hotel restaurant - it's fab!), and a funny movie. The hotel is also conveniently located to downtown Napa and is off the main roads. We had an excellent view from our room. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. I'm sure we'll stay here again when we return to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Perkys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights during August, it was a lovely place, with everything you wanted, the beds were fantastic. It was also nice to have a fridge in your room not just a mini bar. The breakfast was served on the terrace if you wanted which was lovely but could be a bit cold, that is sat outside not the breakfast. The staff were very good always answered any questions and very helpful. The only down side is that you have to drive into downtown napa for other restaurants, other than the one at the hotel, but that was not to bad as when you wanted to go wine tasting you could be out on the road easily. Clapton Family from England

Reviews.Title: “An OK choice with a nice breakfast on patio”
Reviews.Author: lindaruthe
Reviews.Content: First let me say, I think all Napa hotels are over priced. Within that context, the River Terrace Inn seems to be an OK choice. We arrived exhausted after a wedding party at 10:30 at night. The bellman greeted us with great courtesy, unpacked our car, and parked it while we checked in. Valet parking is complimentary. Our room was large, decorated with harvest colors of amber and dusty green. The bath was large and pleasant. The king bed a was very comfortable pillow top. The little frig was nice. We borrowed a free DVD from the front desk and enjoyed a movie. The only negative was that the air conditioning was a little noisy. We had a corner room #229 with a view of the small river on one side and on the other side a view of their tiny swimming pool and an unattractive vacant lot with abandoned washer and dryer in the middle. Specify a "river view that does not overlook the pool" otherwise you'll get this view or a parking lot view. I was pleasantly surprised by the breakfast which was included in the room rate. The selection was ample, scrambled eggs, delicious fried potatoes, various fruits, granola, yogurts, nuts, cheeses, tomatoes & mozzarella, bakery items, and juices. (At home I only have cereal and milk for breakfast, so this was a breakfast extravaganza for me.) We ate on the patio overlooking the river. After, we took a short walk along the river, watching fishermen, kayakers, and birds come and go. It was surprisingly quiet and relaxing along this little river.

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ORFemaleBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I made our reservation on River Terrace's site directly (this worked fine) for a special Junior Suite overlooking the river. This is not an inexpensive property for the area (our room $310 a night during high season in wine country). Check in was fine, the room (on the third floor and toward the end) was a quiet room and the small deck overlooking the river (two chairs, small table, room enough only to turn around) was pleasant enough, although overlooks the parking lot at one end of the view. You can open the window, which is pleasant. Blackout curtains were excellent. What we found objectionable about this hotel was primarily service. Check in was reasonably efficient and was friendly (the highlight of service in our 2-days experience was the clerk carrying in our luggage, who continually offered excellent suggestions and was extremely positive.) Coming and going through the lobby, we rarely were acknowledged from the front desk. The hotel doesn't have a separate elevator for the cleaning staff to use so in the mornings the elevators are full of ice trolleys, towel carts and an army of cleaning staff, etc. And no staff member that we ran into thought it was important to let guests come and go first rather than their carts, so we often waited on elevators as they were full of workers and equipment. In our room, the DVD player (which was discussed with much enthusiasm about the free DVDs available for view) did not work well and we finally gave up trying to watch a movie half-way through. The bathroom is spacious and nicely appointed, there is a separate dressing area for women to apply makeup, which is well lit and has a wall magnifying mirror (although if you are a man using one to shave it doesn't work as it's not over a sink.) There are bottles of wine set out on a counter above the mini bar. We were warned not to lift up the bottles, or a room charge would be made after 45 seconds. Our jacuzzi tub in the bathroom was large and deep but 3 out of 6 of the jets did not work at all. There is wireless computer service in the room. Ours did not work and we were told our room was too far away from the hub, so a cord was issued (which we could only have with a $200 deposit being made on our hotel bill and they would credit it back to us when we returned the cord.) The shower curtain came off it's hooks when you pulled it across the tub, because the curtain and liner are too heavy for the flimsy slider/holders. Towels -- luxe and lovely. My husband and I were going to have a masssage at the "spa", but we learned there is actually no physical spa. You simply decide you want a massage and the service provider is sent to your room. This wasn't what we were looking for, so we didn't purchase this service (which we generally do in other hotels with spas.) Generally, this hotel has more of a "Sleepy Bear" feel to it than a beautiful wine country inn. Check out time is 11 am, which is too early in comparison to most hotels of this "substance" and price in the area. We asked for a 30 minute late check out and were told "absolutely not" in no uncertain terms. We felt overlooked, underserviced and that this property wasn't interested in a return visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Major diappointment”
Reviews.Author: sdbrick
Reviews.Content: This hotel got a lot of positive comments so we decided to book it when we had to go to Napa for a wedding in July. The hotel is really more of a glorified motel. The room was small, the air conditioning was terribly noisy and the paint was so badly chipped in the first room we were shown, that we asked to switch rooms. On the plus side, the bathrooms were modern and updated. The supposedly fabulous breakfast which was included in the room rate, was terrible. The selection was skimpy, the quality terrible and the coffee was bad. I would say this hotel was mediocre at best and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while in the Napa Valley. The room was very nice, good hot/cold breakfast buffet, nice pool. Service was really good, we got some good suggestions for wineries from the bartender. The hotel is about a 10 minute-walk from the main street in Napa where most restaurants and bars are located. There is also a free daytime trolley to downtown which goes by the hotel every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: Davooda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RTI July 23-27 and thoroughly enjoyed this property! Our delight began when we arrived, exhausted, late Sunday night and the desk staff and bellman took care of everything professionally and with great courtesy. Valet parking is complimentary, as was the small refrigerator we used all week. Plus the hotel offers complimentary DVD movies, which we loved, and the free breakfast was delicious and fresh. Not many free breakfasts feature salmon mousse, fresh mozzarella, grape tomatoes, and four kinds of cheese, plus the requisite baked goods and scrambled eggs. This property is but three years old and still seems brand-new. The bed was excellent and our room (#234) large and with a small balcony. The staff is young, but we found that to be the case everywhere we went, except the high-end wineries. They were courteous, professional and hard-working. It was incredibly hot (between 100 and 116 degrees F, depending on which end of the valley) the week we stayed, so we didn't use the pool (the water was 90+ degrees F). However, I used the fitness center every morning and enjoyed a cigar on the terrace facing the river every evening. Peg, the one-footed goose, was on hand and enjoyed the bread offerings! The hotel is a short drive to either Route 29 or Silverado Trail (and I would recommend using the Silverado Trail over Route 29 to all - St. Helena is a huge bottleneck!) and our farthest winery visit (Schramsberg) was still only :30 away. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Our friends, who stayed in Yountville a couple months prior, found the rate hard to believe as they had paid more than double. The only amenity their hotel featured that RTI does not is an in-house spa, so if that is important to you, perhaps the extra expense is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Adriana A
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I loved the bed, the bathroom, the breakfast, the double-headed shower, the friendly knowledgeable front desk staff, and I loved the price I paid for it... I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place I've ever Stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: pamela913
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow, wow wow wow! This place, even more than over a year staying in napa valley, is still #1. By far the best place I've stayed after traveling in Ireland, Dublin, Las Vegas, and Bahamas since N. Valley. The bedroom is so perfect. From the very updated bathroom any girl would love! With a big mirror, granit sink and top....just beautiful. The bed the best part by far!....Stuffed down comforter you can fall asleep in, in no time! A balcony (view wasn't the best we were facing the street. nothing exciting there) with chairs and table. The breakfast in the morning was the best breakfast we've ever experienced in a hotel that was "complimentary." It was great. Every thing from self-made waffles to salmon, yogurt, pancakes, home fries, cheeses...and the list goes on! The entrance of the hotel when you enter is amazing makes one feel famous. Staff was very attentive. Great service! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be condfident they will love the place they're to stay. Even honeymooners. Though I think a honeymoon should be spend in bora bora, this place is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: jno2005
Reviews.Content: I had a few reservations about staying here as I just booked it from reviews on this site and due to the relative affordability compared to other places. This Hotel is clean and new, has very comfortable beds, a friendly albeit young staff, a great breakfast, nice bathrooms with double headed showers, extensive DVD collection, and a pool. Not too much more you can ask for in my opinion. The pool area could use some landscaping and padding on the outdoor furniture bit otherwise this place is an excellent choice, especially for the $$. You can walk to downtown Napa if you want as well as COPIA. But, downtown seemed relatively dead and COPIA could've been better. If I stayed in the area again I think I would stay up in Healdsburg. Either way this a good starting point for the Napa Valley vineyards.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: spinit
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here - we came last year at the same time. Great terrace on the river for breakfast or late night wine - the rooms are nice and clean. Super comfortable bed. Last time, we had a quieter room on the first floor away from the lobby - this time we had a larger room on the second floor, with the bar/lobby right below. Was a bit noisy in that room - nothing out of the ordinary but they play soft music until 10ish. Great place to stay - great food and perfect location to travel into Sonoma, Carneros and Napa for vino!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not much of a view!”
Reviews.Author: gallopinggoose
