Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn from 29th June to 1st July and although we booked a King room with River View and balcony, the room was average and being on the ground (1st floor) had only a view of the path in front of the river and the balcony was a very narrow area for people who smoked (no smoking in hotel (EXCELLENT) so smokers had to go outside), but you could not really sit out there and enjoy a view with a drink as in other hotels where we have stayed that have proper balconies to sit on!!!! We were told we could have another room but would have to move out for our last night so it didn't seem to be an option only being there for 3 nights. The first night whilst I was in the shower there was a power cut (power out) and no explanation was given as to why it happened, I thought someone (my husband) had switched the bathroom light off by mistake or for a joke and as it is an inside room it was pitch black.............NOT FUNNY if you are claustrophobic or not sure where everything is in a room you have just arrived at! At breakfast when I asked for black tea without a special flavour (as that was all they seemed to have), I was told they didn't have any!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (I don't drink coffee, or didn't until I was so desperate for a hot drink I had to)! All in all I would not stay there again, although the reception staff where very good and always smiling! I would say that the hightlight of our trip was balloon trip with Napa Valley Balloons Inc. we had a fabulous trip and can't wait to do it again! We also had lunch on the Wine Train which I would recommend, the food was excellent and was a very well organised trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and have to say it was one of our best experiences as far as accomidations!! The rooms are very spacious and the bathroom was a women's dream. The staff was very friendly. It's very quiet and has the cutest lobby and patio. It was nice to sit in the evening, relax and have a glass of wine. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and already have.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. We stayed in Room 318. The room decor is very nice and stylish. Fancy bedspread and nice furniture. Big room with a couch, king bed, desk and chair. The bathroom was equisite. It had the nicest tiled and glass shower I've had in a hotel or probably even in a house. The marbled top vanity with wood legs was a nice touch. Staff was very nice. Hotel is set off from Soscol Ave on a river. You get a nice away from everything feeling. On the back patio they have lots of tables with umbrellas and an open gas fire place for those chilly mornings in Napa. It was very relaxing to sit out here with a bottle of wine. A local Canadian Goose with a missing foot was almost always around. See if he is there when you go. I think he made this his home. They have a great continental breakfast with all the usuals plus they make a cheese egg dish that is very good and fried potatoes (hashbrowns). Also this hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the Napa Valley Wine Train and maybe 15 minutes from Downtown. A free trolley also stops at the hotel for trips downtown. If I ever go to Napa again this is the only place I'll ever stay. Make sure you eat at Red Rock's(Back Door BBQ) on Lincoln Ave. HUGE portions. Good local joint. There is also a Walmart about 1/2 a mile down the road on Soscol which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for 3 nights through Hotwire for my mother, my brother and I (I'm the daughter/sister) because I couldn't find anything in Napa. We were booked into a jr. suite w/a king bed and sleeper sofa. When we got to the room there was a queen bed and no sleeper. The attendant got on the phone immediately and took us to a second room. This room had a sleeper, but was still occupied! He got on the phone again and took us to a third room that had a king bed, a sleeper and a terrace overlooking the river. The room was excellent, the staff outstanding and the complimentary bottle of champagne for our troubles really hit the spot! The continental breakfast was very good, although there were no breakfast meats. Except for some exhuberant guests one early morning it was quiet and comfortable. We will definitley stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Feel pampered without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: flygurl814
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn for two nights over the Fourth of July weekend, for $125 a night. We loved the location and the hotel was great for our needs. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and we loved some of the extra touches in the room. The shower had two shower heads (although no tub). There was also a little music box that let you choose a relaxing sound (ocean, rain, etc) to lull you to sleep. The breakfast was great – fresh fruit, cheese, potatoes, eggs, meats, pastries, muffins, and bagels. One of the best things about this place was the proximity to town. We took the free trolley around to Napa down town and it was an easy walk back to the hotel from down town after the trolleys stopped running. We did the Taste Napa card, and really enjoyed it. Being able to taste lots of wine without having to drive or hire someone to drive you around was a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Ferschnizzle
Reviews.Content: Rooms were furnished very nicely and beds very comfortable, although a little cramped. Good location with easy access to the Silverado Trail and for Hwy 29, Napa Valley. Pool was on the small side but adequate and uncrowded. Staff was friendly although not that informed about wine country. Biggest negative was breakfast buffet. Don't expect much and you won't be disappointed. Scrambled eggs and potatoes, cold cuts with cheese and danish. Plates were saucer size making things difficult. Overall though, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the River Terrace Inn!”
Reviews.Author: MML2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the RTI last week and fell in love with the place. We were originally booked in a horrible little motel where we felt extremely uncomfortable. We decided to take a chance and see if the RTI had any rooms available and we were fortunate to find a lovely king-size room with a balcony. The room was huge and comfortable. There was a ceiling fan above the bed, which my husband loved. The bathroom was large and very clean. Some rooms had a jacuzzi tub but ours had a very large shower, which was fine for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us advice on restaurants and wineries. The breakfast was the best we had on our trip. We expected just a simple continental breakfast but were pleasantly surprised at the hot items and Italian lunchmeats and fresh mozzarella. They had a great selection of tea as well as coffee and juice. We ate outside on the patio overlooking the river and it was such a relaxing way to start the morning. We were a little disappointed with the town of Napa. It wasn't nearly as charming as some of the other little towns in the area. On our next trip, we'll probably stay in another town but if we ever do stay in Napa again we will definitely stay at the RTI.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hello_Travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting the Napa Valley for the Memorial Day Weekend. We stayed at the RTI and had a wonderful stay! When I booked the room, I requested a room on the top floor and I was accomodated when I checked in. We stayed in a River Superior Jacuzzi room and it was huge with a nice view of the Napa River. The jacuzzi tub was great! The room was spacious and very clean. The staff was friendly and nice. Housekeeping comes around in the evening to do a turn down in addition to seeing if you need extra towels. They also offer bottled water if you need it. I thought that was a nice touch. The breakfast buffet was delicious with hot food (eggs/potatoes) as well as plenty of pastries (bagels and lox were my husband's favorite) and different kinds of dried fruit/cheeses/fruit. It was really nice free buffet. The location of this hotel was good. It's close to Copia and downtown Napa. You could walk it if you really wanted to. The freeway is close as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to Napa or Sonoma, the town of Napa is actually the furthest down in the county. Yountville and St. Helena are in the middle and Calistoga is at the top. St. Helena probably has the most wineries. Having said that, the town of Napa is very cute with some good restaurants and this hotel is lovely. It is very close to the backroad (something Trail) to the wineries and is only about 3 minutes to Rt. 29. The rooms were VERY CLEAN. I am a stickler for cleanliness and I have never felt more comfortable staying in a hotel before. The beds are like clouds. The little stream in the back is nice but nothing crazy. They have a great breakfast in the morning and a nice restaurant for dinner. The staff was very polite. If this hotel was located in a more central part of the county, it would be perfect. We LOVED Napa and Sonoma Valley and will stay at this hotel again, dispite it being a little out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: pabloman
Reviews.Content: Was unsure of what to expect but was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Nice and quiet, great beds, very good breakfast. Thought it was a pretty good value, if booked online. I would not pay the extra for the river-view, but that is just me. Right around the corner is a great wine store with a tasting bar I believe 5 wines for $5. The best value for tastings we found.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Napa”
Reviews.Author: discosturules
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here with friends whilst exploring the region. Hotel was very clean, with spacious & pleasant rooms that had a balcony. Pool was a bonus, but lost what sun it got very early in the afternoon due to being on the wrong side of the hotel. Within a short walk of town & it's bars & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Napa Resort”
Reviews.Author: lsdoget
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn after getting a deal on Hotwire, so totally blind, but had heard some good things from a friend at work, so looked forward to it. It was REALLY nice. Clean rooms, great service, nice breakfast, and quiet little location on the Napa River. Downside was not much additional dining without a little drive, but that is all. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again. Feed the geese for me!

Reviews.Title: “After the flood...”
Reviews.Author: ABJLB
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at RTI in mid-January. What we hadn't been told before we arrived was that Napa had had its worst flood for 10 years on New Year's Eve, and was still cleaning up (it didn't seem to have affected the hotel). RTI is quiet, modern, clean, comfortable, spacious...but certainly not a 'special occasion' hotel. We may have gained a different opinion of it in high season. As others have said, it is very well positioned for the wine train and for Napa town itself (short walks). RTI is on the river and we had a room on that side of the hotel. The outlook is pretty but not stunning. As far as Napa itself is concerned, there are some pretty good restaurants and bars in town and we liked the place - despite the river silt that was still on the sidewalks. The service in RTI was very good, and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The included buffet breakfast was certainly OK, but not the best I've had in similar hotels in the US. We would use the hotel again if we stayed in Napa....but then the choice is fairly limited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business or a Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Goblu
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to hold two small (12 people) busineess meetings at this hotel in the last year. We stayed at the hotel the second time, because of good experience the first time. Principal positives: --Great location - 5 minute walk to downtown NAPA --Very personable and accommodating (they quickly made a number of stapled/collated copies a few times for our group) --Excellent "free" breakfast, unusual and appreciated as I get tired of the "normal" stuff (includes things like smoked salmon, Italian lunchmeats) --Nice wine bar in lobby for evenings --Placid view from rooms overlooking the back --LCD projector included with meeting room (for meeting planners, this is a big savings) --DVD player in room --Comfortable rooms/bed --Full wine bottles (nice selection) in rooms (but you pay for these if you use them) Negatives, not many to speak of: --No "business center," but there's a full-service Kinkos (though not 24-hr) one stoplight down. --No "fine dining" restaurant on property, but their casual restaurant is very good for lunch or a casual dinner (they used to have "Budo" in a separate building that was an exceptional restaurant, but it closed second time we went there...they say it's "under renovation") I'd recommend this hotel as an ideal place for a small business meeting or a jumping off point for exploring Napa. Several of our attendees both times brought wives, and appreciated the opportunity to bring them to such a nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “Arriving Christmas night”
Reviews.Author: lsm112375
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I arrived Christmas night for three wonderful nights at The River Terrace Inn. We flew from the east coast on Christmas day fighting flight cancellations and rain. Check-in was smooth and the fantastic bed was the highlight of the day for hubby and I to get the rest we needed. Breakfast each morning was the same- but there was plenty to choose from. The fresh squeezed OJ was a nice change from the normal concentrate juice you normally get at hotels and the eggs and potatoes provided a hearty breakfst without having to battle a restaurant that early in the morning. Every encounter with the staff was extremely pleasant- no problems at all. The room was very clean and maid service was superb each day. The only thing negative I have to report was that seating for breakfast can be limited in the mornings when it is raining and the outside deck is unusable. Hubby and I ate closer to the front desk a few mornings- but it was not unbearable. Overall- I would stay here agin in a heartbeat and will recommend it to others. Please feel free to email questions concerning my stay to lsm1123@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, poor front-desk attitude, great jacuzzi tub”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very nice, we had a big jacuzzi tub and it was fantastic. I would have them improve on the front-desk service. We booked a "fall special" which included a bottle of wine and a platter of cheese on arrival. It was not in our room. Furthermore, when I called to ask about it and to upgrade our room (we were willing to pay the price difference), the lady at the front desk stated that she was not the one to book our room, the assistant manager was and she was in a meeting, would be out in 5 minutes and will call us back. Needless to say, no one called us back and we had to go downstairs, even after going downstairs, she acted very unprofessionally. Room: nice bed, nice bathroom. Great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good place Especially if your going to the Wine Train”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are going to have dinner on the wine train. The station is a short walk away. Ask for a river view though, or you will find yourself staring at a parking lot all day. I went here late summer and found there was one drawback, which was the in-room wine bar and fridge. I have to young kids and we weren't in the room 5 minutes, before they lifted one of the wine bottles off its electronic cradle. The bottle was immediately charged to our room. Even though we called down and explained what happened and had all the bottles removed from the room, and despite the fact that I went down and spoke to the front desk numerous times during our stay, the charges remained on our bill until the day we left. We had to go down once again and re-address the issue, which finally was resolved. Also, don't count on a whole lot of service. This is not a spa hotel, rather its a nice hotel to stay at with conveinient access to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great time.”
Reviews.Author: kradu
Reviews.Content: My husband, his brother and wife, our daughter and I all spent a three-day weekend at the River Terrace Inn to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday. We enjoyed it so much. Dining and socializing outside on the terrace overlooking the river was especially enjoyable. Service was good. The rooms were great. The beds were terrific. Napa Valley is easily accessible. Overall a wonderful time. It's a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beds and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: scal
Reviews.Content: We were in Napa for a family visit and stayed here for two days as was recommended by our parents. Check in was fine and Greg was very nice at the front desk. The best part was the bed! It was high, fluffy and very comfortable. The room was newer and quiet. I do not usually sleep very well when we travel, but I was thrilled that I slept through the whole night! We stayed on the riverside and you can't really see the river but the view was of trees and such, so it was nice. Breakfast on the Terrace was good and some geese flew in and were hanging out all morning. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0306
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the River Terrace Inn. The rooms are very nice, clean, and the bed is very comfortable. I liked that the rooms did not have "thin" walls as many of the older hotels do in Napa Valley. The breakfast is included in the price and it is a great spread with a lot of choices. The staff was very friendly, but it didn't seem like they new very much about the area. This hotel was a great base for visiting wineries during the day and there a lot of great restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing visit”
Reviews.Author: LaniMoo
Reviews.Content: Although a couple of friends and I only stayed 1 night, it was great! I'm 5' tall and had to climb onto the bed to sleep...and once in it was so comfy I was asleep in minutes. Yes, we were on the first floor, and yes we had a view of the parking lot, but the continental breakfast was great and we ate out on the lanai where it was serene and peaceful. Walked about 2 blocks to the Wine Train, another great experience. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay, With One Caveat”
Reviews.Author: trinaunz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the River Terrace Inn, mainly perhaps because we got a $119 introductory rate and it was a great value, esp for the area. We've paid about the same amount to stay at a motel near Napa. When we first pulled up I was a bit disappointed with the facade, which looked like a standard Fairfield Inn-style place (with this being Wine Country, I'd hoped for something cozier-looking). The rooms were fine, peaceful, quiet. The pool was ok for my three-year-old, who didn't need anything fancy. The caveat I need to mention is that we thought we'd kick off our wine tasting with a visit to the wine bar that they say also has tapas. When we walked in, no one was there. We asked the front desk where the staff were - we were advised someone would be on their way. About 5 or 10 minutes later, someone showed and reluctantly served us some rather unexciting wine. We felt like we were putting this guy out for doing his job. No tapas anywhere in sight. The atmosphere of the bar was more like a boutique store in a big hotel - minus the interesting stuff to look at. But...the rest of the stay was fine. Would stay there again with the rate we paid!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place! Perfect location! Very clean and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: nyjen
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews and doing lots of research, I was confident we would like this hotel for our anniversary/my 30th birthday. I read a few negative reviews here on tripadvisor....thos occurences must be rare! Upon check in, we had excellent customer service and did throughout our 4 day stay. The hotel is a perfect location for going around Napa and north and then swinging over to Sonoma and going North. It's also convienent to the great places to eat in town! We loved the free breakfast...it was rather large and had a variety of things to choose from. The fitness center was perfect and the pool looked nice (we didn't use it). We rented some of the free DVDs from the front desk and found our room quite relaxing. We did the 2 nights for 3 deal in the River Jacuzzi Rooms w/balcony. Huge room! The front desk was very helpful with everythign. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay on the first floor”
Reviews.Author: captnKrunch
Reviews.Content: Foolishly responding to the name of their hotel, I booked a night of our wine tasting tour for my wife and her brother and his girlfriend. I diliberately asked for rooms in the back overlooking the river. We got rooms in back but, unfortunately, our rooms were on the first floor with a glorious view of a dirt parking lot. The porches are barely wide enough for a chair and the railing is so high that you can't even see the parking lot if you're sitting. As far as I know, there is no river and there are no terraces. Breakfast buffet is good though.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: chicritic
Reviews.Content: As one of the employees described it, it's a B&B in a hotel format. Nice staff, New clean spacious rooms, quiet property, great daily breakfast, FREE DVD rentals, staff always going the extra mile to help you out. Easy access to downtown napa and the sonoma and napa valley wineries. Definitely would stay here again. Great rates especially Sun - Thursdays, weekends are very expensive. Look for deals on their website, recommend calling to book room rather than online since website doesn't always show the best rates available on a given day.

Reviews.Title: “Focus on comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: AM-TJ
Reviews.Content: The River Terrace staff can't do enough for you. It starts at the front desk where warm friendly smiles greeted us every time we came by. We needed a document printed so we emailed it to them and they printed it .. no charge .. no hassle. Staff throughout the hotel matched this first impression. Spacious comfortable rooms and the river facing rooms are so peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on overly critical review writer!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Terrace Inn while some work was being done to my home and i found my stay there delightful. It was so nice to be able to be in such comforting surroundings in such a hectic time in my life. However when i stumbled upon this website to write my rave review i was in SHOCK to read the review that someone wrote about the front desk agent Lynn. I found her to be friendly, nice and willing to help. She was always extremely polite and courteous in a warm manner. Not like some of those hotels that are stuffy and cold. Perhaps the review writer that had issues with Lynn, actually have their own issues they need to deal with themselves. I can't believe this website would even post such harsh insults on an individual! Seems a bit slanderous to me!Sometimes even if you go over and above for someone they will never be satisfied. The entire staff at the River Terrace Inn did a wonderful job making me feel very welcome and not once did I regret my choice of hotel. The time I got to spend at the Inn was very relaxing. I had a room over-looking the river. It had such a serene feeling. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful as well. Another great feature the hotel has is their DVD service. They have many DVD's on the premises that you are allowed to borrow during your stay with them and as long as you return them there is no fee! How great is that? Thats what i call customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service ..... loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the River Terrace Inn this past week. I had the most enjoyable time. The front desk personnel especially Miguel and Lynn were very friendly and helpful. They answered our questions and gave wonderful advise about where to eat. The free breakfast in the morning was very delicious and the pillowtop beds extremely comfortable. We very much enjoyed out stay and cant wait to come back soon. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tmp309
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 15-17, 2005 and only wished we would have stayed longer! We were greeted at check-in with a "free upgrade!" to a junior king suite on the third floor overlooking the river (room 311). It could not have been more perfect since we were celebrating our anniversary. All of the staff we came in contact with were friendly and courteous. One of the guys at the front desk (so sorry to not have gotten his name) recommended a great Italian restaurant (not stuffy...just a cute corner place with great food)---Filippi's (I think I'm right on the spelling). The breakfast (on the patio overlooking the river) was awesome. The location is perfect for touring the wineries...only a couple of blocks from the start of the Silverado Trail. Would definitely return here and will tell everyone we know about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Napa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for couples, romantic and quiet. The beds were ridiculously comfortable and the rooms clean and quiet. I have no idea who was staying above the person from NJ, but it must have been pretty raucous bc I didnt hear one single noise my entire 4 day stay over the 4th. Also, the FREE breakfast is AMAZING!! People who complain about free breakfasts annoy me, and they should annoy you too :) The breakfast was great, eggs, pastries, fruit, bagels, granola, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc etc....Ive never had a better "hotel" breakfast. And its FREE people! There were 3 (count em) coffee containers there, so big deal if they run out, wait 30 seconds for them to refill them....didnt happen to me though. Eat on the gorgeous terrace overlooking the river, just a fantastic place trust me.

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace: Good Base of Operations”
Reviews.Author: MARKLakeWorth_Fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly because it is within an easy walk to the Wine Train Station and we're glad we did. The room was great, as was the food, though their room service menu is somewhat limited. Our room had a whirlpool tub and a balcony with views of the Napa river (nothing spectacular), and we found the bed very comfortable. The pool area was on the small side but the gym was better than most hotels. City of Napa is really not very nice compared with the rest of the valley, but they are trying to change that. The shopping area downtown (only a short drive from the hotel) was nice to visit and explore. If I'm back this way I'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace Inn was Great”
Reviews.Author: TeaParty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the River Terrace Inn and thoroughly enjoyed every moment. The room was clean and the bathroom was absolutely beautiful! Plush beds and duvets, a first class hotel!! We would return again when the opportunity arises!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for weekday rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't really get to experience the customer service. No problems checking in or out. The complimentary breakfast buffet was okay. It consist of coffee, juices, variety of pastries, salami, scrambled eggs and cereal. They were slow to refill the food. I think the hotel went cheap on the building material, I could hear the vacuum in the morning... can't figure out if it was from upstairs from the room or the next door. I could hear children jumping upstairs and people talking next door. the "jacuzzi" tub is a regular size tub w/jets.... the room we had is the deluxe river view room... no point in paying extra for the view since the hotel is surrounded by two poorly maintained empty land sites. the bed wasn't comfy... it was too soft for me. if you have the money to spend, I would probably go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Stay at the River Terrace Inn”
Reviews.Author: MC54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River Terrace Inn from June 26 - July 2. After reading the reviews here, I was more than a little concerned that I'd made a poor hotel choice, but as it turned out, we were very pleased with our stay and would not hesitate to recommend it to family and friends. The Inn is located in downtown Napa (sort of), within walking distance of the Napa Wine Train (but not much else). It's an easy 5-10 minute drive to get to Route 29, the main drag through the Valley from Napa to Calistoga. Our check-in was smooth, friendly and efficient, from the bell staff to the front desk. In a matter of minutes, we were in our River Junior Suite, with a balcony and nice view of the Napa River. We spent many a late afternoon/evening sitting on the balcony and enjoying a glass of wine or cold beer. If possible, spring for the river front suites -- the alternative is to get a room with a view of the parking lot, and while the river view is hardly extraordinary, it certainly beats the alternative. The rooms are very nicely appointed. The beds are as comfortable as you're likely to find in a hotel and the bathroom is very nice (ours was equipped with a jacuzzi tub, which was a little small, but nice). I particularly got a kick out of the dual-headed shower. It was great! Housekeeping was flawless and did a great job in our opinion -- our room was always cleaned and ready for us when we returned in the afternoon before dinner. The morning breakfast buffet was perfect for us and the price was unbeatable (free). If you've had the buffet at a Comfort Suites or Residence Inn, it's comparable -- nothing special, but just fine to start the day. Fresh fruit, danish, bagels, toast, cereal, scrambled eggs and potatoes, etc. Much as been written about apathetic or poor service, but we certainly didn't experience that -- in fact, we found the opposite. During the early part of our stay, the mornings were quite chilly sitting outside for breakfast, and my wife, who doesn't drink coffee, asked a staffer if they had hot chocolate. He said "No, not normally, but he'd make her some using the espresso machine." And he did, and it was pretty darn good. When he saw her the next morning, he asked her if she'd like another. I guess a thank you and a smile goes a long way sometimes. I don't think it's been mentioned elsewhere, but the pool, which is fairly small (and can get crowded in the afternoon) is heated, which was great given the very cool mornings and evenings in Napa. There are too many terrific places to eat to mention them all, but some of our favorites included the Rutherford Grill, Wappa Taco in Calistoga (don't be fooled by the name of this little hole-in-the-wall spot -- we had a great lunch (tapas/Cuban sandwich) there), Taylor's Refresher in St. Helena (think 50's drive-in -- great burgers and shakes), and a picnic lunch at V. Sattui Winery. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the River Terrace very much, and hope you find this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Actionjcksn5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel June 10th-13th. This was our first trip to Napa and it was perfect!! When we arrived we checked in and were in our room with in minutes, the lobby is beautifully decorated and the terrace over looks the Napa river. Our room was spacious nice high ceilings and the bathroom was very nice and very clean! I was looking forward to the beds and we were not let down they are extremly comfortable. The location was perfect for us, we wanted something close to it all. We never drove more than 20-30 min and we went to about 6 vineyards. All in all this hotel was worth every penny. The people on here saying bad things must have went on there vactions thinking they were gonna be the only one's in this hotel. We have not one bad word to say and were in this industry.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People- Friendly receptionists. Very very helpful with directions and advice on activities. Too bad I can't recall the names because looking at other reviews of this hotel, they're not all this friendly. Facilities- The lobby is quite elegantly decorated. It gave a warm classy feeling. Definitely more inviting than most 3-stars I've been to (albeit not in the Napa area). The room is comparable to 3-star Hilton's and other big name hotels I've stayed at but what I liked about this place was the very high ceiling. The room itself was a bit on the plain side though the choice of colors was pleasant imho. Cleanliness, I'd rate it around 9. The "self-cleaning" whirlpool tub was great initially but became a disappointment because the moment we turned on the jets, little black specks came out of the spouts. The tub itself was quite clean though. Too bad the water wasnt! Overall, I'd rate this a 3+ star hotel for the quality. I liked the place and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: cinnabun1
Reviews.Content: We loved this inn. It was a good location in Napa and the place was beautiful! It's a relatively new hotel. The Staff was very pleasant and friendly. The computer was down when we originally checked in, but they offered us each a complimentary glass of wine. Also, they give a free breakfast in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: digitalq
Reviews.Content: I was a bit cautious booking this place because of the tales I had read about the minibar and the parking lot view. I made sure to book a river view and not to touch the minibar. As I was driving into the parking lot of the river terrace I really felt bad that some people had a view of the enormous parking lot. I suppose it would be fine if you're booking a room for your in-laws. Our stay was fun and enjoyable. From the outside the river terrace literally looks like a grey barn, but the inside is warm, inviting, clean and new. Checkin and checkout was a smooth process, the staff was friendly and always willing to help. Now let me get to the good part, the room. The river view room is spacious and nicely appointed. It's got a "luxury in the wine country" feel. The river is nothing to write home about, but the only better thing I could imagine would be if the room overlooked a nice hill-side vineyard. We went there to relax, and we certainly did. We left the balcony room door open when we were in the room because the air was so fresh and we loved to hear the birds chirping. The pillow-top bed was so comfy. We took advantage of the library of DVDs you could borrow free of charge. We used the jacuzzi tub two out of the three nights, it filled up quickly, hot water was aplenty, and the jets were powerful enough but not overpowering. We ordered massages from the "spa", the only option was for the masseuses to come to our room which was fine by us. It was a little cramped when the masseuses brought two full-size massage tables in. They had to rearrange furniture, but they put it back before they left. The location is a great place to start your wine adventure. We had a memorable time and we will definitely trust our stay with the River Terrace again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, clueless staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the beginning the customer service was sad. We had trouble booking our rooms on-line, but even more trouble trying to deal with the staff on the phone. We booked for 3 nights (buy 2 get one free special) but then wanted to add a 4th night on. This was clearly too difficult for the staff to understand, both at booking and at check-in. The front desk service in general was lacking. But luckily the wonderful rooms (and the most comfortable beds) made up for the lack of front desk support. The jacuzzi tubs were great as well. The "river view" is more of muddy stream. Breakfast was so-so. But the location is a great starting place for wine touring. In the end our comfy room made up for our other dissatisfactions, but it would be nice if they could get their act together at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “River Terrace keeps getting better (and beds are great)”
Reviews.Author: chatman
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the River Terrace Inn--we were there about a year ago. We had another wonderful stay. The beds are extremely comfortable, and that's coming from someone who spent the first and last night's of their stay at San Fran's Ritz (and that was because this hotel was booked those 2 evenings). The breakfast has gotten much better--everything from fruit, eggs, smoked salmon (but it goes fast) to the more standard pastries, cereal, etc. The setting is clean, spacious, and very relaxing. We travel with our 2 year old, and were extremely comfortable staying there with her --my only warning would be to double check the lock on the door if you have a balcony room, our maid left ours unlocked one time. This time we did get a river side room. We had a terrific view of the hills from our room. The location is great, I was able to jog over to downtown Napa and was a nice central location for going to wineries in Napa and Sonoma. Everyone we came across was very helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Contrary to bad reviews, this place took care of us ”
Reviews.Author: luckycat2
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews about poor service and problems with people being charged for wine or items in the minibar they did not use, we ventured into the River Terrace being cautious. What we experienced was very helpful service and an extremely clean well maintained property. Also, right on the mini bar was a sign that said "if you remove a wine bottle from this rack your room is automatically charged". That couldn't have been any clearer, so I don't know why people had a problem with that. For people who are pickey, the carpets were clean enough to walk barefoot, the marble in the bathroom well maintained, clean, no mold, and the bed very comfortable. In comparison, we looked at a room for $390/nite at the Silverado Country Club and the carpet was dirty, there was mold in the shower and the room smelled like something out of 1950. I would highly recommend the River Terrace and we will return later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in late April. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The interior was clean and nicely decorated. There is a terrace behind the hotel on the riverside that is great for dining or relaxing. The beds were awesome -- the most bed I've ever slept in, motel or otherwise. The property is close enough to downtown, the Wine Train and Copia to walk, but if you prefer not to walk there is a free trolley service that runs from just outside the front door. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: guavabean
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice. Beds very comfortable. Staff wonderful. We didn't want to leave. We would definitely come back. Location very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, but quirky”
Reviews.Author: sixelagogo
Reviews.Content: We checked in using the promotional offer -3 nights for the price of 2. For a suite (kinda) that overlooked the napa river (kinda) with endless musak floating through our room (definately) we felt we got our money's worth. The bed itself was worth the$503 for 3 nights. Breakfast was disappointing for 2 of the morninings. The third morning- a thursday- was obviously the time when they kick it up. Lox, moz. with tomatoes, procuttio. You name it. The managment was a bit confused while we were there and the customer service ok- a valet looked on as we loaded our 5 bags up the ramp. So room, yes a 5 star. Service a 3. Hence, a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds and free internet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel during a quick trip to Napa. I booked the Inn on their website. "Village" side does not have a view but the beds were great, pillows were very soft and I slept the thru the night! Free high-speed internet was nice, and they have a good selection of free DVD movies at the front desk. Could use some landscaping and it's near but not in downtown. You could walk but I drove. Nice place, nice bar and I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia which had a great deal for a village room with two queen beds. Although the room amenities were nice and the continental breakfast was a good value, the customer service was terrible. We were put in a room right above housekeeping and there was a loud constant sound coming from below us the entire weekend. I complained not once but three times about it and no one did anything. Worse, they didn't seem to care. When I requested they send someone to try to check out the sound, they agreed to do it but no one ever came. When I called for the last time at around 8:30 at night, the front desk said they would call me right back. No one called me back, no one came to the room, no one tried to do anything to resolve the problem. It was as if they were just waiting for us to check out. I thought that the hotel might be discriminatory toward us but then I heard another guest complain about something else and the front desk was just as uncaring and unwilling to try to resolve their problem. I would not stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. Pay the extra amount and stay in Yountville or St. Helena. Customer service makes all the difference when you are trying to have a nice relaxing weekend in the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise”
Reviews.Author: DDCHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 1-3, after reading numerous reviews on Tripadvisor; it did not disappoint. Nothing spectacular but provides a comfortable stay for sightseeing. That's probably the way it should be. It's in downtown Napa so a bit of a drive to the vineyards compared to the others situated in the middle of the valley, but the location is convenient too, next to restaurants and a Walmart (in case you need basic ammenities). Our kids enjoyed watching the free DVD on the player in each room. The room is a bit cramped. Or the beds are too large for the room. There were 2 adults and 2 kids (ages 6 and 2) and it felt smaller than the other hotels we were stayed in. You cannot use the in-room minibar for storing personal food and drink, so ask for a complimentary fridge immediately upon check-in. Broadband access is free. Payed USd 139+ a night. There are countless other hotels more expensive and cheaper, but we were happy with our choice, this provided good value...It would be lower by USD 10-20 per night during weekdays and other times of the year. We were right in front of the access to the pool, so that was good and bad. But no one really swims at night so it was quite. Unfortunately one afternoon (around 4-5 pm) we were swimming and our kids were enjoying themselves. A guest apparently complained about the noise because they were sleeping at this time of day (hangover?). So if you are sensitive ask to be placed away from the pool. Otherwise the pool side seems to provide a better ambience. We didn't get a chance to have a meal, except for the free breakfast (generally cereal and muffins). Once I asked about lunch at 1130 am, and this busy waitress was quite abrupt in answering lunch will only be ready at 1230pm. Other than that, our stay was fine...we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: Ringo_Traveling
Reviews.Content: River Terrace Inn is a great deal at it's price. I went on a Thursday afternoon, so it didn't have the weekend crowds. Check-in was fast an easy. We had the 2 queen beds ($129 through their website). It had a balcony, which unfortunately overlooked the parking lot (at least I would know if someone was trying to steal my car!). I would've enjoyed the more intimate and secluded view of the river better, but those rooms were the suites. The bed linens are high-count Egyptian cotton (describes it on their website), but they were soooo soft and comfy. I'm going to buy some for my own bed! We had 2 queen beds w/ very comfy pillows. The decor of the room was fabolous and you can control the temperature in the room (heat & AC). There was also a ceiling fan, mp3/cd alarm clock, dvd player (lots of new dvd movies at the front desk to choose from, and they were free (if you return them)). There was a big shower, with no bathtub, but the shower and bathroom was immaculately clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast buffet in the morning consisted of eggs, sausage patties, bread & toast, muffins, etc. We got to eat on the patio next to the river. It was the first nice day in a while, so it was nice to sit in the sun and have breakfast. The night before, we hanged out at the patio, and stared at the stars. The only cons is that the $30 deposit fee for the dvd was on our bill in the morning, which they removed when they checked their dvd binder (what if someone else checked it out after us?) and you have to be careful not to move the items from the bar. I guess it's sensored, so they would know, and they would charge you. We didn't move it, but if you didn't read... Overall, it was a wonderful stay. For that price in Napa, it was much, much better than any other lodging in that price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy beds!!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeinTX
Reviews.Content: I just visited Napa Valley for the first time, and the River Terrace Inn was great. It was very easy to find, but so is the rest of Napa. We had a village view, which really isn't. All you see is street and parking lot. The room was really nice. Very comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. Like the other visiter, the hotel charge us for mini bar items that we didn't consume. However, the mistake was fixed quickly. It had a great continental breakfast included. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodations, staff okay - good the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was simple. It was nicely situated by the Napa River, which was our view from our room. The junior suites were very nice. Some of the junior suites have sleeper sofas and some do not. If you wish to have a sleeper sofa (we had three people in one room) it is good to specify that in your reservation. The bathrooms were great with whirlpool tubs - nice touch! The bartender in the hotel bar was great and had excellent tips for dinner and knew a lot about the area. The in-room spa treatments were heavenly and convenient. They can give treatments to two people at a time per room. If you have three people in one room like me, the third person had to go to another room for their treatment - which was okay. Room service was excellent and food was good. Breakfast was also very good - but always seemed to be out of plates? The only problems we experienced were charges on our bill from the mini bar for items we did not consume. The front desk staff at check-in were very cordial but on check-out the staff was cold and accidentally double charged our credit card on the spa treatments. Overall this hotel was very nice for the price - just verify charges at check-out!

Reviews.Title: “It made a good place to say for the cost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. It was located near many things. It overlooks the river which is beautiful and very quite. The rooms were clean and enjoyed it

Reviews.Title: “This 3 STAR should be a 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: cajungambler
Reviews.Content: an oasis in noisy napa. only 1 blk. off a main artery, but quiet. rooms are way above 3 star.bathrooms roomy and new. continental breakfast is best ever. restaurant meals excellent . staff very helpful and courteous. a real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The most affordable luxury property in the Napa Valley - conveniently located next to COPIA, The Opera House, fantastic retail shops, the Napa River and wineries. The River Terrace Inn has a lovely terrace cafe and wine bar. We loved our stay and plan to return again soon. It is the perfect weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: br55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay. First time in Napa Valley. Liked the location, as we wanted to visit COPIA and the Wine Train. Jr. Suite was spacious, comfotable bed, large bathroom, robes, jacuzzi tub, ceiling fan. Staff was lacking in friendliness (being from Texas, everyone's friendly). Lots of business travelers, as we were there mid-week. Next time we visit the Napa Valley we'll try another town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location Lacking”
Reviews.Author: cruisingbug
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the River Terrace Inn in July for $129 on the Internet for a village standard (parking lot view) - but a really good deal from what we'd seen of Napa and the Napa Valley. If you're not going to leave the hotel much, then this is a great place to stay. What we didn't realize is that the town of Napa is at the far southern end of the wine trailis and isn't very picturesque (try Sonoma for that). Neither is the Napa River along which the hotel sits. Luckily it does sit back from the busy road. Next time in Wine Country we would stay in St. Helena. I'm sure it's more expensive, but it seemed the most centrally-located to the wineries and more fitting my idea of what Wine Country would be like. The hotel itself was the nicest we stayed in of the five on this trip. High bed, CD/DVD player, free high speed Internet, nice bathroom with high-end toiletries, free use of robes, coffee maker, pool, excellent continental breakfast. There is a restaurant on-site, but the menu was limited, and there was only deck seating.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel, but we wouldn't recommend it. The room had some nice appointments, such as granite countertop in the bath, a step in shower, and very comfortable bed. The breakfast was hit or miss - sometimes it was well stocked, but sometimes we found it to be very sparse. The primary reason that we would not recommend this hotel is that the HVAC unit was very, very, very loud and woke us up every time it cycled on. It seemed that there are better locations to stay withn the Napa Valley - such as Yountville, which seemed much more quaint, safe and clean in comparison to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very nice 4-night stay recently at this newly opened hotel. Seeing their website, we knew it was not going to be a small, charming inn. But it was nicely decorated and very comfortable. Their introductory rates were good and I always like having breakfast included. I'm not a waffle and pancake person so it was just fine. And the outside terrace was very pleasant. Spacious river view room (village rooms face the parking lot out front), king bed, sofa, desk and chairs and large, beautiful bathroom with lovely waffle robes. You can walk to Copia, well worth a visit. Have lunch on their beautiful terrace. There is a free trolley that runs around the town of Napa, it has a stop at hotel as well as Copia, if you are so inclined. Ditto the other reviewers about driving on Silverado Trail. Napa is just at the beginning of the valley, so you are going to be driving a bit more to see towns and wineries farther north in the valley. Fabulous restaurants all around!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with a very helpful staff! They even provide wireless laptops so you can check your e-mail. The continental breakfast was wonderful, with seating both inside and outside. Walking distance to the wine train.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a bed, what a bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a bed! This was definitely the MOST comfortable bed we have ever slept in. We are contemplating ordering the mattress, they provide the details in the room. The bathroom was very nice, and the shampoo and lotion they provide smells great. We had a village view king room. We faced the parking lot but did not care as we paid only $99! For the rest of our trip after we left the R.T.I. we wished we could return to this hotel. The continental breakfast was pretty good. My only issue is regarding the minibar. It is automatically sensored so if you even pick up an item, it is automatically charged to your room. My husband of course examined all four of the wine bottles before realizing this. The front desk removed the charges when I immediately called them about it. We will DEFINITELY be back! Next time we will upgrade to a river room!
